answer: You can reserve bike spaces via the SBB Mobile app on all trains within Switzerland if reservation is mandatory at the time of your journey.

question: How can I transport my folding bicycle on the train?
answer: Folding bicycles should be stowed as luggage items under the seat, in the luggage stowage/niches or in other suitable places where they do not hinder other passengers or occupy any bicycle spaces.  You do not need a reservation or a ticket for this.  No packing/bag is required.

question: Which bikes and vehicles cannot be transported on public transport?
answer: Vehicles with combustion engines (e.g. mopeds), triple tandem bikes, multi-seater horizontal bicycles, personal transporter (e.g. Segways) and electric mopeds.

question: I will be travelling in 1st class. Can I also reserve a space for my bicycle in a 1st class coach?
answer: The reservation system allocates spaces automatically. Unfortunately, it is not possible to choose between 1st and 2nd class when making the reservation.

question: Can I cancel my annual bike pass and have it refunded?
answer: If you have used the annual bike pass for no more than one month and would like to cancel it, you will receive 50% of the purchase price as a refund. If you have used the annual bike pass for two months, you can still get 25% of the purchase price back. Cancellation is not possible if you have used it for more than two months.

question: Can I change or cancel my bicycle reservation?
answer: No. Unfortunately, this is not possible at the moment.

question: Is the annual bike pass non-transferable?
answer: Yes, the annual bike pass is integrated onto a personal SwissPass and is therefore only valid for that person.

question: Do I have to make a reservation for children’s bicycles?
answer: No reservation is necessary for bicycles, balance bikes and scooters belonging to children below 6 years old. A reservation is required for bicycles belonging to children between the ages of 6 and 16.                                               For more information, see the question: “Do I need tickets for children’s bicycles?”

question: Is it possible to rebook or cancel reservations which have already been made using the SBB Mobile app?
answer: No. Unfortunately, this is not possible at the moment.

question: Can groups of 10 or more people load their bicycles themselves?
answer: No, we cannot offer self-service loading of bicycles for groups of 10 or more people.                                             More about self-service loading of bicycles for groups

question: For reservations for more than one person, are all the seats always next to each other?
answer: Yes. However, if there are not enough seats next to each other available, you will get a message asking you to split up the reservation. Even if the seat numbers are not always consecutive, the seats will still be in the same compartment.

question: Can seat reservations be refunded?
answer: Generally no. Seat reservations cannot be refunded or exchanged. Special conditions apply to trains subject to a surcharge. There is an exception if the rolling stock used for the train changes at short notice and your reservations are made invalid. Ask the train crew to provide you with written confirmation. You can obtain a refund of the CHF 5 at the ticket counter or you can exchange it for a promotional code online (to be used for any service when making your next online or mobile booking).

question: How much does it cost to reserve a seat?
answer: The reservation fee for seats is CHF 5 per person. For connections involving changes, the reservation on the connecting train is free of charge. For trains subject to a surcharge (e.g. the Glacier Express), the reservation fee is included in the surcharge.

question: I already have a Eurail Pass. Where can I make a seat reservation?
answer: Online: at eurail.comLink opens in new window.. By telephone: via the SBB Contact Center on 0848 44 66 88 (CHF 0.08/min.). In person: at any public transport point of sale.

question: Which trains to Europe require a seat reservation?
answer: When reserving seats for train journeys to Europe, different prices and provisions apply according to the country.                                             Go to the country overview for seat reservations

question: I already have an Interrail Pass. Where can I make a seat reservation?
answer: Online: at interrail.euLink opens in new window.. By telephone: via the SBB Contact Center on 0848 44 66 88 (CHF 0.08/min.). In person: at any public transport point of sale.

question: Which trains within Switzerland can I reserve seats for?
answer: Trains for which you can reserve seats are marked with an R (meaning a reservation is possible) or an R in a rectangular frame (meaning a reservation is compulsory) in the timetable.  For seat reservation for touristic trains such as the Gotthard Panorama Express, the Bernina Express or the Glacier Express etc. please contact a public transport point of sale.

question: Can I reserve seats in the family coach?
answer: Yes. Please visit a staffed public transport point of sale or contact the SBB Contact Center on 0848 44 66 88 (CHF 0.08/min.).

question: How do I reserve seats for a group of 10 or more people?
answer: There are special rules for groups of 10 or more people.                                              Go to information and seat reservations for groups of 10 or more people

question: Can I exchange a seat reservation for a journey to Europe that I booked online for one at another time / on another date?
answer: In some cases it is possible to exchange your seat reservation before the departure of the train and in accordance with the conditions that you were informed of during booking. Not all products and services can be exchanged. Please refer to the supplementary travel details you received when you made your online purchase on SBB.ch. If you have any questions, please contact the SBB Contact Center on 0848 44 66 88 (CHF 0.08/min.) or go to a public transport point of sale.

question: Who can I buy tickets to Europe online for?
answer: International tickets for Europe are available online for passengers aged 16 or over. You can buy tickets online for yourself as well as for people who are travelling together with you (e.g. children of any age, other adults etc.). International tickets for children and young people aged under 16 travelling alone are not available online. These tickets can only be purchased at ticket counters or by calling the SBB Contact Center (0848 44 66 88 (CHF 0.08/min.).

question: What conditions apply to tickets to Europe for exchanges and refunds?
answer: You can see the conditions and validity for offers before you confirm the booking. Please make sure you check them before you make the purchase.  In many cases, tickets are only valid on the train that you have booked. There are certain offers (mostly saver offers) that cannot be exchanged or refunded – not even in exceptional cases. These conditions are set by the respective railway companies and cannot be changed by SBB.  For this reason, we always recommend that you take out cancellation costs insurance. It is best to purchase this insurance the same day as you purchase your ticket – either separately online as an additional service or at a staffed ticket counter. The insurance can be purchased for a single journey or as an annual policy. Buy Ticket Insurance Europe or annual travel insuranceLink opens in new window. Fare regulations and conditions for travel to Europe

question: The train I booked has been impacted by a strike or a suspension of service on the line. What do I need to do?
answer: If a train is cancelled due to a strike, the ticket can usually be refunded or rebooked for a train running on the same day free of charge (up to a maximum of one month after the date of travel). Please contact the office that issued your ticket to request a refund. In the event of a suspension of service on the line, please enquire as to whether your train is being rerouted, whether your ticket is valid on another connection and whether it is possible to get a free refund. Any potential free refund is only available from the office that issued your ticket.

answer: For travel to the following countries, you can buy tickets for certain routes online at SBB.ch. question: How far in advance can I book journeys abroad?
answer: Booking will become available at varying times depending on the country in question. In some cases, you can book up to 6 months in advance. Please note that bookings are severely restricted in the period before the timetable change (in mid-December and also in June for some countries) and are sometimes only possible a few weeks in advance.  The booking periods for the most relevant countries:  Germany: 180 days Austria: 180 day (92 days for some trains) Italy: 180 days France: 120 days or 180 days (TGV/ICE France–Germany).

question: I would like to travel flexibly through Europe. What options does Interrail offer?
answer: Interrail offers Interrail Passes for both individual and multiple European countries.                                             More information on Interrail products

answer: For travel to the countries listed below, you can buy tickets on SBB.ch. Depending on the journey destinations and duration, Interrail Passes are a practical and inexpensive alternative. question: I would like to take my bike with me on a train to another country. Is this possible?
answer: You can find international connections that permit you to take your bike on the train (excluding Italy) by visiting the route planer (hafas.bene-system.com) and selecting the number of bicycles from the drop-down menu ‘carriage of Bicycles required’.                                             Go to the route planner                         Link opens in new window.                                       In France, bicycles and trailers can be transported free of charge on regional trains, provided there is enough space. Tandem bicycles can only be transported in trains with luggage vans.                                             More information on taking your bike with you in France                          Link opens in new window.                                                                                   Help with bike tickets and reservations for Europe

question: How can I find out about any changes to the journey I have booked?
answer: We recommend you check the timetable a few days before the journey you have booked or want to make so you can see whether there are any timetable adjustments. Tip: search the timetable on SBB Mobile and save the connection you have chosen (“Add to My Trips”). You will therefore be automatically notified if there are any changes.                                             More information on saving your connection

question: Can I have my luggage sent abroad?
answer: Please contact Swiss Post to have your luggage transported from Switzerland to Germany or Austria.                                             More information on luggage dispatch at post.ch/en                          Link opens in new window.                                       The following shipping options are available for transporting luggage from Germany to Switzerland.                                             More information on luggage dispatch with DHL                          Link opens in new window.

question: How can I reserve a seat on international journeys?
answer: There will be an option to reserve seats directly in the purchasing process. It is compulsory to have a seat reservation for some trains/countries and this may already be included in the price of a ticket. Please pay attention to the information about this in the timetable. Have you already purchased a ticket and want to reserve a seat for your journey? Please visit a staffed public transport point of sale or contact the SBB Contact Center on 0848 44 66 88 (CHF 0.08/min.).

question: I experienced a major delay on my international journey. Can I receive compensation for this?
answer: You can receive 25% of the transport price as a refund if the delay was 60 minutes or more. You can be refunded 50% of the transport price for a delay of 120 minutes or more.                                             More information on compensation

question: How can I present an international ticket that I have purchased on SBB.ch when on the train?
answer: The following options are available for presenting international tickets on the train:  Printed on white A4 paper (print@homeLink opens in new window.). Displayed as a screen ticket/PDF on a mobile device.  Please note that an internet connection is required on the train in order to display your ticket as a screen ticket/open the PDF. To be on the safe side, we recommend that you save the PDF from the confirmation email to your device before you travel.

question: I can no longer make my journey abroad and would like to have my ticket refunded or exchanged. What can I do?
answer: You will be shown or informed of the exchange and refund conditions when making the purchase. Refunds are generally only possible up until one day before departure. The deductible shown at the time of purchase will be applied (this can be as high as 100% depending on the train or offer).  If necessary, contact your cancellation insurance provider to have the costs covered for insured reasons. A tip for your next trip: purchase your cancellation costs insurance the same day as your ticket – either separately online as an additional service or at a staffed ticket counter.                                             Buy Ticket Insurance Europe or annual travel insurance                         Link opens in new window.                                       For a small number of offers, a partial refund is possible even after a train has departed if a passenger has confirmation of non-use – but usually only up until one month after the travel date at the latest. Please note that the person who was supposed to travel must provide the confirmation of non-use.  Please contact the office that issued your ticket to get a refund. You must have the original ticket to do this. For international tickets purchased online at SBB.ch, please go to a public transport point of sale or call the SBB Contact Center on 0848 44 66 88 (CHF 0.08/min.).                                             Fare regulations and conditions for travel to Europe

question: What is a group journey in Switzerland?
answer: In Switzerland, 10 or more people can travel as a group. Groups benefit from discounted fares. To calculate the price, we take certain travelcards and the age of the people travelling into account. Group journeys must be booked in advance. For the journey, you will need a group ticket. It includes a free seat reservation.

question: Can I amend or cancel a group journey?
answer: If your group journey cannot take place as planned, let us know that you wish to amend or cancel your journey no later than 11am the day before travel. Please observe the special provisions for partner offers, including RailAway. Unfortunately, if you inform us later than this, we cannot guarantee that we will be able to make the changes. Please note, that a fee of CHF 10 is charged for cancellation of unused group tickets. These provisions apply to group tickets for travel within Switzerland. Special provisions apply to group journeys to other European countries.

question: How long is my group ticket valid for?
answer: Group tickets for single journeys are valid for 10 days. Group tickets for return journeys are valid for 1 month. When you buy tickets online, the validity date is fixed when you make the purchase.

question: Do people with GA or Half Fare Travelcards or day passes count as part of the group?
answer: Passengers with the following tickets are counted as part of the group and benefit from group discount:  Adults without discount (30% discount on the full fare). Adults with Half Fare Travelcards (30% discount on the half-fare price). Passengers with GA (travel for free). Passengers with Regional, Point-to-Point or Modular Travelcards (the entire route must be included; they then travel for free) (counts as a GA Travelcard). Children and young persons aged at least 6 and under 25 (30% discount on the half-fare price). Children under 6 (travel for free). Dogs (30% discount on the half fare price).  Passengers with the following tickets are not counted as part of the group (they travel with the group for free, but their details have to be entered for the obligatory seat reservation):  Adults, children and dogs with a day pass (including Leisure Travelcard). Young people with a GA Night Travelcard (for journeys after 7pm). Accompanied children with Junior Travelcard or Children's Co-Travelcard. Companions of passengers with a Disabled Passenger’s ID card.

question: Are group reservations on trains always labelled?
answer: No, there is not always a label on the train. For group journeys on Regio-Express, regional and S-Bahn trains, the seating the group needs is provided but no physical reservation label is provided on the train. On long-distance trains travelling before 6 am and after 8 pm, reservation labels are also not provided.

question: Do I need to book a group journey in advance and, if so, how far in advance?
answer: Group journeys must be booked in advance.  If you buy group tickets at a staffed public transport point of sale, by telephone from the SBB Contact Center or online, we ask you to register your journey at least two working days before the start of travel. (E.g. if you travel on Sunday, the request must reach us by Wednesday evening at the latest).  You cannot book in writing or reserve by contact form, e-mail or letter.                                              Buy group tickets online

question: Are there luggage offers for groups?
answer: We provide the following luggage offers for group journeys in Switzerland:                                             Go to group luggage offers for Switzerland

question: What level of discount is available with a group ticket?
answer: With a group ticket, you benefit from a 30% discount on your journey by public transport.

question: Can I change the number of passengers in the group?
answer: You can change the number of passengers up to 30 minutes before starting your journey free of charge at a staffed public transport point of sale. If you make a change later, we will charge an excess of CHF 10 for each refund request made if the group becomes smaller.  If a change is made, you should always ask train staff to confirm how many passenger actually make the journey in each direction. Do the same if you use additional services from third parties at your destination. If necessary, apply for a refund after your journey.

question: What information will the booking office need to book an international group journey?
answer: To ensure we can provide you with a suitable offer, we need:  the complete itinerary with departure dates and times,  the number of travellers, and any travelcards for reduced fares (both for Switzerland and abroad). For travel to Italy, for travel on night trains and for travel on regional trains in France the list of participants with last names, first names and dates of birth is required.  You can also indicate whether you would like to take out an insurance policy to protect your group against unforeseen events before and during the trip. If you wish to take out travel insurance, we need to know the number of people you wish to insure as well as the surname, first name, address and date of birth.

question: Where and how can I book an international group journey?
answer: Tickets and reservations for group travel abroad can be requested using the online form. We will determine the best prices for the group journey for you and provide you with a non-binding offer.                                             Go to booking request for international group journeys for private groups, schools, youth groups and clubs                                                                Please note that requests for international group travel can no longer be processed directly at SBB Travel Centres, over the phone with the SBB Contact Center or via e-mail. Instead, your details will be recorded in the form and then processed by our specialists. Our staff will be happy to help you fill in the form.

question: How many participants do I need to get the group discount for an international journey?
answer: 10 is the minimum number of travellers for group travel abroad. For smaller group journeys (between six and nine people), purchase tickets for individual passengers at SBB.ch or your local point of sale. You can buy tickets for a maximum of five to nine passengers per request, depending on the country. You may need to split up the booking.

question: Some of the passengers in our group are wheelchair users. Can they travel together with us?
answer: Yes, you have to tell us when ordering your group journey so that a suitable coach can be reserved for you. At the same time, notify the SBB Contact Center Handicap about your journey. Groups that include more than one wheelchair user can only be carried subject to certain conditions. The double-deck trains operated by Long-Distance Services allow groups to travel together (maximum ten people in wheelchairs). On board all other trains, groups may only be able to travel in different compartments or split across several trains, depending on the size of the group.                                             Go to SBB Contact Center Handicap

question: Can groups make use of self-service loading of bicycles?
answer: No. Self-service loading of bicycles is not available for groups. Find out about the other options available to you.                                             Further information about transporting bicycles

question: Which requests for international group travel are processed by SBB?
answer: We will be happy to process your request as long as the group journey starts in Switzerland and the passengers’ and the trip organiser’s country of residence is Switzerland. We cannot process requests from groups residing abroad nor for connections that do not pass through Switzerland.  In such cases, please contact the railway company in your country of residence or in the country where you will start your group journey.

question: How do I buy group tickets including seat reservations?
answer: The easiest and most convenient way to calculate and/or book your group journey is online from the comfort of your home – avoid having to rush or queue. Ideally you should name one person as group leader for your group journey. This person books the journey and group tickets required (including the reservation). So that we can calculate the price correctly, we need to know the age of the passengers you are travelling with and how many hold a GA or a Half Fare Travelcard. If travellers in the group hold a Modular or Point-to-Point Travelcard covering the whole route, enter these people under ‘GA Travelcard’. If you wish to buy group tickets (including the reservation) online, you / the group leader will need a SwissPass login.  You can also reserve group journeys and buy group tickets at staffed public transport points of sale or by calling the SBB Contact Center on 0848 44 66 88 (CHF 0.08/min.).                                             Buy group tickets online

question: What group tickets are available?
answer: We offer single and return group tickets for 1st and 2nd class.

question: How soon before I travel can I book an international group journey?
answer: It’s best to book an international group journey as early as possible. International group ticket requests and bookings must be made at least 15 working days before the departure date. Travel to and via Germany is an exception, in which case bookings must be made at least 25 days in advance. To book group travel at shorter notice, please purchase tickets for individual passengers on SBB.ch or at your nearest point of sale. You can buy tickets for a maximum of five to nine passengers per request, depending on the country. You may need to split up the booking.

question: Can I calculate the fare for my group journey myself?
answer: Yes, you can calculate an indicative price. Here is our step-by-step guide for SBB.ch:  Enter your chosen route on SBB.ch and click on ‘search for connection’. You will be shown the connections. Choose one and click on it. Then click on the button ‘Tickets from CHF xx.xx’. If you are not registered, select ‘Purchase as a guest’. On the screen ‘Passengers’, enter a fictional name with the date of birth 01.01.1980 to see the price for adults. Select the discount card: no discount (= full price) or Half Fare Travelcard (choose also for children and young people under 25) and then click on ‘Accept’. Now the price is shown for the discount chosen. Pay attention to the class of travel (you can choose 1st or 2nd class) and change it if necessary. The 2nd class price is given by default. Note the price with and without discount. PLEASE NOTE: do not choose supersaver tickets or Day Passes if available – choose only normal fares! To get an indicative group price per person, multiply the half-fare price and/or the full price by 0.7 (× 0.7 = 30% discount) and round up to the next 20 cents (example: normal fare with Half Fare Travelcard: 29.50; indicative group price: 29.50 × 0.7 = 20.65; rounded up to the next 20 cents = 20.80). Important: to be able to travel at the discounted group fare, at least 10 people must travel together. Passengers with a GA Travelcard count as part of the group, but pay nothing.   No liability is taken for the accuracy of the information, rounding differences may occur. An example calculation. Your group travels from Zürich HB to Fribourg in 2nd class. roud up included, in CHF 29.50                                                       20.80                                                     0.–                                                                                                                                                                 Please note: school classes and Jugend+Sport groups have the option of buying a Day Pass for Schools for max. CHF 15 per day.                                             Go to the Day Pass for Schools

question: Do I need to reserve seats?
answer: Yes. Seat reservations are included in the price of the tickets and will be made where possible. When buying online, the reservation will be made automatically. Online reservations can only be made when you buy a group ticket at the same time.                                             Buy group tickets online

question: How can I buy group tickets including seat reservations for a school trip?
answer: You can book a school trip yourself online. Please note that you must place the booking at least 7 weekdays before the desired travel date. School trips at short notice (i.e. if the travel date is in fewer than 7 weekdays’ time) can only be booked at staffed public transport points of sale or by calling the SBB Contact Center on 0848 44 66 88 (CHF 0.08/min.).                                              Book school trips online

question: Can e-bikes be taken on trains to Europe using self-service loading?
answer: E-bikes with pedal assist up to 25km/h can generally be transported like normal bikes on all international railways. There are a few key points to note:  S-Pedelecs (e-bikes with a number plate) cannot be transported on journeys to Germany or Austria. In some countries, the battery cannot be charged during the journey and must be attached to the bike during rail transport. The transport of a spare battery is not permitted in many countries.  Before setting off on an e-bike trip abroad, it’s advisable to find out about the rules of the road in the country you are visiting as they can sometimes differ from those applicable in Switzerland.

question: What do I have to be aware of when planning a trip to Europe with my bike?
answer: SBB and the railways in the neighbouring countries provide international self-service loading of bicycles. In addition to a valid ticket for yourself and your bicycle, in most cases, you also need a bike space reservation for your journey. Bike tickets and reservations for international journeys with a bicycle can currently only be purchased from the rail company of the neighbouring country concerned. Go to «Where can I find more country-specific information about bicycle transport by rail?»  It’s also important to note:  Availability of bike transport on trains to Europe is limited or, in some cases, not available. A bike space reservation is generally required on international services. Please note that S-Pedelecs (e-bikes with a number plate) cannot be transported on journeys to Germany or Austria.                                              More on self-service loading of bikes on trains to Europe

question: Where can I buy the ticket and the reservation for an international journey with a bike?
answer: Tickets and reservations for international journeys with a bicycle can be purchased directly online from the rail company of the neighbouring country:  Germany: bahn.deLink opens in new window. Austria: oebb.atLink opens in new window. Italy: trenitalia.itLink opens in new window. France: sncf-connect.comLink opens in new window.  At the moment, you cannot buy tickets or reservations for international journeys with a bike from SBB.

question: How can I see if an international service carries bikes at all when checking the timetable?
answer: You can check the route you wish to travel. You can find international connections that permit you to take your bike on the train (excluding Italy) by visiting the route planer (hafas.bene-system.com) and selecting the number of bicycles from the drop-down menu ‘carriage of Bicycles required’.                                             Go to the route planner                         Link opens in new window.                                       In France, bicycles and trailers can be transported free of charge on regional trains, provided there is enough space. Tandem bicycles can only be transported in trains with luggage vans.                                             More information on taking your bike with you in France                         Link opens in new window.                                       Specific country and night train information is also available:  By telephone: from the SBB Contact Center 0848 44 66 88 (CHF 0.08/min.). In person: from all public transport points of sale.

question: Can I take my bike for free as hand luggage on all trains to Europe?
answer: SBB cannot guarantee that bikes in bags can also be transported on foreign trains. On night trains for example, bikes in bags cannot be carried unless information to the contrary is provided. Bikes may also not be stowed in spaces where they inconvenience other passengers and/or train crew. Bikes must not block passageways. Please note the special maximum dimensions for bike transport covers for the following countries (not a complete list):  TGV Lyria: max. length 130cm, max. width 90cm.  Italy: max. length 110cm, max. width 80cm, max. height 45cm.

question: Where can I find more country-specific information about bicycle transport by rail?
answer: The following links provide you with information from the rail operators on travelling with a bike in the respective countries:  Germany DBLink opens in new window.  Austria ÖBBLink opens in new window. Italy TrenitaliaLink opens in new window. France SNCFLink opens in new window. Belgium SNCBLink opens in new window. Croatia HZPPLink opens in new window. Denmark DSBLink opens in new window. Hungary MAVLink opens in new window. Luxembourg CFLLink opens in new window. The Netherlands NSLink opens in new window. Norway VyLink opens in new window. Poland PKP IntercityLink opens in new window. Czech Republic CDLink opens in new window. Serbia Srbija VozLink opens in new window. Slovakia ZSSKLink opens in new window. Slovenia SZLink opens in new window. Spain RenfeLink opens in new window. Sweden SJLink opens in new window.

question: How do I reserve seats for a group of 10 or more people?
answer: There are special rules for groups of 10 or more people.                                              Go to information and seat reservations for groups of 10 or more people

question: Which trains within Switzerland can I reserve seats for?
answer: Trains for which you can reserve seats are marked with an R (meaning a reservation is possible) or an R in a rectangular frame (meaning a reservation is compulsory) in the timetable.  For seat reservation for touristic trains such as the Gotthard Panorama Express, the Bernina Express or the Glacier Express etc. please contact a public transport point of sale.

question: I already have a Eurail Pass. Where can I make a seat reservation?
answer: Online: at eurail.comLink opens in new window.. By telephone: via the SBB Contact Center on 0848 44 66 88 (CHF 0.08/min.). In person: at any public transport point of sale.

question: Can I exchange a seat reservation for a journey to Europe that I booked online for one at another time / on another date?
answer: In some cases it is possible to exchange your seat reservation before the departure of the train and in accordance with the conditions that you were informed of during booking. Not all products and services can be exchanged. Please refer to the supplementary travel details you received when you made your online purchase on SBB.ch. If you have any questions, please contact the SBB Contact Center on 0848 44 66 88 (CHF 0.08/min.) or go to a public transport point of sale.

question: Can seat reservations be refunded?
answer: Generally no. Seat reservations cannot be refunded or exchanged. Special conditions apply to trains subject to a surcharge. There is an exception if the rolling stock used for the train changes at short notice and your reservations are made invalid. Ask the train crew to provide you with written confirmation. You can obtain a refund of the CHF 5 at the ticket counter or you can exchange it for a promotional code online (to be used for any service when making your next online or mobile booking).

question: Can I reserve seats in the family coach?
answer: Yes. Please visit a staffed public transport point of sale or contact the SBB Contact Center on 0848 44 66 88 (CHF 0.08/min.).

question: I already have an Interrail Pass. Where can I make a seat reservation?
answer: Online: at interrail.euLink opens in new window.. By telephone: via the SBB Contact Center on 0848 44 66 88 (CHF 0.08/min.). In person: at any public transport point of sale.

question: For reservations for more than one person, are all the seats always next to each other?
answer: Yes. However, if there are not enough seats next to each other available, you will get a message asking you to split up the reservation. Even if the seat numbers are not always consecutive, the seats will still be in the same compartment.

question: How much does it cost to reserve a seat?
answer: The reservation fee for seats is CHF 5 per person. For connections involving changes, the reservation on the connecting train is free of charge. For trains subject to a surcharge (e.g. the Glacier Express), the reservation fee is included in the surcharge.

question: Which trains to Europe require a seat reservation?
answer: When reserving seats for train journeys to Europe, different prices and provisions apply according to the country.                                             Go to the country overview for seat reservations

question: How can I cancel my GA Travelcard subject to monthly payment?
answer: To the GA cancellation

question: Which documents do I need to purchase a GA Travelcard for Disabled Persons for the first time?
answer: Order form sent by post. To purchase your travelcard for the first time using the order form, you will need the following documents:  a recent, high-quality passport photo. a copy of the passport or ID for both the travelcard user and the contracting party (for example, if you are purchasing a GA Travelcard for your child or for another person). a copy of a valid IV (disability insurance) ID for the travelcard user.  or a medical certificate if you are dependent on a wheelchair at all times to use public transport.  You will also need a copy of the valid IV (disability insurance) ID or a new medical certificate for any further purchases at a later date. Purchasing at a public transport point of sale. To purchase for the first time at a public transport point of sale, you need a recent analogue or digital passport photo and the passport/ID card for yourself or the other person (for example, if you are purchasing a GA Travelcard for your child as a parent or for another person).

question: Where is my GA Travelcard valid?
answer: On all SBB trains and those of most other railways in Switzerland, as well as on boats, buses, trams and some mountain lifts and railways. Find more detailed information on the GA Travelcard area of validity map.                                             Go to the GA Travelcard area of validity map

question: Is the GA Travelcard valid on boats?
answer: Yes, you can travel free of charge by boat on most large lakes in Switzerland with your GA Travelcard. Boat trips on the following lakes are excluded:  Greifensee (GA Travelcard only partially accepted – discount). Lake Lugano (GA Travelcard only partially accepted – discount). Beckenried–Gersau ferry (no discount with GA Travelcard). Lac de Joux (no discount with GA Travelcard). Lac des Brenets (no discount with GA Travelcard). Lago di Poschiavo (no discount with GA Travelcard). Silsersee (no discount with GA Travelcard). Walensee (no discount with GA Travelcard).

question: Which documents do I need to purchase a GA Travelcard Familia for Children, a GA Travelcard Familia for Youth or a GA Travelcard Familia for Adults?
answer: You will need a recent analogue or digital passport photo. You can find a list of all the other required documents on the SwissPass website.                                             Go to the list of required documents                         Link opens in new window.

question: How can I buy a GA Travelcard?
answer: First-time purchase online for GA Travelcard for Adults, GA Travelcard for Children, GA Travelcard for Youth, GA Travelcard for 25 Year Olds, GA Travelcard for Seniors. When purchasing online, the most important thing is your customer number in the format 000-000-000-0. If you have or had a SwissPass or a public transport travelcard in the last five years, you can find this number on your SwissPass card and use it to purchase your GA Travelcard online. If you used to have a travelcard but have forgotten the customer number, you can find out what it is by going to a public transport point of sale or phoning the SBB Contact Center on 0848 44 66 88 (CHF 0.08/min.). To purchase a GA Travelcard for another person online, they also need to have a customer number. First-time purchasing online with an identity check. If you don’t have a travelcard or a SwissPass, you can still buy your new GA Travelcard online. If you are buying a travelcard for the first time, we need to verify your identity. This identity check takes place online – you will need your passport or ID card and a smartphone with a camera. You will also need a recent, high-quality, digital passport photo. Online purchase with an identity check is not possible for other persons                                             Questions on the identity check                         Link opens in new window.                                       First-time purchase via (online) order form for GA Travelcard for Disabled Persons. You can order a new GA Travelcard for Disabled Persons online using the PDF order form on SBB.ch. To do so, fill out the PDF form on your computer, print it out and send it to us at the address given on the order form, together with the photo and the required documents. Alternatively, you can print the form out first, fill it out by hand and then send it to us.  First-time purchase via (online) order form for GA Travelcard for Duos, GA Travelcard Familia for Children, GA Travelcard Familia for Youth, GA Travelcard Familia for Adults. To be entitled to purchase any of the GA Travelcards mentioned above, a family member must hold a basic GA Travelcard (GA Travelcard for Adults, GA Travelcard for Youth, GA Travelcard for 25 YearOolds, GA Travelcard for Seniors or GA Travelcard for Disabled Persons).  You can order any of these GA Travelcards on SBB.ch using the PDF order form. To do so, fill out the PDF form on your computer and print it out. Alternatively, you can print the form out first and then fill it out by hand. Please send the completed order form, an original passport photo and all the documents required for the relevant Familia GA Travelcard or GA Travelcard for Duos to the address given on the order form. Purchasing at a staffed public transport point of sale. Of course, you can also order all GA Travelcards at a staffed public transport point of sale. Please bring your SwissPass (if you have one), the completed order form, a recent analogue or digital passport photo(s) and all the documents required for the relevant GA Travelcard(s). PDF order form (to fill out on your computer or by hand) (PDF, 1,3 MB)Link opens in new window. (PDF, 1,3 MB)

question: How long does it take to receive my GA Travelcard on the SwissPass?
answer: Already have a SwissPass? Your GA Travelcard will be valid on the SwissPass from its first day of validity.  This is your first SwissPass? Your GA Travelcard on the SwissPass will be delivered by post within around ten days. If you would like your new GA Travelcard to be valid earlier, we can provide a temporary SwissPass. If you order online, you can print it out as a PDF. If you order using the order form, bring all your documents with you to the counter and you will receive it there.

question: What happens to my existing travelcards if I switch to the GA Travelcard?
answer: If you choose a GA Travelcard, you will receive a pro-rata refund for travelcards that you no longer need, such as the Half Fare, regional, Point-to-point or Modular Travelcard or Night GA Travelcard as well as one 1-month GA Travelcard. Take your SwissPass on which reference is made to your current travelcard to a staffed public transport point of sale and you will receive a credit.

question: Can I also travel in 1st class with my 2nd class GA Travelcard?
answer: Yes, if you purchase a class upgrade. With your 2nd class GA Travelcard and a class upgrade at a discounted rate, you can travel in even greater comfort in 1st class. Class upgrades are available for individual routes, for a day or a month. You can upgrade your 2nd class GA Travelcard to a 1st class GA Travelcard at any time. Tip: Look out for the Saver Class Upgrade: benefit from a reduction of up to 70% when upgrading from 2nd to 1st class on many Swiss public transport lines.                                             More information on upgrading

question: Can I suspend my GA Travelcard if I do not need it?
answer: Yes. If you don’t need your GA Travelcard for a certain period, you can deposit it at the counter during the validity period of your travelcard, for a minimum of five consecutive days and a maximum of 30 days per travelcard year.                                             More information on depositing your travelcard

question: I am on the move and I have forgotten my GA Travelcard on the SwissPass – what happens now?
answer: If you’ve left your SwissPass at home or at the office, you can display it easily in the SBB Mobile app in the Tickets & SwissPass tile (you must have a login with a linked customer number to do so). Alternatively, for a fee of CHF 5 we can issue you with a temporary card, available at any ticket counter, upon presentation of official ID.

question: How can I cancel my GA Travelcard subject to annual payment?
answer: To the GA cancellation

question: Is the GA Travelcard valid for the Klewenalp?
answer: Yes, the journey to the Klewenalp is included in the GA Travelcard area of validity.

question: Which documents do I need to purchase a GA Travelcard for Duos?
answer: You will need a recent analogue or digital passport photo. You can find a list of all the other required documents on the SwissPass website.                                             Go to the list of required documents                         Link opens in new window.

question: Is the GA Travelcard valid for the Stanserhorn?
answer: Yes, the journey to the Stanserhorn is included in the GA Travelcard area of validity.

question: Is the GA Travelcard valid for travel to Constance?
answer: Yes, the GA Travelcard is valid up to Constance.

question: What do I need to consider when taking my photo?
answer: Requirements. For the travelcard on the SwissPass, you need to provide a recent analogue or digital passport photo which fulfils the following criteria:  Taken from the front. Eyes open and not covered. Plain background. Even lighting (no shadows). Clear with high contrast. Black and white or colour. Approx. size 35mm × 45mm. Analogue passport photo: only original prints, no scans or photos printed out on paper. Digital passport photo: unedited, min. image size 200 × 250 pixels; in .JPG or .JPEG format with a maximum size of 4MB.  Purchasing a GA Travelcard online for the first time. If you already have a SwissPass or used to have another public transport travelcard, we will use the same photo for your new travelcard. In this case, adults will only need to provide a new photo if the previous one was taken more than ten years ago. Children and young people under 25 will only have to do so if their previous photo was taken more than five years ago. First-time purchasing online with an identity check. If you are purchasing a GA Travelcard for the first time, do not already have a SwissPass and have not previously had a travelcard, you can upload your digital passport photo once the purchasing process (including the identity check) is complete.  Purchasing for the first time via the order form. You will need to submit an original, high resolution passport photo taken recently. Your photo will be stored electronically for a maximum of ten years (or five years for children and young people under 25).  Please write your first name and surname in block capitals on the back of the photo. Please attach the photo to the order form in the space indicated.  Purchasing the travelcard for the first time at a staffed point of sale. Please bring a recent analogue or digital passport photo to the counter. Changing your photo. If you would like to update your photo before the 5/10 year period has elapsed, please bring a recent analogue or digital passport photo to a public transport point of sale. You can then get a new SwissPass card with the new photo for a fee of CHF 30.

question: How can I pay for a new GA Travelcard?
answer: Purchasing online. When purchasing online, you can pay by credit card, PostFinance Card, Reka Card or Twint. (Online) order form.  When purchasing using the order form, you have the choice of paying by credit card or invoice. At a staffed public transport point of sale. When purchasing at a staffed point of sale, the following payment methods are available to you: cash, vouchers, Reka Check, Reka Rail, Twint, debit or credit card (PostFinance Card, Mastercard, Visa, Reka Card, American Express, Diners, JCB or myOne). Payment by credit card (please keep in mind the limit on your card). You can pay for your new travelcard with the following credit cards:  Visa (incl. prepaid cards) MasterCard (incl. prepaid cards) American Express Diners Club International JCB MyOne  Please note:  The credit card must be in the same name as the contracting party. The credit card will be charged once the order has been received.  Payment by PostFinance Card (please keep in mind the limit on your card).  Payment with Twint (please keep in mind your limit/credit).  Payment by invoice.  We will send you the invoice together with a payment slip in the post. Please note:  Your order must be placed at least ten days before your travelcard validity begins. Otherwise your payment by invoice cannot be processed and will be returned. We will send you the invoice separately – i.e. not together with your SwissPass card. You must pay the invoice before the first day that your travelcard is valid, otherwise you will receive a payment reminder.  Other payment options at our points of sale.  At a point of sale, you can pay using a Maestro card, PostFinance Card, any of the credit cards listed above, Reka Checks, Reka Card, Twint, voucher or cash.

question: How can I cancel my GA Travelcard and what do I need to be aware of?
answer: You can find all the questions and answers about cancelling your GA Travelcard on the cancellation help page.                                             Go to GA Travelcard cancellation

question: Can I travel to Domodossola with the GA Travelcard?
answer: Yes, you can travel for free with the GA Travelcard both on the route to Domodossola through the Simplon Tunnel via Brig and to Domodossola from Locarno through the Centovalli. For travel on a panorama train from Locarno, you have to pay a surcharge of 2-3 euros. Trains that are subject to a surcharge are marked in the timetable with ‘Z’.

question: Which documents do I need to purchase a GA Travelcard for Children, GA Travelcard for Youth, GA Travelcard for 25 Year Olds, GA Travelcard for Adults and GA Travelcard for Seniors for the first time?
answer: Purchasing online with a SwissPass. If you already have a SwissPass, you will need the following documents to purchase your GA Travelcard for the first time online.  Debit or credit card (PostFinance Card, Mastercard, Visa, Reka Card, American Express, Diners, JCB or myOne), Twint. (The credit card must be in the same name as the contracting party.) Passport or ID card for the travelcard user and for the contracting party (for example, if you are purchasing a GA Travelcard for your child as a parent or for another person).  When buying online, you can enter details for the following types of ID: passports and ID cards issued in Switzerland, Germany, Austria, France, Italy or Liechtenstein.   Purchasing online with an identity check.  When purchasing with the identity check, you can only buy a GA Travelcard for yourself. You will need:  a smartphone with a camera. a debit or credit card (PostFinance Card, Mastercard, Visa, Reka Card, American Express, Diners, JCB or myOne), Twint. a recent, high-quality, digital passport photo. a passport or ID card.  List of the accepted forms of IDLink opens in new window. Questions on the identity checkLink opens in new window.                                             Order form sent by post. To purchase your travelcard for the first time using the order form, you will need the following documents:  a recent, high-quality passport photo.  a copy of the passport or ID for both the travelcard user and the contracting party (for example, if you are purchasing a GA Travelcard for your child as a parent or for another person).  Purchasing at a public transport point of sale. To purchase for the first time at a public transport point of sale, you need a recent analogue or digital passport photo and the passport/ID card for yourself or the other person (for example, if you are purchasing a GA Travelcard for your child as a parent or for another person).

question: How do I pay for my GA Travelcard renewal?
answer: You can find information about payment options for subsequent invoices on the SwissPass website.                                             Go to information on paying subsequent invoices                         Link opens in new window.

question: I have lost my GA Travelcard on the SwissPass – what should I do?
answer: Have you lost your SwissPass or has it been damaged? You can order a SwissPass replacement card for CHF 30 online at SBB.ch, via the SBB Contact Center or at a staffed public transport point of sale.                                             Order your SwissPass replacement card here

question: How much does the GA Travelcard cost?
answer: The price for a 2nd class GA Travelcard for Adults is CHF 3,860. Children, young persons and senior citizens benefit from a cheaper price. There is also a discount on the GA Travelcard for families, partners, 25 year olds and travellers with disabilities.                                             Go to summary of prices

question: Is the GA Travelcard also valid in Liechtenstein?
answer: Yes, the GA Travelcard is valid on the entire network of the Liechtensteinmobil (LIEmobil) transport company, as well as on the S-Bahn between Buchs SG and Nendeln.

question: Is the GA Travelcard valid for the Jungfraujoch?
answer: The journey up to the Jungfraujoch is not free with a GA Travelcard, but you do get a discounted price.

question: How can I renew my GA Travelcard?
answer: When buying a GA Travelcard you take out an indefinite contract. The advantage of this is that your travelcard is automatically renewed at the end of your chosen period of validity – 1 year or 1 month. Thanks to the SwissPass, you no longer have to think about renewing your travelcard yourself. Your SwissPass card is valid for five years and we automatically renew your travelcard on the same card.

question: On which mountain lifts/railways is the GA Travelcard valid?
answer: As a general principle, the GA Travelcard is valid on mountain lifts/railways that provide access to residential areas. For journeys on purely tourist-related mountain railways, such as those to the Jungfraujoch, Titlis and others, you pay either a reduced price with your GA Travelcard or the standard full price.

question: What do I need to consider when taking my photo?
answer: Requirements. For the travelcard on the SwissPass, you need to provide a recent analogue or digital passport photo which fulfils the following criteria:  Taken from the front. Eyes open and not covered. Plain background. Even lighting (no shadows). Clear with high contrast. Black and white or colour. Approx. size 35mm × 45mm. Analogue passport photo: only original prints, no scans or photos printed out on paper. Digital passport photo: unedited, min. image size 200 × 250 pixels; in .JPG or .JPEG format with a maximum size of 4MB.  Purchasing a 1-month GA Travelcard online for the first time. If you already have a SwissPass or used to have another public transport travelcard, we will use the same photo for your new travelcard. In this case, adults will only need to provide a new photo if the previous one was taken more than ten years ago. Children and young people under 25 will only have to do so if their previous photo was taken more than five years ago. First-time purchasing online with an identity check. If you are purchasing a 1-month GA Travelcard for the first time and do not yet have a SwissPass or travelcard, you can upload your digital passport photo once the purchasing process (including the identity check) is complete.  Changing your photo. If you would like to update your photo before the 5/10 year period has elapsed, please bring a recent analogue or digital passport photo to a public transport point of sale. You can then get a new SwissPass card with the new photo for a fee of CHF 30.

question: Where can I buy the 1-month GA Travelcard if I do not yet have a SwissPass?
answer: You can buy the 1-month GA Travelcard including SwissPass at any point of sale for public transport. Please take official ID and a recent analogue or digital passport photo with you. First-time purchasing online with an identity check. If you did not previously hold a SwissPass, you can still buy your new 1-month GA Travelcard online. If you are buying a travelcard for the first time, we need to verify your identity. This identity check takes place online – you will need your passport or ID card and a smartphone with a camera. You will also need a recent, high-quality, digital passport photo. Online purchase with an identity check is not possible for other persons.                                             Questions on the identity check                         Link opens in new window.                                       Delivery of your 1-month GA Travelcard on the SwissPass takes approx. ten days by post. If you would like your 1-month GA Travelcard to be valid sooner, we will issue you with a temporary SwissPass.                                              More information about the SwissPass

question: Do I need a Half Fare Travelcard to be able to buy the 1-month GA Travelcard?
answer: No, a Half Fare Travelcard is not required to purchase a 1-month GA Travelcard.

question: How can I pay for a new 1-month GA Travelcard?
answer: Purchasing online. When purchasing online, you can pay by credit card, PostFinance Card, Reka Card or Twint. Purchasing at a staffed public transport point of sale. When purchasing at a staffed point of sale, the following payment methods are available to you: cash, vouchers, Reka Check, Reka Rail, Twint, debit or credit card (PostFinance Card, Mastercard, Visa, Reka Card, American Express, Diners, JCB or myOne). Payment by credit card. You can pay for your new travelcard with the following credit cards:  Visa (incl. prepaid cards) MasterCard (incl. prepaid cards) American Express Diners Club International JCB MyOne  Please note:  The credit card must be in the same name as the contracting party. The credit card will be charged once the order has been received.  Payment by PostFinance Card and by Twint. Other payment options at our points of sale.  At a point of sale, you can pay using a Maestro card, PostFinance Card, any of the credit cards listed above, Reka Checks, Reka Card, Twint, voucher or cash.

question: What is the 1-month GA Travelcard?
answer: With the 1-month GA Travelcard, you can travel for one month without restriction on public transport throughout Switzerland, in the same way as with a GA Travelcard. The 1-month GA Travelcard is available for children and young people (under 25) and for adults (aged at least 25) in 1st and 2nd class. It is personal, non-transferable and valid for one month from the start date of your choice(?)Show note choiceChosen start date until -1 day in the following month (for example: 23 September 2021 until 22 October 2021).Close note.                                             Go to the 1-month GA Travelcard and prices

question: How long does it take to receive my 1-month GA Travelcard on the SwissPass?
answer: Already have a SwissPass? Your 1-month GA Travelcard will be valid on the SwissPass from its first day of validity.  This is your first SwissPass? Your 1-month GA Travelcard on the SwissPass will be delivered by post within around ten days. If you would like your new 1-month GA Travelcard to be valid earlier, we can provide a temporary SwissPass. If you order online, you can print it out as a PDF. If you order at a ticket counter, bring all your documents with you and you will receive it there.

question: Can I cancel or deposit my 1-month GA Travelcard?
answer: No. As a 1-month GA Travelcard is only valid for one month and does not renew automatically, you cannot deposit or cancel it.

question: Which documents do I need to purchase a 1-month GA Travelcard for the first time?
answer: Purchasing online with a SwissPass. If you already have a SwissPass, you will need the following documents to purchase your GA Travelcard for the first time online.  Debit or credit card (PostFinance Card, Mastercard, Visa, Reka Card, American Express, Diners, JCB or myOne), Twint. (The credit card must be in the same name as the contracting party.) Passport or ID card for the travelcard user and for the contracting party (for example, if you are purchasing a 1-month GA Travelcard for your child as a parent or for another person).  When buying online, you can enter details for the following types of ID: passports and ID cards issued in Switzerland, Germany, Austria, France, Italy or Liechtenstein.   Purchasing online with an identity check. When purchasing with the identity check, you can only buy a 1-month GA Travelcard for yourself. You will need:  a smartphone with a camera. a debit or credit card (PostFinance Card, Mastercard, Visa, Reka Card, American Express, Diners, JCB or myOne), Twint. a recent, high-quality, digital passport photo. a passport or ID card.  List of the accepted forms of IDLink opens in new window. Questions on the identity checkLink opens in new window. Purchasing at a public transport point of sale. To purchase for the first time at a public transport point of sale, you need a recent analogue or digital passport photo and the passport/ID card for yourself or the other person (for example, if you are purchasing a Point-to-Point Travelcard for your child as a parent or for another person).

question: Where is my 1-month GA Travelcard valid?
answer: The area of validity for the 1-month GA Travelcard corresponds to that of the GA Travelcard.                                             Go to the 1-month GA Travelcard area of validity

question: Where can I buy the 1-month GA Travelcard if I already have a SwissPass?
answer: If you have a SwissPass, you can buy the 1-month GA Travelcard online or at a staffed point of sale for public transport. To make sure you receive the right offer for adults or young people when purchasing online, please enter the relevant customer number. You will find the customer number on the SwissPass in the format 000-000-000-0.                                             Buy 1-month GA Travelcard online

question: How can I renew my 1-month GA Travelcard?
answer: Since the 1-month GA Travelcard is not automatically renewed, you need to purchase a new travelcard if you want to travel for another month with your GA Travelcard. You can do this very easily online. Alternatively, you can buy your 1-month GA Travelcard at any SBB ticket machine or at a staffed point of sale. Before your current 1-month GA Travelcard expires, we will inform you about how you can renew it. To make sure you receive the right offer for adults or children and young people when purchasing online, please enter the relevant customer number. You will find the customer number on the SwissPass in the format 000-000-000-0.                                             Buy 1-month GA Travelcard online

question: Does the 1-month GA Travelcard renew automatically?
answer: No, the 1-month GA Travelcard does not renew automatically. Register at swisspass.ch and we will remind you in good time by e-mail or text message of the last day of validity for your card.                                             Register on swisspass.ch                         Link opens in new window.

question: How do I buy a Night GA Travelcard?
answer: First-time purchase online.  When purchasing online, the most important thing is your customer number in the format 000-000-000-0. If you have or had a SwissPass or a public transport travelcard in the last five years, you can find this number on your SwissPass card and use it to purchase your Night GA Travelcard online. If you used to have a travelcard but have forgotten the customer number, you can find out what it is by going to a public transport point of sale or phoning the SBB Contact Center on 0848 44 66 88 (CHF 0.08/min.). First-time purchasing online with an identity check. If you do not yet hold a travelcard or a SwissPass, you can still buy your new Night GA Travelcard online. If you are buying a travelcard for the first time, we need to verify your identity. This identity check takes place online – you will need your passport or ID card and a smartphone with a camera. You will also need a recent, high-quality, digital passport photo. Online purchase with an identity check is not possible for other persons.                                             Questions on the identity check                         Link opens in new window.                                       You may also want to know: if you wish to buy the Night GA Travelcard for your children, you can do so, as long as you and your child hold SwissPass cards with a linked SwissPass login. To buy for your child, select Purchase a travelcard for another person during the purchasing process. Buy Night GA Travelcard online Note: a SwissPass login is linked with SBB.ch if the customer number is stored in your profile on SBB.ch. After signing in, click on your initials, then on Profile and then on Update details in the Personal details tile. If the customer number is displayed in the form 000-000-000-0, it means it is linked.                                              Link customer number                                                                Purchase at a staffed public transport point of sale. Of course, you can also purchase the Night GA Travelcard at a staffed public transport point of sale. Please bring your SwissPass (if you have one), a recent analogue or digital passport photo and your passport/ID card. If you are purchasing for another person, then please bring the documents for this person (e.g. for your child).

question: How can I renew my Night GA Travelcard?
answer: If you wish to renew your Night GA Travelcard after it expires, you can buy a new travelcard. The Night GA Travelcard is not renewed automatically. Before your current Night GA Travelcard expires, we will inform you about how you can renew it. Buy Night GA Travelcard online

question: My train leaves before 7pm – what ticket do I need?
answer: The Night GA Travelcard is valid from 7pm. Validity is based on the scheduled departure time. For departures before 7pm, a ticket valid as far as the first stop made by the train after 7pm must be purchased. This rule also applies to journeys with EasyRide or other check-in/check-out solutions.

question: Does the Night GA Travelcard remain valid after my 25th birthday?
answer: Yes. If you turn 25 while your Night GA Travelcard is valid, you can continue to use it until the end of the period of validity. However, you cannot buy a Night GA Travelcard after your 25th birthday.

question: I would like to use my Night GA Travelcard to travel in 1st class – what do I need to be aware of?
answer: To travel in 1st class, you need to buy a 1st class upgrade for the route you wish to travel.  If you hold a Night GA Travelcard and are 16 or over, buy a first-class upgrade for the route you wish to travel. If you hold a Night GA Travelcard and a Half Fare Travelcard and are 15 years old or younger, buy a half-price first-class upgrade for the route you wish to travel. You cannot buy a 1-day class upgrade for a Night GA Travelcard.  You can buy class upgrades for a specific route online on SBB.ch, in the SBB Mobile app and from ticket machines. So you always have the option of going 1st class.

question: I have forgotten my SwissPass holding a Night GA Travelcard – what should I do now?
answer: If you leave your SwissPass at home or in the office, you can display it very easily in the SBB Mobile app in the Tickets & SwissPass tab (you must have a login with linked customer number). Alternatively, you can buy a card with temporary validity for a fee of CHF 5 from a public transport point of sale upon presentation of official ID.

question: How can I pay for a new Night GA Travelcard?
answer: Purchasing online. When purchasing online, you can pay by credit card, PostFinance Card, Reka Card or Twint. At a staffed public transport point of sale. When purchasing at a staffed point of sale, the following payment methods are available to you: cash, vouchers, Reka Check, Reka Rail, Twint, debit or credit card (PostFinance Card, Mastercard, Visa, Reka Card, American Express, Diners, JCB or myOne). Payment by credit card. You can pay for your new travelcard with the following credit cards:  Visa (incl. prepaid cards) MasterCard (incl. prepaid cards) American Express Diners Club International JCB MyOne  Please note: The credit card will be charged once the order has been received.  Payment by PostFinance Card. Payment with Twint.

question: How long does it take to receive my Night GA Travelcard on the SwissPass?
answer: Already have a SwissPass? Your Night GA Travelcard on the SwissPass will be valid from its first day of validity. This is your first SwissPass? Your Night GA Travelcard on the SwissPass will be delivered by post within around ten days. If you would like your Night GA Travelcard to be valid earlier, we can provide a temporary SwissPass. If you would like your new GA Travelcard to be valid earlier, we can provide a temporary SwissPass.

question: Where is my Night GA Travelcard valid?
answer: The area of validity for the Night GA Travelcard corresponds to that of the GA Travelcard.                                             Go to the Night GA Travelcard area of validity

question: My SwissPass holding a Night GA Travelcard has been lost or damaged – what can I do?
answer: No problem, order a replacement SwissPass for CHF 30. We are also happy to help you at a staffed point of sale.                                             Order a replacement SwissPass

question: Do I receive a discount on routes where the Night GA Travelcard is not valid?
answer: No.                                             Go to the Night GA Travelcard area of validity

question: My train arrives after 5am / 7am. Do I need to buy another ticket?
answer: The Night GA Travelcard is valid up to the last stop reached before 5am / 7am at the weekend and on public holidays. For travel after 5am / 7am, please buy a ticket.  If you hold a Night GA Travelcard and are aged 16 or over, please buy a full price ticket for your chosen route. If you hold a Night GA Travelcard and a Half Fare Travelcard or if you hold a seven25 Travelcard and are 15 years old or younger, buy a half-price ticket for the rest of your journey.

question: Can I deposit my Night GA Travelcard or return it and have it refunded?
answer: You cannot deposit or return your Night GA Travelcard. A refund is possible if you purchase a GA Travelcard from the standard GA Travelcard range instead.                                              Go to the refund conditions as per Tariff 600.9 Refunds, Chapter 4 (in German, French and Italian)                         Link opens in new window.

question: How long is the Night GA Travelcard valid for?
answer: The Night GA Travelcard is valid for one year from its first day of validity.

question: Is the night supplement included in the Night GA Travelcard?
answer: No, you need to buy night supplements separately.                                             Travel home safely with the nighttime network

question: Who is the Night GA Travelcard suitable for?
answer: The Night GA Travelcard is ideal if you are aged under 25 and are often on the move in the evenings. Because the Night GA Travelcard lets you enjoy unlimited travel in 2nd class on SBB trains, most other railways and many other public transport services in Switzerland from 7pm to 5am (on Saturday, Sunday and public holidays until 7am) – as if you had a GA Travelcard. The Night GA Travelcard is available on the SwissPass.

question: How much does the Night GA Travelcard cost?
answer: Until you turn 25, you can buy the Night GA Travelcard for one year for CHF 99. The Night GA Travelcard is available for the 2nd class.                                             More about the Night GA Travelcard

answer: No, you do not need a Half Fare Travelcard to buy a Night GA Travelcard.

question: What do I need to consider when taking my photo?
answer: Requirements. For the travelcard on the SwissPass, you need to provide a recent analogue or digital passport photo which fulfils the following criteria:  Taken from the front. Eyes open and not covered. Plain background. Even lighting (no shadows). Clear with high contrast. Black and white or colour. Approx. size 35mm × 45mm. Analogue passport photo: only original prints, no scans or photos printed out on paper. Digital passport photo: unedited, min. image size 200 × 250 pixels; in .JPG or .JPEG format with a maximum size of 4MB.  Purchasing a Night GA Travelcard online for the first time. If you already have a SwissPass or used to have another public transport travelcard, we will use the same photo for your new travelcard. Children and young people aged at least 6 and under 25 only need a new photo if the current photo was taken more than five years ago. First-time purchasing online with an identity check. If you are purchasing a Night GA Travelcard for the first time and do not yet have a SwissPass or travelcard, you can upload your digital passport photo once the purchasing process (including the identity check) is complete.  Purchasing for the first time via the order form. You will need to submit an original, high resolution passport photo taken recently. Your photo will be stored electronically for a maximum of five years (applicable for children and young people under 25).  Please write your first name and surname in block capitals on the back of the photo. Please attach the photo to the order form in the space indicated.  Purchasing the travelcard for the first time at a staffed point of sale. Please bring a recent analogue or digital passport photo to the counter. Changing your photo. If you would like to update your photo before the 5/10 year period has elapsed, please bring a recent analogue or digital passport photo to a public transport point of sale. You can then get a new SwissPass card with the new photo for a fee of CHF 30.

question: I am on the move and I have forgotten my Half Fare Travelcard on the SwissPass. What can I do?
answer: If you leave your SwissPass at home or in the office, you can display it easily in the SBB Mobile app in the Tickets & SwissPass tile (you must have a SwissPass login with a linked customer number).  Alternatively, for a fee of CHF 5 we can issue you with a temporary card valid for two days, available at any ticket counter, upon presentation of official ID.

question: How can I buy a Half Fare Travelcard?
answer: First-time purchase online. When purchasing online, the most important thing is your customer number in the format 000-000-000-0.
