The name on the ticket bought online must match the one on the travelcard and the same ticket can only be shown once.   For supersaver tickets, the following conditions apply in addition:   If you miss your booked connection or want to travel at another time, you can purchase a ticket for the same day at the standard fare and obtain a refund for the supersaver ticket after your journey. To be reimbursed, you must present both the original supersaver ticket and the original standard fare ticket. Only tickets with identical route and class can be refunded. A reduced surcharge of CHF 10 will be applied for refunds as per T600.9.

question: How and until when can I buy supersaver tickets, Saver Day Passes and Supersaver Class Upgrades using SBB Mobile?
answer: Supersaver tickets. If available, supersaver tickets are shown with a % symbol in the connection overview in the timetable enquiry. You can buy supersaver tickets up until one hour before the train departs. These tickets are no longer available after this point in time. Please note that supersaver tickets are limited to a specific train and are only valid for the selected connection.                                             More information on supersaver tickets                                                                 Saver Day Passes. You can also buy Saver Day Passes either via the timetable search or via rapid access in the ‘Shop & Services’ tab. Saver Day Passes are only available when booking in advance: from 6 months in advance up to the day before travel. They cannot be purchased on the day of travel.                                               More information on Saver Day Passes                                                                                                  Supersaver Class Upgrades. Once you have selected the connection you want, you can swipe on the connection from right to left to start the purchasing process. Alternatively, you can also open the detailed view of the connection and start the purchase process by clicking on the ‘Tickets from CHF xx.xx’ button. Supersaver Class Upgrades are only valid in combination with a valid 2nd class ticket.                                               More information on Supersaver Class Upgrades

question: What other functions does the travel companion in the ‘Trips’ tab offer me?
answer: In the ‘Trips’ tab, you will find relevant information from door-to-door to help you along your entire journey.   You can see departure and arrival times as well as platform information. What’s more, you will receive information about any disruptions to your journey – via push notification if necessary.  The train formation and information about the different sectors make it easier for you to quickly board the train at your preferred location.  To help you when boarding, changing and alighting, you are given directions via a map of marked walking routes.

question: Can I forward tickets stored in my Apple Wallet via WhatsApp, iMessage, e-mail or another channel?
answer: Yes, you can forward these tickets. However, they are personal and the name and date of birth must be entered correctly. The recipient of the ticket must then be able to show a valid form of personal ID (passport, identity card, driving licence, Half Fare/GA Travelcard) along with the ticket and the details on the two must match.

question: How can I reserve seats with SBB Mobile?
answer: Seat reservations (if they are available for the route selected) can be found in the ticket options under ‘Additional offers’.

question: How can I buy a ticket for a dog or a bike using SBB Mobile?
answer: You can easily add dogs and bikes to your order during the purchase process. The right ticket for your bike(s) and/or dog(s) will be added to the offer.

question: Can I authorise ticket purchases by means of facial recognition / fingerprint?
answer: Yes. If your device has a fingerprint sensor or facial recognition, you can authorise ticket purchases with one of these two security elements. You can activate them in the ‘Profile’ tab under ‘Settings for ticket purchase’.

question: Where can I find my travelcards on the SwissPass?
answer: In the ‘Tickets & Travelcards’ tab, you can see the travelcards referenced on your SwissPass under ‘Travelcards on your SwissPass’.

question: Which documents do I have to show to the ticket inspector?
answer: Tickets purchased via your smartphone are personal and non-transferable and are only valid in conjunction with a valid form of ID belonging to the person travelling (passport, identity card, driving licence). If you have a Half Fare/GA Travelcard, this is also a valid form of ID. If you have a travelcard on the SwissPass and have bought a ticket that is linked to it, you can simply show the ticket in the app. The prerequisite for this is that you are logged in with the SwissPass login and were also logged in at the time of purchase. Once you’ve done this, there’s usually no need to show your SwissPass card.   Important: If you can’t get an online connection while your ticket is being checked, you must show your SwissPass or another official form of ID if requested to do so by the inspector.

question: Is my phone operating system iOS (iPhone / iPad) compatible with the SBB Mobile app?
answer: In order to check if your iOS operating system is compatible with SBB Mobile, you need to know the model of your Apple device.                                             Go to the Apple models                          Link opens in new window.

question: What can I do if my device is not compatible?
answer: Buy tickets easily at SBB.ch. SBB.ch is also suitable for mobile devices with newer browsers.

question: I have checked in. How can I present my EasyRide ticket for inspection?
answer: You can find all your purchased tickets in the ‘Tickets & Travelcards’ tab. To do so, switch to the ‘Tickets & Travelcards’ tab and select the ‘Valid’ tab there. Your EasyRide ticket will be displayed in the list of valid tickets once you have checked in. Tap the QR code icon on the far right to display the ticket for inspection.

question: I have bought a travelcard which is not on the SwissPass – how can I enter it into the app?
answer: Manually add the desired travelcard to the ‘Tickets & Travelcards’ tab using the ‘Enter Travelcard’ button.

question: How can I buy a ticket faster?
answer: In the ‘Profile’ tab, set up the simplified purchase settings.  Your options:  Carry out purchases under CHF 40 with no additional confirmation. Set up Touch / Face ID. Always add ticket to Wallet (iOS only).

question: Can I pause the notifications on a temporary basis, for example when I go on holiday?
answer: Yes. Notifications can be paused temporarily. To enable this, open the relevant commuter route, tap on the round button with the three vertical dots and select ‘Pause notifications’’.  Don’t forget to reactivate notifications if you would like to receive notifications again.

question: Which Apple devices are compatible with SBB Mobile?
answer: All iPhones from iPhone 5s onwards as well as iPads (5th generation) and newer devices. Please note that:  your device must have at least iOS 12 for use with app versions 12.0.0 to 12.10.2.  your device must have at least iOS 13 for use with app versions from 12.12.0.  We recommend that you automatically update the app to always benefit from the latest features and improvements. Set this preference in your device settings under ‘iTunes & App Store’.

question: I have a question about SBB Mobile in relation to the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS.
answer: You can find answers to your questions on the help page for the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS.                                             To the Half-Fare travelcard PLUS

question: Can I buy a ticket for myself, my dog and my bicycle at the same time?
answer: Yes, just add a dog and a bicycle. You can also buy tickets for multiple passengers, dogs and bicycles at the same time.

question: I would like to buy tickets for myself and for people travelling with me. What do the terms ‘Standard offer’, ‘City offer’, ‘Saver offer’ and ‘Day Pass’ mean?
answer: As soon as you add multiple passengers or a bicycle and/or a dog, the names of the offers change. You will most often encounter the following:  The standard offer includes tickets at the standard tariff (Point-to-Point Tickets, single tickets etc.) for all passengers as well as for bicycles or dogs for the selected route / in the selected zones. With the City offer, you can also use local urban services at the start or the end of your journey. Saver offers are the lowest priced offer. These include supersaver tickets for passengers. This offer is only provided if there are enough tickets left for the route selected. The Day Pass offers allow travel groups to travel for the whole day within a given area of validity. Please note any individual provisions regarding the period of validity of the offers in the fare network (e.g. for 9 o’clock travelpasses).

question: How can I print tickets bought through SBB Mobile?
answer: Log in at sbb.ch/en/buying. All tickets are listed there under ‘Orders’. It is not necessary to update them there.  You can display the desired ticket in PDF format and print it here. You will also receive the ticket purchased via SBB Mobile by e-mail as a PDF.                                             Go to sbb.ch/en/buy

question: Which disruptions will I be notified about via push notification?
answer: You will be informed about any delays, platform changes or service interruptions that affect the commuter routes to which you are subscribed.

question: How can I set up notifications (information about disruptions and transfers)?
answer: In the ‘Profile’ tab, under ‘Notifications’, set whether you want to receive notifications for saved trips.

question: Can I share connections or save them in the calendar?
answer: Yes.  Here’s how it works:   Choose your connection from the timetable.  In the detailed view of the connection, you can share your journey with your contacts or save it in the calendar after clicking on the symbol with the three dots in the top right-hand corner.  The same function is also available for connections already saved in the ‘Trips’ tab.

question: Are tickets that were purchased on SBB.ch also shown in the SBB Mobile app?
answer: Yes, as long as you purchased them using the same SwissPass login. There is an exception for some international tickets which can only be shown on SBB.ch. Your tickets are listed in the ‘Tickets & Travelcards’ tab.  iPhone users can also add all their purchased tickets directly to their Apple Wallets. These tickets will then appear automatically on the device’s home screen on the day that they are valid.

question: What benefits does the ‘Commuting’ function offer me?
answer: You only have to set up your personal commuter routes once for the days and times that are relevant to you. This means you no longer need to search the timetable each day. You can quickly see the operating situation for your commuter route in the current commuting period (platform changes, disruptions etc.). If you don’t check your commuter route every morning, you can receive proactive notifications about service disruption via push notifications.

question: What should I do if I’ve forgotten my password?
answer: You can reset the password at swisspass.ch. To do so, you’ll need the e-mail address that you entered when registering. If you don’t receive an e-mail, make sure that you entered your e-mail address correctly and that the e-mail hasn’t gone to your spam folder. If you have also forgotten the e-mail address that you used to register, please open a new account.                                             Go to swisspass.ch                         Link opens in new window.

question: Can I change my password?
answer: You can change your password in the ‘Profile’ tab under ‘Personal details’ and ‘Change login information’. Then click on ‘Change password’.

question: Which Apple devices are not compatible?
answer: iPhone, iPhone 3G, iPhone 3GS, iPhone 4, iPhone 4S, iPhone 5, iPhone 5c as well as iPad mini, iPad 1, iPad 2, iPad 3 and iPad 4 are no longer supported.

question: Can I use EasyRide for additional passengers?
answer: No. At present, EasyRide can only be used for the main user who is logged in, in accordance with the general terms of business. It is not possible to enter other passengers, dogs or bicycles. Please buy tickets for your companions in the usual way via the app.

question: What is the maximum daily cost of a journey with EasyRide?
answer: Based on the journeys you take, EasyRide calculates the best available combination of tickets that can be sold to you in accordance with the fare provisions.  This means the following maximum daily costs for journeys within Switzerland’s GA Travelcard area of validity with EasyRide apply:  With a Half Fare Travelcard: the price of the ‘Day Pass for the Half Fare Travelcard’ in 2nd or 1st class. Without a Half Fare Travelcard: no upper limit, you will be charged the full price for the tickets.  Go to the prices for the ‘Day Pass for the Half Fare Travelcard’ For journeys within a fare network. A Day Pass for the relevant fare network will be charged, taking into account the following information:  Zones travelled. Class used. Any current travelcard benefits stored in the SBB Mobile app that are creditable for EasyRide.  EasyRide will not take into account Saver Day Passes, seasonal special offer Day Passes or regional special offer day passes.  Please buy these tickets via the usual channels: in the SBB Mobile app, online at SBB.ch or in-person at the relevant points of sale.

question: What do I need to do before my journey?
answer: You need to start EasyRide and check in immediately before you start your journey and before you board the vehicle. Your mobile phone will transmit your log-in time and location to the system and display a confirmation that you have checked in successfully. Once you have checked in, you are entitled to travel on public transport within the GA Travelcard area of validity and on selected routes outside of the GA Travelcard area of validity. More detailed information is available under the question “Where can I use EasyRide?”.

question: What are the requirements for using EasyRide?
answer: You will need a valid SwissPass login with which you have logged in to the app. You will need a functioning smartphone with a touchscreen and operating system Apple iOS 12 (or above) or Android 6.0 (or above). Your smartphone must have a working SIM card that enables the transmission of data. We recommend using EasyRide on a smartphone contract with a data flat rate. You will need a valid payment method. You can choose between monthly invoice, Twint, Reka, a credit card or a PostFinance Card. If the device has been jailbroken or rooted, EasyRide will not work.

question: What happens if my smartphone switches off during the journey because it’s out of charge?
answer: By opting to use EasyRide, you are responsible for ensuring that your smartphone has sufficient charge throughout the entire journey.

question: Where can I use EasyRide?
answer: EasyRide can be used on the entire GA route network in Switzerland, including boats.                                             Go to the GA Travelcard area of validity                                                                Jungfrau Railway and Grindelwald Bus AG.  Outside of the GA Travelcard route network, EasyRide can be used on certain routes: EasyRide is valid with Grindelwald Bus AG and Jungfrau Railway. Including:   Jungfraujoch - Top of Europe (incl. Eiger Express) Grindelwald - First Schynige Platte Harder Kulm Winteregg Mürren Kleine Scheidegg  Tip: In the winter season, there is a reduced fare for travellers who would usually pay the full fare (i.e. adults without a Half Fare Travelcard). This must be purchased locally in Grindelwald and is not available via EasyRide. ‘Stalden–Staldenried–Gspon’ cable car. EasyRide is valid on the ‘Stalden–Staldenried–Gspon’ cable car. ‘Stechelberg–Mürren–Schilthorn’ cable car (LSMS). EasyRide is valid on the ‘Stechelberg–Mürren–Schilthorn’ cable car.

question: Why do you need to set your smartphone tracking service to “always” to use EasyRide?
answer: EasyRide needs your tracking data (GPS) in order to record your journey correctly and charge you the right price for the route you are travelling. If you close the app or leave it running in the background during your journey, the travel tracking function will only work if your tracking service is always activated. EasyRide pinpoints your location:  each time you open the app to find your nearest station. For a smooth check-in at the start of your journey. when you are checked in during your journey in order to record the route you’re travelling. a few minutes after you check out so that it can calculate the right price based on your destination.  Please make sure that your location services are set up as followed in your smartphone settings:   For iPhones: set the permission to “Always”. For Android smartphones: set the permission to “Allow only while in use” and “Precise location”. activate Bluetooth and WiFi scanning for SBB Mobile. Enable “Physical activity” for SBB Mobile.

question: Can I change vehicle during the journey?
answer: Yes, during the journey you can make as many changes as you like, whenever you like.

question: When will the journey be charged to my payment method?
answer: Go to questions about invoices and receipts

question: What’s the difference between the “Provisional price” and the “Calculated price”?
answer: Go to questions about fares

question: Can I use EasyRide for boat trips too?
answer: Yes, you can also use EasyRide for boat trips in the GA travelcard area of validity.

question: Are there supersaver tickets for EasyRide?
answer: Supersaver tickets must be purchased at least one hour before departure in accordance with the applicable fare provisions. With EasyRide you check in immediately before departure which means that supersaver tickets do not apply with EasyRide. For journeys planned well in advance, we recommend purchasing the supersaver ticket in the usual way via the app and combining or undertaking the final section on local services, where no supersaver tickets are currently available, with EasyRide.

question: Can EasyRide be used for business travel?
answer: If you have an SBB Business customers agreement which is linked to your private SwissPass login on SBB Mobile, EasyRide cannot be used for business travel at present. Please buy tickets in the usual way via the app.  If you use EasyRide without an SBB Business customers agreement with your business payment card, the receipt will be sent to your billing address.  Please note: EasyRide charges all journeys to the last payment method used, on the day. It is not possible to switch between private and business payment cards for different journeys on the same day.

question: What do I need to know if my journey involves a change?
answer: If you change vehicle without this involving a major break in the journey, there’s no need to check out. SBB Mobile will detect the change you have made and automatically work out the best ticket for you.

question: I’ve been overcharged for a journey. What can I do?
answer: Go to questions about refunds

question: I’ve checked in by mistake. Will I be charged for a ticket?
answer: When you check in, you have a few seconds to check out again straight away. If you never actually leave the first stop on a journey, you won’t be charged for a ticket either.

question: Does EasyRide take my travelcards into account?
answer: Yes. EasyRide takes your saved Half Fare and regional Travelcards into account and applies them to any relevant journey in your travelcard area. Travelcards can be edited in the “EasyRide” tab. In the event of a ticket inspection, both the EasyRide ticket and the saved travelcard must be shown to the ticket inspection staff. The following travelcards are NOT taken into account by EasyRide. Please purchase your zone upgrade separately in the app or at a point of sale:  Local network travelcards ZVV  Transreno travelcards Léman Pass travelcards U-Abo (Freizeit) travelcard GA travelcards seven25 Point-to-point Travelcards Modular Travelcards Leisure Travelcards Dog Pass Annual bike passes Junior Travelcards FlexiAbo travelcards Transferable season tickets

question: How does the check-in work?
answer: To check in, start up EasyRide and check in by swiping from left to right on the start button on the display. Successful check-in is confirmed in the SBB Mobile app when the timer begins and the picture starts moving. The EasyRide ticket can be found in the “Tickets & Travelcards” tab. Please be aware that the check-in was not successful if the EasyRide ticket (barcode ticket) is not displayed in the “Tickets & Travelcards” tab after you check in. If this happens, you do not have a valid ticket for your journey on public transport. As soon as you have checked in successfully, you can use your EasyRide ticket on public transport in the area of validity of the GA Travelcard. You must complete the check-in with EasyRide before the departure of the means of transport.

question: I forgot to check out. What can I do?
answer: Go to questions about refunds

question: How do I buy a ticket?
answer: It’s quite simple: just start SBB Mobile and check in (by swiping from left to right). Important: You must complete the check-in with EasyRide BEFORE the departure of the means of transport, otherwise the journey is considered a “travel without a valid ticket (RogF)”.  As soon as you have arrived at your destination and alighted from the vehicle, you need to check out (by swiping from right to left). The app records your route and then works out the best ticket for you. The cost of this ticket will be charged automatically to your stored payment method.

question: Are there any offers or features I can’t use with EasyRide?
answer: The following offers are not (or not yet) available when using EasyRide. Please purchase these offers via the usual channels in the SBB Mobile:  Class upgrade (to be added at a later date) Supersaver tickets and Saver Day Passes (not available for tariff-related reasons, as they must be purchased at least one hour before departure) Bike space and seat reservations Dog tickets Bike tickets  Zurich Transport Network 24-hour Day Pass (as a replacement, ZVV has introduced the Calendar Day Day Pass, which will be recognised in EasyRide) Calendar Day Day Pass.Link opens in new window. For regional and seasonal offers and offers with special fares (e.g. Football ticket for fan train, regional Day Passes not sold by SBB, free buses or free ski buses) as well as the Lake Zurich Meilen–Horgen you can’t use EasyRide. Buy tickets from the normal range instead. Tickets for fellow travellers (EasyRide can only be used by the main traveller logged in, as this user is the only one to have accepted the GTC)  Multiple-journey tickets Day Pass Children Friends Day Pass for Youth

question: How and when will I receive a final invoice for my journeys?
answer: Go to questions about invoices and receipts

question: How much data is used?
answer: When you are checked in, EasyRide receives and sends approximately 1MB per hour.

question: What happens if my smartphone doesn’t work properly during the journey?
answer: If your smartphone isn’t working properly or is unable to transmit data during your journey for a reason that is within your control (e.g. it’s in flight mode, power saving mode, battery optimization, out of charge or is faulty, or location services have been turned off, etc.), this means that you are not meeting the conditions for using EasyRide and you are therefore not in possession of a valid ticket. If your smartphone doesn’t work properly on a temporary basis, the system will continue to run on the server in the background for a certain period of time.

question: Can I turn off my Internet connection during the journey?
answer: No, because this may prevent your journey from being recorded properly. We reserve the right to ban users if they are repeat offenders in this regard.

question: The app won’t let me check out even though I’ve got reception. What can I do?
answer: Close the app completely. Then reopen the app and check out. If that doesn’t work either, turn on flight mode for at least five minutes. You will then be checked out automatically from the location you were in when you turned on flight mode. Alternatively, for Android smartphones, we recommend deleting the cache or data of the SBB app. To do so, go to the Smartphone settings under ‘Apps’, ‘SBB Mobile’, ‘Storage’ and then ‘Clear cache’.

question: Why are there price differences between tickets purchased via SBB.ch or SBB Mobile and EasyRide or other automatic ticketing vendors on the market?
answer: Go to questions about fares

question: What do I need to do after the journey?
answer: As soon as you have completed your journey and alighted from the means of transport, you need to check out by swiping from right to left. Once you have done this, the app will immediately calculate the route you have travelled and the price of the journey.

question: What payment methods can I use for EasyRide?
answer: Half Fare Travelcard PLUS  Monthly invoice Visa MasterCard American Express PostFinance Card Twint Reka card (you must have a SwissPass login)  Apple Pay cannot be used because EasyRide journeys are charged at the end of the day.

question: What is the difference between SBB EasyRide and Fairtiq?
answer: EasyRide is based on the technology of our partner, Fairtiq. The straightforward operation, journey recording and price calculation is identical to that of Fairtiq. Common features of all solutions are:   Valid on the entire GA Travelcard network map in Switzerland.  All three solutions determine the price of the journey according to the applicable fare regulations for automatic ticketing.    Advantages of EasyRide compared with the other solutions:   Thanks to the SwissPass login, your travelcards on the SwissPass are included for journeys with EasyRide and the zone upgrade is determined automatically. See below for details of restrictions.  With EasyRide, you can pay for your journeys via a monthly invoice. With EasyRide you can store up to 5 different payment methods: Choose from monthly invoicing, Visa, MasterCard, American Express, PostFinance Card, Twint and Reka.  The Fairtiq app is a purely ticketing app. As EasyRide is integrated into the SBB Mobile app, you benefit from an all-inclusive public transport service:   Easy operability for timetable queries with the touch timetable. Real-time timetable information with change assistance and information about delays. Purchase of Point-to-Point tickets from A to B. Purchase of supersaver tickets and Saver Day Passes. Purchase of tickets for travelling companions or for bicycles and dogs. Display of the digital SwissPass in the app itself.  SBB Mobile is the perfect companion for journeys by public transport in Switzerland. For example, you can buy a supersaver ticket when you are planning journeys in advance, or you can check in with EasyRide for spontaneous trips by public transport then just get on and go – and you have all relevant timetable information to hand at all times. All in one app!

question: What can I do about location problems on Android smartphones?
answer: To record your journey correctly, SBB Mobile needs access to your location data. Some versions of Android are configured to prevent SBB Mobile from receiving location data. Therefore, recording and completion may not be possible for some trips. To locate you correctly, your phone also uses Wi-Fi and Bluetooth technology. It is therefore a good idea to keep these technologies activated during your trip (you do not need to be connected to a WLAN network). Have you had a GPS problem? Please complete the following steps before your next trip with EasyRide:  Make sure that SBB Mobile is allowed to use your location. To do so, your smartphone settings should be as follows: Settings > Apps > SBB Mobile > Permissions > Location. Make sure that you allow SBB Mobile to use GPS while using the app. Deactivate the battery saving mode.  Make sure your location settings are set to “High accuracy” / “Exact location”. You can do this as follows: Settings > Additional settings > Privacy > Location > Set to High accuracy or Settings > Connections > Location > Set to High accuracy. Ensure that the exchange of data between your device and SBB Mobile is not negatively influenced by any other app installed (virus scanner etc.) or by battery optimisation.  Please note that if you abort SBB Mobile and EasyRide (when the app is closed in the Task Manager or by swiping it in the list of running apps) immediately after your journey is completed, this can affect the fare paid if SBB Mobile did not have enough time to locate you correctly.

question: How does the check-out warning work?
answer: The check-out warning uses the movement sensors in modern smartphones to help you to remember to check out after you have completed your journey. As soon as you are no longer standing or sitting in the vehicle and are walking instead, the app will detect by your movements that you are most likely no longer in the vehicle and it will remind you to check out. For this purpose, you have to activate movement and fitness data on your device and authorise notifications. Please note that we are unfortunately unable to guarantee that the check-out warning will work properly. It is intended as a service to help you remember to check out. We are currently working to improve the reliability of the warning, but it is always your responsibility to make sure that you check out at the right time. Important: Google Pixel, Huawei and Xiaomi smartphones in some cases have an energy saving mode which deactivates the location services required to track your journey. Check your device settings to make sure the SBB Mobile app is a protected app. For example, Huawei Mate 9: System Settings > Power Saving > Protected App > turn the service on for SBB Mobile.

question: Why can’t I start the check-in process?
answer: You may have been automatically connected to a public WiFi network that requires you to register before you can use it (e.g. SBB-FREE, PostAuto). The easiest way to avoid this problem is to switch off WiFi on your device or to ignore the WiFi network in question. Please make sure that the WiFi and Bluetooth scanning settings (if available on your device) are activated. You can activate these options in your phone’s settings via ‘Settings’ -> ‘Location’ -> ‘Improve accuracy’ (may vary depending on manufacturer and Android version). For subterranean stops (such as Lucerne, Allmend/Messe, all underground platforms at Zurich main station, Zurich Airport, Geneva Airport and any other underground stations), please check in while you are still on the ground floor as the geolocation may be insufficient underground. Power saving mode and/or battery optimisation on the user device can severely affect the reception of precise location data. This data is essential for recording the journey accurately. Please turn off these settings when using EasyRide.  Location access. iOS. Location access must be set to ‘Always’ to use EasyRide – otherwise it is not possible to record the journey accurately. You can configure this setting in your iPhone’s app settings. For iOS 14 and above, please also activate the “Precise location” option. Android. Set the permission to “Allow only while in use” and “Precise location”. In addition, activate Bluetooth and WiFi scanning and enable “Physical activity” for SBB Mobile. Motion & Fitness (iOS) / Physical activity (Android). iOS. ‘Motion & Fitness’ must be activated while using EasyRide. You can activate this in your iPhone’s app settings. Android. Please note that the physical activity permission is enabled for SBB Mobile from Android 10 on. You can activate this in the app permissions on your Android smartphone.

question: I have a question about EasyRide in relation to the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS.
answer: You can find answers to your questions on the help page for the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS.                                             To the Half-Fare travelcard PLUS

question: Which data are recorded with EasyRide and why?
answer: When you register for EasyRide, your SwissPass personal data and the stored payment data are saved. To determine your route, the app captures your location and activity data based on motion sensors during the journey. The recording of your travel data starts when you check in to EasyRide and ends a few minutes after completion of the check-out process. Your data will never be passed on to third parties and will be stored in accordance with Swiss data protection regulations.

question: What happens if I can’t check in before the journey due to technical reasons?
answer: If you can’t check in via EasyRide due to technical reasons, you need to buy a ticket in some other way, e.g. via the usual purchase process in the app or at a ticket machine.

question: What happens if I turn off location services during the journey?
answer: Your smartphone’s location services are used to help work out the route you have travelled, so these must always be switched on while the app is in use. If location services are turned off, the app will issue an error message and the ticket can no longer be displayed. This means that you are travelling without a valid ticket and you may be fined by a ticket inspector.

question: Why do I not see any details of the EasyRide journeys on the payment method “monthly invoice”?
answer: Go to questions about invoices and receipts

question: Can passengers aged under 16 use EasyRide?
answer: Yes, passengers under 16 years old can use EasyRide and automatically travel at the discounted price.

question: How can I see an overview of my past journeys?
answer: Go to questions about invoices and receipts

question: How can I see the fare?
answer: Go to questions about fares

question: How can I print out tickets purchased with SBB Preview?
answer: Log in at sbb.ch/en/buying. All tickets are listed there under ‘Orders’. It is not necessary to update them there. You can display the desired ticket in PDF format and print it here. You will also receive the ticket purchased via SBB Preview by e-mail in the form of a PDF.                                             Go to sbb.ch/en/buying

question: What other functions does the travel companion in the ‘Trips’ tab offer me?
answer: In the ‘Trips’ tab, you will find relevant information from door-to-door to help you along your entire journey.   You can see departure and arrival times as well as platform information. What’s more, you will receive information about any disruptions to your journey – via push notification if necessary.  The train formation and information about the different sectors given make it easier for you to quickly board the train at your preferred location.  To help you when boarding, changing and alighting, you are given directions via a map of marked walking routes.

question: I am not being offered a bike space reservation, even though I have added a bicycle.
answer: Bike space reservations are obligatory on certain days of travel and for certain train types. For journeys for which this requirement does not apply, you do not need a bicycle space reservation. In such cases, the app will not offer you this option. You can find all details regarding compulsory seat reservations at sbb.ch/en/bicycle.

question: How can I reserve seats with SBB Preview?
answer: Seat reservations (if they are available for the route selected) can be found in the ticket options under ‘Additional offers’.

question: How do I buy regional transport tickets with SBB Preview?
answer: At present, you can only buy regional transport tickets by entering your desired route in the timetable. The quick-select function, which offers the best zone tickets based on your current position, will be implemented at a later date.

question: Is the data generated through detection used further?
answer: Bluetooth detection takes place only on the train. The data will not be registered, stored or further used. As soon as you leave the train, you also lose the information about the train.

question: Is my iOS mobile phone operating system (iPhone / iPad) compatible with the SBB Preview app?
answer: In order to check whether your iOS operating system is compatible with SBB Preview, you need to know the model of your Apple device.                                             Go to Apple device models                          Link opens in new window.

question: Which devices with the Android operating system are compatible with SBB Preview?
answer: To use SBB Preview to purchase tickets on your smartphone, the operating system installed must be Android 6.0 or higher.  We recommend that you automatically update the app so that you will always benefit from the latest features and improvements. Adjust this setting in the Play Store.

question: Can I forward tickets stored in my Apple Wallet via WhatsApp, iMessage, e-mail or another channel?
answer: Yes, you can forward these tickets. However, they are personal and the name and date of birth must be entered correctly. The recipient of the ticket must then be able to show a valid form of personal ID (passport, identity card, driving licence, Half Fare/GA Travelcard) along with the ticket and the details on the two must match.

question: How can I set up notifications (information about disruptions and transfers)?
answer: In the ‘Profile’ tab, under ‘Notifications’, set whether you want to receive notifications for saved trips.

question: How can I activate/deactivate advertising in SBB Preview?
answer: In the ‘Profile’ tab, you can choose whether you want to see advertisements in the app.

question: Can I save my commuter route?
answer: Yes, you can use the ‘Commuting’ function. In the ‘Trips’ tab, you can switch between ‘Single Trips’ and ‘Commuting’ Enter one or more of your commuter routes by tapping on ‘Set up commuter route’.

question: How can I buy a ticket faster?
answer: In the ‘Profile’ tab, set up the simplified purchase settings.  Your options:  Carry out purchases under CHF 40 with no additional confirmation. Set up Touch / Face ID. Always add ticket to Wallet (iOS only).

question: What tickets can I buy with SBB Preview?
answer: You can buy the following tickets with SBB Preview:  Standard tickets for trips within Switzerland All regional transport tickets for all regional networks in Switzerland Supersaver tickets and Saver Day Passes City-City tickets Day Pass for the Half Fare Travelcard Class upgrades & Supersaver Class Upgrades Day Pass Children / Day Pass for dogs / Bike Day Pass Reserving seats and bicycle spaces

question: How do I save a trip?
answer: Search for the connection you want.  On the connection overview, save the connection by swiping from left to right. The connection is automatically transferred to the ‘Trips’ tab.  You can now also save the connection by using the ‘Save trip’ button in the detailed view of the connection. This way, you can save several connections without always having to start the search again.  If you buy a ticket, the connection is automatically transferred to the ‘Trips’ tab.  On the next page you will find further useful information and video tutorials:                                              More information and video tutorials

question: How do I buy zone upgrades with SBB Preview?
answer: If you are logged in and your regional travelcard is referenced on the SwissPass, you will automatically be offered the correct zone upgrades. If your travelcard is not on the SwissPass, you can enter it manually in the ‘Tickets & Travelcards’ tab.

question: What does SBB Preview need these permissions for?
answer: Location. In order for SBB Preview to be able to find the next stop, both in the timetable and on the map in the ‘Plan’ tab, GPS location services must be enabled for the app. If you want to purchase your ticket conveniently via EasyRide, location services must always be enabled so that the journey can be recorded. Internet access. The SBB Preview app needs to be able to access online timetable and ticket data in order to answer your queries. If you want the convenience of buying a ticket via EasyRide, you must always have a functioning internet connection during your journey. Notifications. If you wish to receive push notifications for saved trips, SBB Preview requires the authorisation to display notifications on Android and iOS systems.

question: I would like to buy tickets for myself and for people travelling with me. What do the terms ‘Standard offer’, ‘City offer’, ‘Saver offer’ and ‘Day Pass’ mean?
answer: As soon as you add multiple passengers or a bicycle and/or a dog, the names of the offers change. You will most often encounter the following:  The standard offer includes tickets at the standard tariff (Point-to-Point Tickets, single tickets etc.) for all passengers as well as for bicycles or dogs for the selected route / in the selected zones. With the City offer, you can also use local urban services at the start or the end of your journey. Saver offers are the lowest priced offer. These include supersaver tickets for passengers. This offer is only provided if there are enough tickets left for the route selected. The Day Pass offers allow travel groups to travel for the whole day within a given area of validity. Please note any individual provisions regarding the period of validity of the offers in the fare network (e.g. for 9 o’clock travelpasses).

question: Can I share connections or save them in the calendar?
answer: Yes.  Here’s how it works:   Choose your connection from the timetable.  In the detailed view of the connection, you can share your journey with your contacts or save it in the calendar after clicking on the symbol with the three dots in the top right-hand corner.  The same function is also available for connections already saved in the ‘Trips’ tab.

question: Can I deactivate the function?
answer: Yes, either directly at the bottom of the function or alternatively in the ‘Profile’ tab under ‘Other settings’.

question: I am buying several tickets at the same time, but I can only see one price on the ‘Ticket options’ screen. Where can I see the price per ticket?
answer: Tap the arrow icon to the right of the tickets listed. This will take you to the ‘Ticket details’ screen, where you can see the individual prices.

question: Can I check the train formation so I can wait for the train on the right part of the platform?
answer: Yes. To find out where on the platform e.g. the 1st class section of the train, the carriage for transporting bicycles, or the family compartment are located, proceed as follows:  Choose your connection from the timetable.  Click on the connection to open the detailed view. Open the train formation by swiping to the left in the area of the route diagram.   Please note that the train formation for the current day will be displayed in the app and that this is not available for all modes of transport.

question: What benefits does the ‘Commuting’ function offer me?
answer: You only have to set up your personal commuter routes once for the days and times that are relevant to you. This means you no longer need to search the timetable each day. You can quickly see the operating situation for your commuter route in the current commuting period (platform changes, disruptions etc.).  If you don’t check your commuter route every morning, you can receive proactive notifications about disruption via push notifications.

question: What information can I see using the On Board Information function?
answer: Map view with your current position and the overall route of the train. Customer information about the train: the train’s next stop, arrival times, disruptions to the train’s service. Possibility to share your position on the train with another person, making it even easier to meet up on the train.  Information on shops and services, including opening hours at the nearest arrival station (if available on SBB.ch).  Environmental calculator for the entire route of the train.  Explanation of the function.  Option to deactivate the function.

question: Do I have to register in order to buy tickets with the SBB Preview app?
answer: No. You have the option of buying tickets without registering. In order to do so, click on ‘Buy as guest’ when purchasing your ticket.

question: What happens to my personal data (name, address, etc.)?
answer: Protecting your personal data and privacy is a major concern for us as public transport companies. We guarantee that your personal data will be processed in accordance with the applicable provisions of data protection law. You can find all the details on this in the SBB privacy policy.                                             Go to the SBB privacy policy

question: How do I search for a connection?
answer: In the standard timetable, you can search for a connection by entering the departure and destination stations using the keyboard.  The touch timetable is the personalised alternative to the standard timetable. The stops you travel to most often are automatically saved on the dynamic tiles. The touch timetable therefore adapts to suit your needs as they change. However, you can also create customised tiles according to your own needs, and personalise them with photos.  The map also provides guidance, taking you from your current location to your point of departure or your destination.

question: Which devices with the Windows operating system are compatible with SBB Preview?
answer: Since March 2018, ticket sales on SBB Preview (and SBB Mobile) for Windows have no longer been supported. This is because the operating system no longer meets international security standards for data from payment cards. As the Windows platform is also no longer actively supported by Microsoft, there is no alternative app solution for Windows phone users.

question: Can I disable push notifications for disruption on my commuter routes?
answer: Yes. You can make adjustments under ‘Notifications’ in the ‘Profile’ tab.

question: How can I register a payment method?
answer: Select ‘Payment method’ in the ‘Profile’ tab and tap on ‘Enter new payment method’. Next, enter the information required.

question: Can I buy a ticket for myself, my dog and my bicycle at the same time?
answer: Yes, just add a dog and a bicycle. You can also buy tickets for multiple passengers, dogs and bicycles at the same time.

question: Up until when can I buy tickets with SBB Preview?
answer: Up to the beginning of the journey or just before the train departs.  Please note that the purchasing process must be completed before departure. We recommend that you always buy your ticket before boarding.

question: Can I buy a ticket for my bicycle and a bike space reservation at the same time?
answer: Not yet, but we are working on making it possible to do both in the same purchase process very soon.

question: I have bought a travelcard which is not on the SwissPass – how can I enter it into the app?
answer: Manually add the desired travelcard to the ‘Tickets & Travelcards’ tab using the ‘Enter Travelcard’ button.

question: Can I have tickets purchased with SBB Preview refunded?
answer: Yes. Tickets purchased with SBB Preview (as well as with SBB Mobile and at SBB.ch) can be refunded. Refund before the start of the period of validity. You can have your tickets refunded before the start of the period of validity in the SBB Preview and SBB Mobile apps themselves, as well as in your profile on SBB.ch.  Procedure in SBB Preview. Open the ticket to be refunded in the ‘Tickets & Travelcards’ tab. Then click on the 3 dots on the ticket screen and select ‘Refund ticket’. The ticket will then be refunded and the amount will be credited to the payment method used for payment.  Refund after the period of validity has started. You can have your ticket refunded after the start of validity via the refund request form for a fee of CHF 10:                                               Go to the refund request form                                                                Can I get a refund for saver offers (supersaver ticket, Saver Day Pass and Supersaver Class Upgrade)? Yes. National saver products (supersaver tickets, Saver Day Passes, Supersaver Class Upgrades) which you purchase in the SBB Preview app, the SBB Mobile app or on SBB.ch while logged in can be refunded/exchanged free of charge within 30 minutes of the time of purchase.  Once those 30 minutes have elapsed, national saver products can be refunded/exchanged only in the following exceptional cases. A fee of CHF 10 is retained in each case.  The purchase of duplicate tickets (where travel date, route and passenger – full name and date of birth – are identical). Ticket purchased for the wrong customer group (Day Pass without the Half Fare Travelcard or ‘full fare’ instead of ‘discounted’). Proven inability to travel (illness, accident or death). Subsequent purchase of personal travelcards for at least 12 months (as per Tariff 600.9, paragraph 16.0). The name on the ticket bought with SBB Preview must match the one on the travelcard and the same ticket can only be shown once.  Tickets with incorrect personal details (surname, first name or date of birth, if an obvious error has been made). Tickets can only be refunded if customers can show that they purchased the right ticket afterwards. Ticket on which an incorrect date has been entered in error: a refund is only available before the ticket travel date. It must be possible to prove that a new ticket was purchased.  For supersaver tickets, the following conditions apply in addition:   If you miss your booked connection or would like to travel at a different time, buy a ticket at the normal fare and get a refund for the supersaver tickets after your journey. To be reimbursed, you must present both the original supersaver ticket with confirmation from the sales staff or ticket inspector and the original standard fare ticket. Only tickets with completely identical routes can be refunded.

question: What can I do if my device is not compatible?
answer: You can easily buy tickets at SBB.ch.

question: Are tickets which were purchased at SBB.ch also displayed in SBB Preview?
answer: Yes, as long as you purchased them using the same SwissPass login. There is an exception for some international tickets which can only be shown on SBB.ch. Your tickets are listed in the ‘Tickets & Travelcards’ tab. iPhone users can also add all their purchased tickets directly to their Apple Wallets. These tickets will then appear automatically on the device’s home screen on the day that they are valid.

question: Can I pause the notifications on a temporary basis, for example when I go on holiday?
answer: Yes. Notifications can be paused. To enable this, open the relevant commuter route, tap on the round button with the three vertical dots and select ‘Pause notifications’.  Don’t forget to reactivate notifications if you would like to receive notifications again.

question: Which documents do I have to show to the ticket inspector?
answer: Tickets purchased via your smartphone are personal and non-transferable and are only valid in conjunction with a valid form of ID belonging to the person travelling (passport, identity card, driving licence). If you have a Half Fare/GA Travelcard, this is also a valid form of ID. If you have a travelcard on the SwissPass and have bought a ticket that is linked to it, you can simply show the ticket in the app. The prerequisite for this is that you are logged in with the SwissPass login and were also logged in at the time of purchase. Once you’ve done this, there’s usually no need to show your SwissPass card.   Important: If you can’t get an online connection while your ticket is being checked, you must show your SwissPass or another official form of ID if requested to do so by the inspector.

question: Which disruptions will I be notified about via push notification?
answer: You will be informed about any delays, platform changes or service interruptions that affect the commuter routes to which you are subscribed.

question: How do I see the function in SBB Preview?
answer: The ‘On Board Information’ function is shown on SBB Preview during active journeys in a train with beacon technology and active Bluetooth detection. Requirements:  You must have the SBB Preview app installed on your mobile phone. You must enable Bluetooth for SBB Preview in the device settings. You must be on a train with beacon technology. The following types of train are currently equipped with beacon technology: SBB InterCity. SBB InterRegio. SBB EuroCity.

question: Where can I find my travelcards on the SwissPass?
answer: In the ‘Tickets & Travelcards’ tab, you can see the travelcards referenced on your SwissPass under ‘Travelcards on your SwissPass’.

question: Which Apple devices are compatible with SBB Preview?
answer: All iPhones from iPhone 5s onwards as well as iPads (5th generation) and newer devices. Please note that:  your device must have at least iOS 12 for use with app versions 12.0.0 to 12.10.2.  your device must have at least iOS 13 for use with app versions from 12.12.0.  We recommend that you automatically update the app to always benefit from the latest features and improvements. Set this preference in your device settings under ‘iTunes & App Store’.

question: How do I buy a ticket with SBB Preview?
answer: Once you have selected the connection you want, you can swipe on the connection from right to left to start the purchasing process.  Alternatively, you can also open the detailed view of the connection and start the purchase process by clicking on the ‘Tickets from CHF xx.xx’ button.

question: Where can I add ticket for a dog or a bicycle when making a purchase?
answer: Tap on the pencil icon in the ‘Ticket options’ screen. Add the desired number of dogs and/or bicycles.

question: How can I purchase a bike space reservation?
answer: Add at least one bicycle. Offers matching the selected journey types (passengers, dog / bicycle) will then be displayed.

question: Where can I see the function in SBB Preview?
answer: If you are on a train with beacon technology and have enabled Bluetooth detection for SBB Preview on your device, this will be indicated to you in SBB Preview via the ‘Live’ icon in the ‘Trips’ tab. In the list view in the ‘Single Trips’ area, the train that has been detected is listed at the top together with the destination.

question: What should I do if I’ve forgotten my password?
answer: You can reset the password at swisspass.ch. To do so, you’ll need the e-mail address that you entered when registering. If you don’t receive an e-mail, make sure that you entered your e-mail address correctly and that the e-mail hasn’t gone to your spam folder. If you have also forgotten the e-mail address that you used to register, please open a new account.                                             Go to swisspass.ch                         Link opens in new window.

question: How do I pay for tickets purchased using SBB Preview?
answer: The following payment options are available to you when purchasing tickets with SBB Preview:  Half Fare Travelcard PLUS.  Monthly invoice (only available with a login). Mastercard. Visa. American Express Switzerland. Diners Club. Twint. Apple Pay. PostFinance Card.  Reka-Card (only available with login).

question: How can I buy supersaver tickets, Saver Day Passes and Supersaver Class Upgrades with SBB Preview, and up until when?
answer: Supersaver tickets. If available, supersaver tickets are shown with a % symbol in the connection overview in the timetable enquiry. You can buy supersaver tickets up until one hour before the train departs. These tickets are no longer available after this point in time. Please note that supersaver tickets are limited to a specific train and are only valid for the selected connection.                                             More information on supersaver tickets                                                                 Saver Day Passes. You can currently also buy Saver Day Passes via a timetable enquiry. In future, they will also be available under the ‘Shop & Services’ tab. Saver Day Passes are only available when booking in advance: from 6 months in advance up to the day before travel. They cannot be purchased on the day of travel.                                               More information on Saver Day Passes                                                                                                  Supersaver Class Upgrades. Once you have selected the connection you want, you can swipe on the connection from right to left to start the purchasing process. Alternatively, you can also open the detailed view of the connection and start the purchase process by clicking on the ‘Tickets from CHF xx.xx’ button. Supersaver Class Upgrades are only valid in combination with a valid 2nd class ticket.                                               More information on Supersaver Class Upgrades

question: How can I use SBB Preview to buy tickets for other people?
answer: In the ticket options, you can enter the details of your travelling companions and add them in ‘Edit passengers’. The system saves the passenger details entered. This means that you can easily buy tickets for these people again in the future.

question: What is the fastest way to buy a ticket?
answer: As a general principle, you must approve every ticket purchase by clicking on the ‘Confirm purchase’ button. For payments of less than CHF 40, you can deactivate this additional confirmation. To do so, change the settings in the ‘Profile’ tab under ‘Settings for ticket purchase’.

question: Can I authorise ticket purchases by means of facial recognition / fingerprint?
answer: Yes. If your device has a fingerprint sensor or facial recognition, you can authorise ticket purchases with one of these two security elements. You can activate them in the ‘Profile’ tab under ‘Settings for ticket purchase’.

question: I have checked in. How can I present my EasyRide ticket for inspection?
answer: You can find all your purchased tickets in the ‘Tickets & Travelcards’ tab. To do so, switch to the ‘Tickets & Travelcards’ tab and select the ‘Valid’ tab there. Your EasyRide ticket will be displayed in the list of valid tickets once you have checked in. Tap the QR code icon on the far right to display the ticket for inspection.

question: Where can I find all further information on EasyRide?
answer: Go to EasyRide help

question: Where can I find my saved trips and travel information for tickets I have bought?
answer: Your saved trips and trips for which you have bought tickets are transferred to the ‘Trips’ tab. Here, relevant information will be provided to you throughout your journey. You can see the departure and arrival times, the departure platform, and you will receive information about disruptions during your journey – via push notification if necessary.

question: How long is a ticket purchased with SBB Preview valid for?
answer: Tickets purchased using SBB Preview are valid for the calendar day that was selected at the time of purchase for each journey made.  If you are not planning to return on the same day or by 5am the following day, please buy a single ticket for both journeys. Please note that regional transport tickets are limited to certain times and that supersaver tickets and Supersaver Class Upgrades are only valid for the connection selected.

question: Are tickets bought with the app transferable?
answer: No. Tickets bought with the app are personal and are not transferable. For this reason, you must present a valid form of personal ID (passport, ID card, driving licence Half Fare/GA Travelcard) during ticket inspection.

question: Can I change my e-mail address?
answer: You can edit your e-mail address in the ‘Profile’ tab under ‘Personal details’ and ‘Change login information’. To do this, click on ‘Change login e-mail’.

question: Which Apple devices are not compatible?
answer: iPhone, iPhone 3G, iPhone 3GS, iPhone 4, iPhone 4S, iPhone 5, iPhone 5c as well as iPad mini, iPad 1, iPad 2, iPad 3 and iPad 4 are no longer supported.

question: Why aren’t all Android versions supported?
answer: Operating systems older than Android 6.0 do not support the current security mechanisms for SBB Preview. Android 6.0 closed a range of gaps in security.

question: How can I buy a ticket for a dog or a bike using SBB Preview?
answer: You can easily add dogs and bikes to your order during the purchase process. The right ticket for your bike(s) and/or dog(s) will be added to the offer.

question: Can I change my password?
answer: You can change your password in the ‘Profile’ tab under ‘Personal details’ and ‘Change login information’. Then click on ‘Change password’.

question: How can I register travelling companions?
answer: You can enter travelling companions in the ‘Profile’ tab under ‘Co-passenger’. Enter the name, date of birth and any travelcards held by the co-passenger that you would like to register.

question: I have a question about SBB Preview in relation to the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS.
answer: You can find answers to your questions on the help page for the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS.                                             To the Half-Fare travelcard PLUS

question: Can I buy a one-month or one-year permit for each station on a short term basis?
answer: In order to avoid exceeding capacity, there may be waiting lists or other restrictions for P+Rail facilities with high demand (for example, a quota system, stopping sales during construction work, etc.). Please contact us promptly regarding the availability of one-month or one-year permits for your desired station. Likewise, the same applies if you would like to renew your permit.  One-month and one-year permits can be purchased up to two months in advance of the first day of validity. This is advantageous, especially for P+Rail facilities with high demand.

question: A newly entered number plate is not stored.
answer: Immediately after entering the number plate, click on the Enter/Return button on your keyboard and do NOT click on the back arrow in the top left-hand corner.

question: Why have I received a payment request for outstanding parking penalty?
answer: A payment request for outstanding parking penalty is issued for the following reasons:  Parking fee not paid or not paid correctly (e.g. wrong time, wrong registration number) Parked in reserved parking space Parked outside the parking area Two parking spaces occupied Parking time exceeded

question: Where can I pay with the P+Rail app?
answer: At P+Rail and Parkingpay locations throughout Switzerland. You can purchase parking tickets for over 590 P+Rail facilities in the app. The P+Rail facilities of the following transport companies are currently integrated: SBB, BLS, RBS, Zentralbahn and OeBB.  Over 740 additional car park locations throughout Switzerland have also been available since May 2021 thanks to the integration of Parkingpay. You can use the app wherever you see the blue Parkingpay stickers attached to the on-site parking meters. Select the specified postcode and zone in the app to start the parking procedure.

question: Why do I have to register? Isn’t entering my number plate enough?
answer: The P+Rail app uses the SwissPass login, the official public transport login.  As many of our customers already have this login, they benefit from the convenient transfer of their details and stored payment method. They also receive a personalised receipt which can be used for parking expense claims.

question: What parking offers are available and how can I purchase them?
answer: We offer tickets for hourly parking, P+Rail Day Passes and P+Rail Monthly and Annual Passes. A reservable parking space service is also available at 31 P+Rail locations. Purchasing options vary depending on the offer and the location.                                             Information on our P+Rail service offer

question: Do I have to register to use the P+Rail app?
answer: Yes. You have to log in to the app using a SwissPass login. If you already have a SwissPass login (e.g. for SBB Mobile or the SBB.ch webshop), you can use it to log in directly. Your stored details and payment method will then be conveniently transferred to the P+Rail app.  If you do not yet have a SwissPass login, you can obtain one free of charge in just a few clicks.                                             Go to SwissPass registration                         Link opens in new window.

question: What payment methods can I use?
answer: You can pay for your parking tickets with Mastercard, Visa, American Express, PostFinance Card, Reka, Diners Club, Twint and Apple Pay.

question: How far in advance can I purchase P+Rail tickets using the app?
answer: P+Rail tickets can generally be purchased up to seven days in advance.

question: Why was Parkingpay integrated into the SBB P+Rail app?
answer: As customers requested this directly, SBB added 740 locations with over 180,000 parking spaces throughout Switzerland to the 590 P+Rail locations in the app. This provides customers with an improved user experience.

question: Who should I contact if I encounter problems?
answer: You will find a contact form under ‘Feedback’ in the side menu. We will be happy to provide you with personal support.

question: Why is my P+Rail location not yet integrated into the app?
answer: In cooperation with other transport companies, we are doing our best to integrate as many P+Rail locations into the app as possible. Please contact us if you are not yet able to make reservations for your P+Rail location. We would be pleased to receive your feedback and suggestions under ‘Feedback’.

question: The app doesn’t work, won’t open or constantly crashes.
answer: Uninstall the app and download it again.  All versions older than V2.8.0 will no longer be supported as of 16 April 2021. You can view the version of your app in the bottom left-hand corner of the side menu (in the P+Rail App).

question: I don’t have a SwissPass/SwissPass card. Can I still log in?
answer: Yes. In the P+Rail app you just need a digital SwissPass login. This can be easily created in a few clicks by entering an e-mail address and some other required details. You don’t require a physical SwissPass card to create this kind of login.                                             Go to SwissPass registration                          Link opens in new window.

question: Which stations can I park at?
answer: You can park at one of over 600 P+Rail stations. An overview of available locations can be found at sbb.ch/en/parking.

question: Can I submit several registration numbers for a one-month or one-year permit (for my second car, for example)?
answer: You can enter two different registration numbers on your P+Rail Pass – so for example, one for your second car. You cannot change the car number(s) while the permit is valid. If you need to change your number, we offer an exchange (pro rata refund and new purchase).

question: Payment is not working.
answer: If the payment process cannot be completed, there is often an error with the payment provider. Delete the payment method in the ‘Edit payment method’ side menu (in the P+Rail App) and then add it again.

question: How far in advance can I buy a parking ticket?
answer: P+Rail tickets can generally be purchased up to seven days in advance. Parkingpay tickets can usually only be purchased for immediate use. No advance purchase can be made.

question: Am I guaranteed a free parking space?
answer: No, there is no guarantee that a free parking space will be available, even if you have a one-month or one-year permit or purchased the parking ticket in advance.

question: How can I pay the payment request for outstanding parking penalty?
answer: Most SBB P+Rail car parks are inspected by our subsidiary Transsicura.  To pay the parking penalty, scan the QR code on the payment request for outstanding parking penalty form. You will be taken directly to the payment page, where you can pay the CHF 40 penalty. Alternatively, you can also enter the number found on the payment request for outstanding parking penalty form at sbb.ch/en/gnf and pay the CHF 40 using one of the following payment methods: Mastercard, Visa, PostFinance, Amex, Reka, Diners or Twint.

question: How does the parking inspector know that I have purchased a parking ticket via the P+Rail app?
answer: The on-site inspector has a mobile solution to verify valid parking tickets by checking the number plate.

question: What are the conditions for purchasing a P+Rail one-month or one-year permit?
answer: P+Rail one-month or one-year permits can only be purchased if you hold a GA Travelcard or a monthly or annual public transport travelcard valid at the station in question (Point-to-Point Travelcard, Regional Travelcard, Modular Travelcard). Depending on how busy the facility is, a minimum price or minimum distance can also be defined for this.

question: Where can I download the SBB P+Rail app?
answer: You can find the SBB P+Rail app in the Apple App Store and on Google Play. ‎Go to the P+Rail in the App Store (apple.com)Link opens in new window. Go to the P+Rail app on Google PlayLink opens in new window.

question: What does P+Rail mean?
answer: P+Rail stands for ‘Park and Rail’. P+Rail facilities – also sometimes called P+Ride – refer to car parks located directly at railway stations. The name was chosen because these parking facilities are predominantly used by rail customers who park their private motor vehicles and then travel by train.  The P+Rail app was named after this original area of application. However, Parkingpay car parking spaces can now also be paid for via the P+Rail app. Its scope of application now goes far beyond P+Rail.

question: Can I reserve a parking space with the P+Rail app?
answer: No. You can only buy parking tickets in the app. By purchasing a valid parking ticket, you receive the entitlement to park, but you are not guaranteed an available parking space. That is why we recommend purchasing your parking ticket immediately after parking your vehicle.

question: Is my data secure on the SBB P+Rail app?
answer: Yes. SBB attaches great importance to the protection your privacy. SBB ensures compliance with the legal data protection provisions in accordance with the Federal Act on Data Protection (FADP). More information on data protection can be found in our General Terms and Conditions.

question: Is the P+Rail app free?
answer: Yes. The app is available for iOS and Android and can be downloaded free of charge via the AppStore or the Google PlayStore.

question: Can I extend my parking ticket?
answer: The answer to this question depends on whether you have purchased a P+Rail ticket or a Parkingpay ticket. Yes, for P+Rail tickets. You can extend currently active P+Rail tickets at any time up to a maximum of seven days of validity.  No, for Parkingpay tickets. You cannot extent currently active Parkingpay tickets. However, you can terminate currently active Parkingpay tickets early at any time. In this case you will only be charged for the actual parking duration.

question: Why are there different booking processes for P+Rail and Parkingpay parking spaces?
answer: The two booking processes are currently optimised to meet the needs of their respective users. P+Rail: planned ticket purchase for switching to rail travel at a location known in advance. You search for the location in the app using the station name. Parkingpay: ad hoc ticket purchase in line with the parking procedure. Blue stickers specifying the postcode and zone are attached to the on-site parking meters. You search for the location in the app using these numbers. The parking procedure is then started.  Based on customer feedback, modification/harmonisation of the two booking processes for P+Rail and Parkingpay locations will be taken into account in future.

question: Can I also purchase a P+Rail Annual or Monthly Pass via the app?
answer: No. P+Rail Annual and Monthly Passes cannot currently be purchased via the app.

question: How much does a parking ticket cost and what is the maximum period I can park for?
answer: This varies from location to location. You can select a location via the search field in the app and obtain information about the applicable tariff and maximum parking duration. Before buying a parking ticket, the costs are calculated for you (at the selected location and for the applicable period). This means you will know the final costs before purchasing the ticket and so can avoid any unpleasant surprises.

question: What is the difference between P+Rail and Parkingpay parking spaces? Do I need to know the difference?
answer: No. You don’t generally have to worry about the difference. When purchasing tickets for the various parking spaces, you’ll just notice a few differences in the booking process.  Tickets for P+Rail parking spaces can be purchased up to 7 days in advance. There is also the option of subsequently extending them. Tickets for Parkingpay parking spaces can only be purchased through a check-in/check-out system. You start the parking process directly and enter an end time. The parking duration cannot be extended. However, you can terminate currently active Parkingpay tickets early at any time. In this case you will only be charged for the actual parking duration.

question: Can I store several number plates?
answer: Yes. You can enter several number plates in the side menu under ‘Edit registration plate number’ (in the P+Rail App).

question: The purchase button is grey and I cannot complete the purchase.
answer: Please select a number plate and a payment method.

question: Can I purchase another parking ticket for the same period even if I already have an active ticket for a different number plate?
answer: Yes. You can purchase or have several parking tickets active simultaneously at the same or a different location.  All purchased P+Rail tickets can be viewed in the P+Rail App on the homescreen while they are valid and additionally in the side menu under ‘My car park tickets’ afterwards.

question: Do I receive a receipt after paying for my parking ticket?
answer: Yes. You receive a receipt sent to the e-mail address stored on your profile. You can find an overview of your valid and expired parking tickets under ‘My car park tickets’ in the side menu (in the P+Rail App). The receipt for P+Rail tickets is sent to you directly after purchasing the ticket.  The receipt Parkingpay tickets is only sent to you once the parking ticket has expired (since you can stop the parking procedure early at any time).

question: How can I distinguish between P+Rail and Digitalparking parking spaces in the app?
answer: All car park locations can be found using the search function. These facilities are labelled with either the P+Rail logo or the Parkingpay logo so they can be clearly distinguished.

question: Are additional costs incurred when purchasing tickets for Parkingpay parking spaces?
answer: SBB acts as an intermediary for the sale of Parkingpay tickets. The conditions stipulated by Parkingpay (Digitalparking AG) apply. Extract from Digitalparking’s FAQ: “As a rule, the same tariffs apply for the parking meter/cash register. Where explicitly indicated, surcharges are applicable on the parking spaces of specific operators (e.g. Geneva) and/or for the use of certain Parkingpay functions (e.g. individual charges on the means of payment).” The actual costs are clearly indicated for the user at all times in the P+Rail app.                                              pakingpay.ch                         Link opens in new window.

question: How can I ensure that SBB FreeSurf won’t use mobile data before I connect?
answer: If a customer is charged according to data usage or has a limited data contract, and would like to avoid automatic generation of mobile data:  iOS: in settings, deactivate “Background App Refresh” for all apps to ensure no unwanted data volumes are used in the background before the FreeSurf app is active. Android: in settings, deactivate “Data Saving” for all apps so that no data volumes are used in the background. If you have a prepaid subscription, an amount may be deducted from the credit balance as soon as mobile services are activated in line with the conditions of the pre-paid subscription. Those registered for FreeSurf can use the app even if they have no credit on their account. Stop the FreeSurf connection before leaving the train and do not wait for the text from the mobile network provider informing you that the free service has been terminated.

question: Why are international trains equipped with WiFi?
answer: In contrast to Switzerland, railways abroad often operate on routes that travel through areas with poor coverage. Using WiFi makes sense in this situation because a router pools the existing mobile networks of different providers. The internet connection therefore improves and any gaps in the coverage of individual providers can be balanced out.

question: What exactly is SBB FreeSurf?
answer: With SBB FreeSurf, customers of participating mobile network providers can browse the web for free. SBB takes on the connection costs during journeys on long-distance services within Switzerland. All information is available online: sbb.ch/en/freesurf.

question: Why does SBB not offer WiFi on trains for national longdistance services?
answer: WiFi on trains cannot be compared to WiFi at home. On trains, data is transmitted via the mobile phone network, while a fibre optic network is used at home, which significantly increases the speed. SBB FreeSurf is built upon the excellent mobile phone coverage in Switzerland and offers customers a faster and smoother internet connection with more bandwidth compared to WiFi on a train. Installing WiFi on a train acts like an additional bottleneck because the signals of many users have to be combined and transmitted to the mobile network using just a few connections.  SBB FreeSurf is the more powerful, technology-independent and cost-effective solution compared to WiFi.

question: Which devices are not supported?
answer: Laptops with a SIM card cannot be used (as opposed to tablets and iPads). It is possible to set up a hotspot via your mobile phone to secure internet access on your laptop.

question: There is something wrong with the mobile bill. The costs of browsing the web are too high.
answer: Customers must direct their queries regarding billing to their mobile network provider. SBB only provides the triage system and the notification for activating the data volume during the journey on the train using SBB FreeSurf.

question: The data usage displayed on the smartphone is too high.
answer: The smartphone always displays the data volume used both during FreeSurf sessions and outside of these sessions. The FreeSurf app cannot influence this. The important thing is that no data volume is charged by the provider or deducted from a data package for the duration of the FreeSurf sessions. You can verify this in the provider’s cockpit.

question: What about other mobile network retailers such as M-Budget, Aldi, Coop etc.?
