Battery consumption depends on a range of factors, not all of which relate to the app, however. Using location tracking services, particularly GPS, increases battery usage. However, additional battery usage is kept to a minimum. When the app detects that the smartphone’s location is not changing, the app requests its location less frequently, saving battery power.

question: Why does the app only work on SBB’s long-distance trains?
answer: SBB has no influence over whether other mobility service providers install beacons in their vehicles. At present, SBB only has a secure and reliable source of data for its own facilities and services. SBB is currently testing equipping its regional fleet with the necessary technology.

question: What exactly is SBB Inclusive?
answer: With the SBB Inclusive app, people who are blind or visually impaired can receive relevant and location-based timetable information. At the station, the user is shown the next departures and can view the current departures for a given platform. Shortly after boarding an SBB long-distance train with the app open on their phone, the user will be shown which train they have boarded (train number, destination, coach number, class of travel, service zone, next stop).  The app currently works at all Swiss railway stations and on all SBB long-distance trains. Please continue to use the SBB Mobile app to plan your journeys.

question: What exactly do I need in order to use SBB Inclusive?
answer: A smartphone on which the SBB Inclusive app can be installed. In terms of operating systems, the iPhone requires iOS 14.0 or later, and Android should be 5.0 or later. To use the functions of the app, mobile data and GPS must be activated (at least when using the app), as must Bluetooth.

question: How can I give feedback?
answer: Direct in the app via the contact form. Or alternatively, use the feedback form at the bottom of this page.

question: When boarding the train, the app does not work, or only does so slowly.
answer: Experience has shown that the app works faster and more reliably if you switch off the free SBB wireless internet at the station and use mobile data instead. You should also make sure that your Bluetooth is activated.

question: Sitting on the train, I go to the “At the station” tab. Sometimes it shows me a previous station. What do I have to do to update the station?
answer: The GPS information is provided by the device. If the localisation data does not update itself, there is nothing we can do in terms of the app. Since the train also functions like a Faraday cage, finding your location when on the train is harder than when you are at the station. You can find out what GPS data your device is currently using by opening a map application (e.g. Google Maps) and allowing it to locate you.

question: Does the app help me to find my bearings at the station (station type: terminus, through-platform station, several floors etc. / facilities: stairs, lifts, escalators)?
answer: This information is currently not available. The focus of the app is the digitalisation of customer information, rather than getting around the railway station. The app in no way replaces training with navigation and mobility trainers.

question: Can I make a purchase without a login?
answer: Yes, you can also make a purchase as a guest without a login.

question: How do I redeem a promotional code?
answer: You can redeem your promotional code in the relevant field in the shopping cart. Your discount will then be automatically deducted from the sum of the order. Please note that there are also promotional codes which are only valid for ticket purchases on SBB.ch or SBB Mobile.

question: Can I pay by invoice if I have different delivery and billing addresses?
answer: No. Invoices are only available as payment methods if delivery and billing addresses are identical.

question: What are the shipping costs?
answer: From an order value of CHF 50, shipping is free of charge. Under CHF 50, the shipping cost is CHF 7.90.

question: Do you also deliver abroad?
answer: No, we only deliver to addresses in Switzerland and the Principality of Liechtenstein.

question: What can I see in my customer account?
answer: When you sign in with SwissPass, you can see your orders in your customer account (except for public transport tickets), your billing and delivery address and your saved payment methods.

question: What payment methods do you offer?
answer: In the SBB Shop, the following payment methods are available: PostFinance Card, Mastercard, American Express, Visa, PayPal, Twint, payment by invoice (except for vouchers and services). Please note that there are restrictions on payment methods for certain products, in particular currency exchange.                                              Payment methods available for ordering currency

question: Who pays for the return of the items?
answer: Normally, the shipping costs for the return are charged to the sender.

question: Can I only sign in with a SwissPass login?
answer: Yes, you can only sign in using a SwissPass login. Your address is taken from the SwissPass data, meaning that you do not need to enter your delivery address again.

question: Can I return items purchased in the SBB Shop at the station?
answer: No, unfortunately you cannot return articles bought online at the station.

question: Can I list separate delivery addresses?
answer: Yes, you can list different delivery addresses and select them individually every time you order. When purchasing foreign currency online (SBB Change), you cannot use a delivery address which is different to your billing address for compliance reasons.

question: How can I access the SBB shop?
answer: You can find the SBB online shop via the following link:                                             commerce.sbb.ch                         Link opens in new window.

question: Do I have the right to return products that I have ordered?
answer: You can give back the item within 14 days of receipt as long as it has not been used and remains in the original packaging.  You do not have the right to return gift cards, vouchers, SIM cards, eSIMs, foreign currency, insurance and food. Should you only wish to return Mondaine watches and clocks, you can return the product to the following address in the original packaging: SBB Personenverkehr Drittgeschäft Trüsselstrasse 2 3000 Bern 65 If you wish to return other items, you can send them to the following address: Pandinavia Logistikcenter  c/o Markus Flühmann AG  SBB-Shop – Lager  Rigistrasse 20  5634 Merenschwand  For a full refund of the purchase price to be granted, the article must be unopened and in the original undamaged packaging. If the article has been opened or used, or if the item or the packaging arrives damaged, there will be a deduction from the purchase price (at least 10% or minimum deduction of CHF 10).

question: Are all products immediately available?
answer: The availability of the products is shown with a traffic light code. Products that are immediately available are usually delivered within 2 to 5 working days after receipt of the order. If this is not possible, you will be notified accordingly. You cannot cancel your purchase because of extended delivery times.

question: What delivery options are available?
answer: Every physical product from the SBB Shop will be sent via A Most or PostPac Priority.  Foreign currency is delivered by A Mail Plus. This means consignment tracking is possible.

question: Can I also have my product delivered to a station?
answer: No, the Click & Collect option at a station is unfortunately not available at the moment.

question: What can I buy or order in the SBB shop?
answer: In the SBB shop, you can buy and order the following items and services:  Foreign currencies at the Currency exchangeLink opens in new window. Door-to-door luggage Link opens in new window.  Travel supplies and accessoriesLink opens in new window. Products from the SBB collectionLink opens in new window. SBB station clocks and watches from MondaineLink opens in new window. Home & lifestyleLink opens in new window. Vouchers and gift cardsLink opens in new window. Public transport letter of coverLink opens in new window. Annual travel insuranceLink opens in new window.

question: Why do I have to enter my telephone number?
answer: Your telephone number makes it easier for us to get in contact with you quickly in case we have questions about your order.

question: Why can I not use any payment method to buy foreign currency?
answer: Due to financial regulations, there are several payment methods that we cannot accept for purchasing foreign currency.                                              Go to accepted payment methods

question: I have a question about my invoice. Who can I contact?
answer: If you have selected ‘Invoice’ as your payment method, get in contact with our partner CembraPay directly. Please send your question to customer-care@cembrapay.chLink opens in new window. or call +41 44 551 46 70.

question: I have received a damaged item or the wrong item. What do I need to do?
answer: You need to check the item delivered thoroughly upon receipt. You must also document any objections in detail and attach a note when you send the item back. The same applies to deliveries of the wrong items or incomplete deliveries. SBB will deliver a fully functional replacement product in exchange or refund the purchase price upon return of the goods.  Include a note in the package you send back, clearly stating your name, your order number, the reason for the return and the steps you would like to be taken. If you are returning a Mondaine watch or clock, please send it to the following address: SBB Personenverkehr Drittgeschäft Trüsselstrasse 2 3000 Bern 65 The following address should be used for all other items: Pandinavia Logistikcenter  c/o Markus Flühmann AG  SBB-Shop – Lager  Rigistrasse 20  5634 Merenschwand

question: My Mondaine watch or clock isn’t working. What can I do?
answer: You can send the broken watch or clock with a description of the defect to the following address: Remonta AG Service Center Mondaine Hunnenweg 4 4503 Solothurn Tel. 058 666 86 68 repair.service@mondaine.chLink opens in new window. If the repair is still within the warranty period, please be sure to include the warranty certificate. If the warranty period has expired, you will be charged the repair costs by Mondaine or Remonta.

question: How can I follow the status of my order?
answer: If you ordered the item while logged in, you can follow the status of your order at any time under My Account and My Orders.

question: How can I change my billing address?
answer: Go to swisspass.chLink opens in new window., log in and select ‘Change address’. The address change also applies to the SBB Shop.

question: Where can I find the expected delivery date?
answer: All products shown are available for delivery and will normally be delivered in two to five working days from receipt of the order. If this is not possible, you will be notified accordingly.

question: Do I have to label the luggage?
answer: Yes. Every luggage item being transported must be labelled with your name, address and telephone number. We provide you with downloadable luggage labels for this purpose.                                        Downloads.                                            Download luggage label. (PDF, 76 KB)                                                                                                                            Download                 The link destination will be opened in an external application or a new window (PDF, 76 KB)             Link opens in new window.

question: Can I send luggage even if I am not travelling by train?
answer: The shipping of luggage is only possible with a valid ticket for the entire transport route or with a valid annual travelcard (GA Travelcard, Half Fare Travelcard, Point-to-Point Travelcard, Regional Travelcard, GA Travelcard for SBB employees, Night GA Travelcard, Modular Travelcard) and is not possible if it involves commercial consignments and private consignments unrelated to travel (e.g. shipping of goods sold/ordered, merchandise, removals, etc.).

question: Can I also have luggage collected from an address abroad?
answer: This is not possible. Service points are postal addresses in Switzerland and Liechtenstein that can be accessed directly via a road suitable for vehicles. Otherwise, the carrier shall define a suitable handover location when giving notification the day before.

question: How do I know the best place to get on the train with my luggage?
answer: The best thing to do is check which coaches on the train are the least busy before boarding (those with the fewest little figures). Then wait at the appropriate place on the platform. This will give you the best chance to find a place for yourself and your luggage. Suitcase pictograms on the train also indicate luggage racks. Here’s how to get to the occupancy forecast on SBB.ch:  Search for your connection in the online timetable. Click on the connection and then on ‘Show train information’. Find the coach that is most empty and wait for the train to arrive in the appropriate place on the platform. (Please note that the actual train formation is only shown on the day itself.)  Here’s how to get to the occupancy forecast in the SBB Mobile app:                                             Show train information

question: Can I check in a bike or special bike as luggage too?
answer: Yes. Bicycles, bicycle trailers and e-bikes, as well as special bikes such as tandems, recumbent bikes and three-wheelers, can be transported from station to station and from door to door within Switzerland and Liechtenstein.  Bicycles, maximum dimensions: 2m long, 0.8m wide, 1m tall. Children’s seats, luggage racks and bike baskets must be empty.  E-bikes, maximum dimensions: 2m long, 0.8m wide, 1m tall. The battery does not need to be removed for transport. Spare batteries and accumulators must be carried in hand luggage and may not be checked in as luggage. Children’s seats, luggage racks and bike baskets must be empty.  Special bikes, maximum dimensions: 2.4m long, 0.9m wide, 1.1m tall. Bicycle trailers must not be loaded and can only weigh a maximum of 25kg. Cargo bicycles are excluded due to their dimensions and weight. Each bike must be labelled with your name, address and telephone number. Each bike must be packed in your own cover or the cover of the transport company. All types of bicycle can only be checked in for delivery unlocked. Locked bicycles are not accepted.  Go to check-in and collection stations Go to the shop for booking door-to-door transportLink opens in new window. Go to bicycle shipping

question: In the event of a delay, who is liable and what is the procedure?
answer: Procedure if luggage has not yet been collected or delivered. Contact the SBB Contact Center on +41 (0)848 44 66 88 (CHF 0.08/min.) so that the issue can be investigated immediately. SBB luggage dispatch or the carrier will contact you directly within 2 hours. Liability in general. Liability for partial or total loss, damage and delayed delivery of luggage shall be governed by the Swiss Federal Passenger Transport Act (PTA) and the applicable Passenger Transport Ordinance of the Swiss Federal Council. This matter is also described in Tariff 602 Luggage. Liability in the event of delays. In the event of a delay in delivery, the transport company is liable for any proven damage, with receipts provided for emergency purchases of urgently needed clothing and toiletries and for bicycle, ski or skiing equipment rental. This can be up to CHF 200 per item per 24 hour period, or part thereof, that the delivery time is exceeded, but for no longer than 14 days (maximum liability up to CHF 2,000, analogous to that for total loss). Procedure. If you wish to report claims for emergency purchases or the rental of replacement equipment, submit your claim together with all receipts within 7 days of receipt.                                             Link to the damaged luggage form                                                                Please note: complaints about the transport of your luggage – such as collection or delivery periods not being adhered to, lack of notification, or delays (not involving emergency purchases or rental of replacement equipment) – should be submitted using the complaints form.                                             Link to the complaints form

question: Why is the ‘luggage special’ not displayed on the offer page?
answer: To check whether holiday accommodation or a destination is included in the ‘luggage special’ when you are in the SBB shop, you must enter the holiday accommodation or destination in the ‘From’ or ‘To’ field on the home page.  You then need to select the accommodation from the drop-down menu to make sure the ‘luggage special’ is displayed on the offer page. You can then book the offer.    In some holiday destinations, the ‘luggage special’ can be booked to all addresses. In this case, you only need to enter the town (Ardez, Brail, Braunwald, Ftan, Fuldera, Guarda, Lavin, Lü, Martina, Mürren, Müstair, Ramosch, Samnaun-Compatsch, Samnaun-Dorf, Santa Maria Val Müstair, Scuol, Sent, Strada, Susch, Tarasp-Vulpera, Tschierv, Tschlin, Valchava, Vnà, Zernez).

question: Where can I stow my luggage on the train?
answer: In general on trains. The easiest and most secure place to stow your luggage on the move is in the space between and under the seats. That way, you can keep an eye on it at all times. It also means you keep both the walkways and the seats clear. There is a luggage rack above the seats where you can stow smaller items of luggage, such as backpacks and handbags. This video is provided by a third-party platform (www.youtube.com). To play the video, accept marketing cookies in the cookie settings then reload the page. Go to the cookie settings Load and play video.   On double-deck trains (long-distance double-deck trains, IC2000, IR double-deck trains). There is a luggage rack for stowing items of luggage at the top of the stairs leading to the upper deck. If you are travelling with luggage as a family, you can find multi-functional compartments with space to stow luggage in the lower deck of the family coach (recognisable by its jungle or dragon motifs). On the lower deck of the IC2000, you will find enough space to stow pushchairs, luggage or bikes. Trains with family coaches run mainly on the following InterCity routes: IC1: St. Gallen–Zurich HB–Bern–Geneva Airport IC8: Romanshorn–Zurich HB–Bern–Brig IC6: Basel SBB–Bern–Brig IC61: Basel SBB–Bern–Interlaken Ost IC3: Basel SBB–Zurich HB–Chur  Folding seats on long-distance double-deck trains. In several compartments on long-distance double-deck trains, folding seats are available. They can be found both on the lower deck of the family coach with the playing area and in the compartments with a pushchair signet on the door. Look at the info sticker on the window when you are in the compartment itself. If you are travelling as a family, you will find space for pushchairs and luggage there. IC2000 Modernised IC2000 LD double-decker Tips: If the multi-functional compartment fills up or is already full, please place your luggage under the seats and in the dedicated luggage racks. If you are planning a journey with luggage in advance, it is worth taking a look at our luggage services.  Luggage services Image legend: Luggage rack for stowing items of luggage at the top of the stairs leading to the upper deck of long-distance double-deck trains. Image legend: Luggage rack for stowing items of luggage in the “Giruno” train.

question: What objects cannot be transported?
answer: Objects which cannot be transported under Tariff 602 Luggage. Extract from the tariff conditions: items at particular risk of damage, e.g. televisions, computers, laptops, furniture, cameras and mobile phones, precious metals, jewellery, watches, gemstones, cash, securities, cheque books, identity documents and similar documents, moving boxes, containers of any kind, fragile items, works of art, antiques. This list is by no means exhaustive. For luggage with check-in, the provisions of the respective airline also apply.

question: Can bicycles, bicycle trailers, e-bikes and special bikes be transported to all localities in Switzerland and Liechtenstein?
answer: For logistical reasons, door-to-door delivery or collection of bicycles, bicycle trailers, e-bikes and special bikes is not possible for the following locations:  Belalp/Tschuggen Fiescheralp Melchsee-Frutt Lauchernalp Saas-Fee Stoos Zermatt  We can offer collection from your home for delivery to the train station nearest the location. Return shipping from the station to your home is not currently available for booking in the online shop. For the return journey, please go directly to the station to register your bike and luggage. You will pay at the station.

question: What luggage services does SBB offer?
answer: SBB offers the following services for you to register luggage:  from station to station. from door to door. from station to door. from door to station. flight luggage with or without check-in to/from Zurich Airport.  Go to luggage offers and prices  Go to flight luggage offers and prices

question: Can I stow my luggage at the station?
answer: You can either lock your luggage in a locker at the station or have it stored at an SBB Travel Centre.                                             Go to lockers and luggage deposit

question: Who is liable if items go missing, and what is the procedure?
answer: Procedure if luggage has not yet been collected or delivered. Contact the SBB Contact Center on +41 (0)848 44 66 88 (CHF 0.08/min.) so that the issue can be investigated immediately. SBB luggage dispatch or the carrier will contact you directly within 2 hours. Liability in general. Liability for partial or total loss, damage and delayed delivery of luggage shall be governed by the Swiss Federal Passenger Transport Act (PTA) and the applicable Passenger Transport Ordinance of the Swiss Federal Council. This matter is also described in Tariff 602 Luggage. Liability for lost items. In the event of an item being lost, the transport company shall be liable for the verifiable value of the lost item and its contents, as well as for the value of replacement and emergency purchases made during the loss period, up to a maximum of CHF 2,000 per item. Procedure. In the case of missing items, a missing luggage report is generated by the relevant office; this launches a search.  If the item be found within 14 days, the liability provisions for a delay will apply. If your item has not been found within a 14-day period, the item will be considered lost. In this case, you will receive a notification of total loss. Submit the loss and all related replacement and emergency purchases up to the amount of CHF 2,000 together with all receipts within seven days of receiving the notification of total loss.                                              Link to the damaged luggage form

question: What is the maximum weight for luggage?
answer: Maximum weight for luggage and ski equipment: 23kg.

question: How long do I have to change or cancel my luggage order?
answer: You can make cancellations by calling the SBB Contact Center on +41 (0)848 44 66 88 (CHF 0.08/min.) by 8pm two days before shipping for a handling fee of CHF 10. In the event of cancellations after 8pm two days prior to collection, additional fees of up to 100% of the price will be charged. You can make changes, for example to the number of luggage items and the collection or delivery address, until 8pm two days before shipping. Changes can only be made after 8pm two days before shipping by arrangement with the responsible transport company.

question: If an item has been damaged, who is liable and what is the procedure?
answer: Liability in general. Liability for partial or total loss, damage and delayed delivery of luggage shall be governed by the Swiss Federal Passenger Transport Act (PTA) and the applicable Passenger Transport Ordinance of the Swiss Federal Council. This matter is also described in Tariff 602 Luggage. Liability for damage. If damage has occurred, the transport company shall be liable for any proven damage up to the amount of CHF 2,000 per item. In case of partial damage, compensation for repair costs – for bicycles, for example – is provided in line with the repair quote and up to the sum given above. Procedure. Notify us of damage claims within 7 days of receipt of the items using the luggage damage form. Please include photographs.                                             Link to the luggage damage form

question: Can I check in and pick up luggage at any station?
answer: No, it is only possible at selected stations. You can find out if that includes your station of choice from our list.                                             Go to check-in and collection stations

question: How long will it take for your luggage to be delivered?
answer: The delivery times for receiving your luggage are calculated according to the transport route. You can calculate how long it will take using the luggage timeframe calculator. Please always check the luggage counter opening hours for the check-in and collection stations. (Tip: search for ‘luggage’ in the search bar on the relevant station page.) Go to the luggage timeframe calculatorLink opens in new window. Go to the flight luggage timeframe calculator Go to stations and opening hours

question: Are there luggage offers for groups?
answer: If you are travelling within Switzerland as a group of 10 or more people and would like to check in luggage or bikes, you can benefit from various luggage services.                                             Go to luggage transport for groups

question: What should I do if my luggage is not collected and/or delivered as I ordered?
answer: Contact the SBB Contact Center on +41 (0)848 44 66 88 (CHF 0.08/min.) so that they can start to look into this right away. SBB luggage dispatch or the carrier will contact you directly within 1 hour.

question: Is there an automatic debit when the locker rental is automatically extended?
answer: No. You are debited at the end of the rental period.

question: What types of lockers are there at which stations?
answer: There are three types of lockers. You can find out which types of lockers are located at which stations here:A                                             Go to the locations of the different locker types

question: Can I still pay for the lockers with coins?
answer: A small number of lockers currently accept cash. In future, all lockers will no longer accept cash. However, you can still pay for your luggage storage in cash at the SBB Travel Centre.  Go to the lockers Go to luggage storage for large luggage

question: How much does a locker cost?
answer: The cost of renting a locker depends on the size of the locker. Search for your desired station at sbb.ch/en/lockers and check the prices for your location. Go to the lockers Go to luggage storage for large luggage

question: How can I store my luggage at the station if I don’t have a smartphone?
answer: New lockers (red/grey). You don’t need a smartphone for the payment. The new lockers accept CHF coins, Maestro, PostFinance Card, V Pay, Mastercard, Visa, American Express, myOne, Diners, Twint, JCB, Apple Pay, Samsung Pay and SBB gift cards. Blue lockers (cash payment). You don’t need a smartphone for the payment. The blue lockers (cash) accept CHF coins. Blue lockers (digital). Payment is made via your smartphone. Alternatively, you can use the staffed luggage storage service at the SBB Travel Centre and pay by card or cash.                                              More information on luggage storage at SBB Travel Centres

question: How can I rent a locker?
answer: New lockers (red/grey). Here’s how it works:  Place your luggage in an empty locker. Close the door until it clicks into place (you will hear a click). Pay the amount shown on the screen. Remove the receipt with the QR code and keep it. To collect your luggage, scan the QR code.  Blue lockers (digital). The following video explains how you can rent a blue digital locker:                                                                                                     Scan the QR code on the locker system with your smartphone.  Select a locker.  Enter a valid mobile phone number and e-mail address. Pay the locker rental fee.  Open the locker and place your luggage in it.  To collect your luggage, select the link you received by text message or e-mail. The door will open.  Blue locker (with cash).  Place your luggage in an empty locker.  Close the door. Pay the amount indicated using cash. Turn the key, take it out and keep it in a safe place. To collect your luggage, open the locker with the key.

question: Where can I see the locker opening times?
answer: Each SBB station has different locker opening times. Search for your desired station on SBB.ch. The location-specific opening times are displayed there. Go to the stations Go to the lockers Go to luggage storage for large luggage

question: Can I use several lockers at the same time?
answer: Yes. You can use several lockers at the same time.  Please note that you can only rent one locker at a time. If you would like to rent several lockers, rent them one after the other.

question: What happens to my locker rental when the 6 hours are up?
answer: New lockers (red/grey) and blue lockers (digital). Locker rental is automatically extended every 6 hours and is subject to a fee. An additional fee will be charged each time. The locker remains locked.  Blue lockers (cash payment). Additional payment fees will be charged. The locker remains locked until the fees have been paid.  Please note that the blue lockers (cash payment) are emptied after 72 hours. Contact the SBB Travel Centre.

question: I stored something in a locker. Can someone else collect the contents for me?
answer: New lockers (red/grey) and blue lockers (digital). Yes, this is possible if you provide the collection code to the person collecting the items.  Please note that the storage / handing over of illegal goods is not permitted.  Blue lockers (cash payment). Contactless handing over of goods is not possible.

question: Why do I have to provide my e-mail address and mobile phone number?
answer: You will receive the collection code and the link to open the locker by e-mail and text message.

question: Will my data be passed on to third parties?
answer: No.  Please note that if the lockers are used illegally, the data may be passed on to the police.

question: Can I pay for my locker rental when I’m on the go?
answer: No, because you only need to pay at the end of your locker rental. The rental is cancelled with the additional payment, and you can open the locker.

question: How long will my data be stored?
answer: SBB is subject to a retention obligation and stores sales data for at least 10 years.                                             More information                         Link opens in new window.

question: What locker sizes are there?
answer: Different locker sizes are available depending on the SBB station. Search for your desired station on SBB.ch. The location-specific locker sizes are displayed there.  Go to the stations Go to the lockers Go to luggage storage for large luggage

question: What is the maximum time I can store my luggage in the locker?
answer: New lockers (red/grey): max. 96 hours. Blue lockers (digital): max. 96 hours. Blue lockers (cash payment): max. 72 hours.                                              More information on rental periods and types of lockers

question: If I cancel my locker rental early, will I get a refund of some of the price I have paid?
answer: No. No amounts will be refunded.

question: My smartphone has run out of battery and I can’t open the locker. What now?
answer: Applies only to blue lockers (digital): You can also open the locker using another device because the collection code is always sent to you by e-mail as well as by text message. For example, you can use your laptop or someone else’s smartphone. Here’s how it works:  Log in to your e-mail account on another device. Retrieve the collection code in the e-mail.  You can open the blue lockers (cash payment) and the new lockers (red/grey) without a smartphone.

question: Does SBB exclude liability if my luggage is damaged?
answer: Yes. SBB is not liable for the loss of or damage to the items stored.

question: I can’t operate the lockers myself. Where can I leave my luggage at the station?
answer: You can either use the staffed luggage storage facilities at the SBB Travel Centre or request assistance from the SBB Contact Center Handicap, who can help you use the lockers.  More information on luggage storage in the SBB Travel Centre More information on the SBB Contact Center Handicap

question: Will my data be used for marketing purposes?
answer: No.

question: Why can I not use any payment method to buy foreign currency?
answer: Due to financial regulations, there are several payment methods that we cannot accept for purchasing foreign currency.                                              Go to accepted payment methods

question: Can I choose the note denominations I receive?
answer: We will do our best to meet your requests regarding note denominations (by providing notes of high value or a mix of high and low value notes) depending on availability. Just tell us what suits you best when you exchange currency at the counter or order online.

question: What fees apply when exchanging currency?
answer: Currency exchange at SBB Change or online always costs CHF 4, whatever the sum you buy. Additional shipping costs are changed in some cases. Fees when you order at the counter.  Pick up at a counter: CHF 4 fee. Free if you hold a GA Travelcard. Delivery to your address: CHF 4 fee (if you do not hold a GA Travelcard).  Fees when you order online.  Delivery to an SBB salespoint: CHF 4 fee. Delivery to your address: CHF 4 fee.

question: Where can I change currency?
answer: You can change money directly at the SBB Change counter or order online.                                             Find stations with SBB Change

question: Where can I find SBB Change opening hours?
answer: Follow the link below and type in the name of the station you are interested in. You will then see an overview of the services provided at each station and the corresponding opening hours.                                             Go to the opening hours

question: Are all currencies immediately available when you order online?
answer: When you order online, only currencies which are available immediately are shown. If you require other currencies, please contact our specialists by phone. 0800 007 107 (free of charge) Monday–Friday 8 am–7 pm Saturday 9 am–6 pm                                             Currencies available when you order online                         Link opens in new window.

question: How can I pay for currency exchange?
answer: Payment methods accepted at SBB Change counters: Cash and debit cards. Payment methods not accepted at SBB Change counters: Credit cards, Reka Cheques and SBB gift cards. Order online with delivery to your address:  For the product “home delivery”, payment can be made in advance (up to CHF 1500) or by PostFinance Card, MasterCard and Visa (up to CHF 700).  For the product “collection”, payment can be made at the counter in cash or with any common debit card.  Credit cards and Reka Cards are not accepted.

question: What services does SBB Change offer?
answer: You can find the most important information on our currency exchange page.                                             Go to SBB Change                         Link opens in new window.

question: Which foreign currencies are available?
answer: You can obtain currencies for over 100 countries at around 150 SBB salespoints If a currency is not available at the station, we will send it straight to your house as soon as possible.                                             Currencies available when you order online                         Link opens in new window.

question: Is it possible to cancel a foreign currency order online?
answer: If foreign currency has been ordered and paid for, cancellation is generally not possible. If a mistake has obviously been made, cancellations are possible as a goodwill gesture – if the foreign currency has not yet been sent out. SBB reserves the right not to buy back some exotic currencies. You may be charged for any loss of value due to exchange rate fluctuations. To cancel an order, contact the following office giving your reference and order numbers: Zürich HB Travel Centre Telephone 051 285 12 12 change.zuerich-hb@sbb.chLink opens in new window.

question: How long does it take to send currency to my address?
answer: The foreign currency ordered will be delivered using A-Post Plus. If your payment is received immediately, foreign currency will generally reach you within two to three days.

question: I have ordered the wrong currency. What can I do?
answer: You can exchange the foreign currency you bought back into Swiss francs at a local SBB station at the purchase rate. This can be done for most foreign currencies without a problem. However, SBB reserves the right not to exchange some exotic currencies.                                             Find stations near you

question: Where can I view the up-to-date currency exchange rate?
answer: Go to currency exchange rates:                                             commerce.sbb.ch/sbb-change-home-delivery                         Link opens in new window.

question: I have questions about Western Union. Who can I contact?
answer: You can find information about sending cash with Western Union and contact details on our Western Union page.                                             Go to Western Union

question: How do I obtain the foreign currency I want if I order online?
answer: You can choose between delivery to your home and collection at an SBB salespoint.                                             Go to currency exchange online                         Link opens in new window.

question: I have a question about my foreign currency order. Who can I contact?
answer: If you have questions about your foreign currency order with delivery to your address, please phone the following number: 0800 007 107 (free of charge) Monday–Friday 8 am–7 pm Saturday 9 am–6 pm

question: Can I also change foreign currency back into Swiss francs?
answer: Yes, you can also exchange your foreign currency back into Swiss francs at SBB Change points of sale.

question: Can I purchase the travel insurance or letter of cover if I live abroad?
answer: No. The person insured must be resident in Switzerland.

question: What insurer does SBB work with?
answer: SBB’s partner is Allianz Travel.

question: How long is the insurance valid?
answer: Each insurance policy is valid for one year.

question: Are the insurance products valid immediately after purchase?
answer: The definitive policy will be generated within 24 hours by our partner Allianz Travel and will be sent to you with the general policy conditions on behalf of Allianz Travel by e-mail as a PDF. The validity of the insurance will only start when you receive this policy by e-mail.

question: I haven’t received my insurance policy, even though there were no payment problems and I received a confirmation from SBB. What can I do?
answer: If you have not received a policy by e-mail from Allianz Travel within 24 hours of ordering, please contact our customer services immediately (Tel. 051 225 78 94, Monday to Friday 7 am–6 pm).

question: I have ordered the wrong insurance policy by mistake and already paid for and received it. What can I do to exchange the policy?
answer: You can contact Allianz Travel directly. You will find their contact details in the policy you received by e-mail.

question: Can I choose the note denominations I receive?
answer: We will do our best to meet your requests regarding note denominations (by providing notes of high value or a mix of high and low value notes) depending on availability. Just tell us what suits you best when you exchange currency at the counter or order online.

question: I have ordered the wrong currency. What can I do?
answer: You can exchange the foreign currency you bought back into Swiss francs at a local SBB station at the purchase rate. This can be done for most foreign currencies without a problem. However, SBB reserves the right not to exchange some exotic currencies.                                             Find stations near you

question: Where can I view the up-to-date currency exchange rate?
answer: Go to currency exchange rates:                                             commerce.sbb.ch/sbb-change-home-delivery                         Link opens in new window.

question: Is it possible to cancel a foreign currency order online?
answer: If foreign currency has been ordered and paid for, cancellation is generally not possible. If a mistake has obviously been made, cancellations are possible as a goodwill gesture – if the foreign currency has not yet been sent out. SBB reserves the right not to buy back some exotic currencies. You may be charged for any loss of value due to exchange rate fluctuations. To cancel an order, contact the following office giving your reference and order numbers: Zürich HB Travel Centre Telephone 051 285 12 12 change.zuerich-hb@sbb.chLink opens in new window.

question: What fees apply when exchanging currency?
answer: Currency exchange at SBB Change or online always costs CHF 4, whatever the sum you buy. Additional shipping costs are changed in some cases. Fees when you order at the counter.  Pick up at a counter: CHF 4 fee. Free if you hold a GA Travelcard. Delivery to your address: CHF 4 fee (if you do not hold a GA Travelcard).  Fees when you order online.  Delivery to an SBB salespoint: CHF 4 fee. Delivery to your address: CHF 4 fee.

question: Are all currencies immediately available when you order online?
answer: When you order online, only currencies which are available immediately are shown. If you require other currencies, please contact our specialists by phone. 0800 007 107 (free of charge) Monday–Friday 8 am–7 pm Saturday 9 am–6 pm                                             Currencies available when you order online                         Link opens in new window.

question: Which foreign currencies are available?
answer: You can obtain currencies for over 100 countries at around 150 SBB salespoints If a currency is not available at the station, we will send it straight to your house as soon as possible.                                             Currencies available when you order online                         Link opens in new window.

question: Where can I change currency?
answer: You can change money directly at the SBB Change counter or order online.                                             Find stations with SBB Change

question: Why can I not use any payment method to buy foreign currency?
answer: Due to financial regulations, there are several payment methods that we cannot accept for purchasing foreign currency.                                              Go to accepted payment methods

question: I have questions about Western Union. Who can I contact?
answer: You can find information about sending cash with Western Union and contact details on our Western Union page.                                             Go to Western Union

question: What services does SBB Change offer?
answer: You can find the most important information on our currency exchange page.                                             Go to SBB Change                         Link opens in new window.

question: How can I pay for currency exchange?
answer: Payment methods accepted at SBB Change counters: Cash and debit cards. Payment methods not accepted at SBB Change counters: Credit cards, Reka Cheques and SBB gift cards. Order online with delivery to your address:  For the product “home delivery”, payment can be made in advance (up to CHF 1500) or by PostFinance Card, MasterCard and Visa (up to CHF 700).  For the product “collection”, payment can be made at the counter in cash or with any common debit card.  Credit cards and Reka Cards are not accepted.

question: How do I obtain the foreign currency I want if I order online?
answer: You can choose between delivery to your home and collection at an SBB salespoint.                                             Go to currency exchange online                         Link opens in new window.

question: I have a question about my foreign currency order. Who can I contact?
answer: If you have questions about your foreign currency order with delivery to your address, please phone the following number: 0800 007 107 (free of charge) Monday–Friday 8 am–7 pm Saturday 9 am–6 pm

question: How long does it take to send currency to my address?
answer: The foreign currency ordered will be delivered using A-Post Plus. If your payment is received immediately, foreign currency will generally reach you within two to three days.

question: Can I also change foreign currency back into Swiss francs?
answer: Yes, you can also exchange your foreign currency back into Swiss francs at SBB Change points of sale.

question: Where can I find SBB Change opening hours?
answer: Follow the link below and type in the name of the station you are interested in. You will then see an overview of the services provided at each station and the corresponding opening hours.                                             Go to the opening hours

question: Can I pay for my locker rental when I’m on the go?
answer: No, because you only need to pay at the end of your locker rental. The rental is cancelled with the additional payment, and you can open the locker.

question: What types of lockers are there at which stations?
answer: There are three types of lockers. You can find out which types of lockers are located at which stations here:A                                             Go to the locations of the different locker types

question: What happens to my locker rental when the 6 hours are up?
answer: New lockers (red/grey) and blue lockers (digital). Locker rental is automatically extended every 6 hours and is subject to a fee. An additional fee will be charged each time. The locker remains locked.  Blue lockers (cash payment). Additional payment fees will be charged. The locker remains locked until the fees have been paid.  Please note that the blue lockers (cash payment) are emptied after 72 hours. Contact the SBB Travel Centre.

question: What is the maximum time I can store my luggage in the locker?
answer: New lockers (red/grey): max. 96 hours. Blue lockers (digital): max. 96 hours. Blue lockers (cash payment): max. 72 hours.                                              More information on rental periods and types of lockers

question: Will my data be passed on to third parties?
answer: No.  Please note that if the lockers are used illegally, the data may be passed on to the police.

question: I stored something in a locker. Can someone else collect the contents for me?
answer: New lockers (red/grey) and blue lockers (digital). Yes, this is possible if you provide the collection code to the person collecting the items.  Please note that the storage / handing over of illegal goods is not permitted.  Blue lockers (cash payment). Contactless handing over of goods is not possible.

question: Can I use several lockers at the same time?
answer: Yes. You can use several lockers at the same time.  Please note that you can only rent one locker at a time. If you would like to rent several lockers, rent them one after the other.

question: How can I store my luggage at the station if I don’t have a smartphone?
answer: New lockers (red/grey). You don’t need a smartphone for the payment. The new lockers accept CHF coins, Maestro, PostFinance Card, V Pay, Mastercard, Visa, American Express, myOne, Diners, Twint, JCB, Apple Pay, Samsung Pay and SBB gift cards. Blue lockers (cash payment). You don’t need a smartphone for the payment. The blue lockers (cash) accept CHF coins. Blue lockers (digital). Payment is made via your smartphone. Alternatively, you can use the staffed luggage storage service at the SBB Travel Centre and pay by card or cash.                                              More information on luggage storage at SBB Travel Centres

question: How can I rent a locker?
answer: New lockers (red/grey). Here’s how it works:  Place your luggage in an empty locker. Close the door until it clicks into place (you will hear a click). Pay the amount shown on the screen. Remove the receipt with the QR code and keep it. To collect your luggage, scan the QR code.  Blue lockers (digital). The following video explains how you can rent a blue digital locker:                                                                                                     Scan the QR code on the locker system with your smartphone.  Select a locker.  Enter a valid mobile phone number and e-mail address. Pay the locker rental fee.  Open the locker and place your luggage in it.  To collect your luggage, select the link you received by text message or e-mail. The door will open.  Blue locker (with cash).  Place your luggage in an empty locker.  Close the door. Pay the amount indicated using cash. Turn the key, take it out and keep it in a safe place. To collect your luggage, open the locker with the key.

question: Is there an automatic debit when the locker rental is automatically extended?
answer: No. You are debited at the end of the rental period.

question: Will my data be used for marketing purposes?
answer: No.

question: Where can I see the locker opening times?
answer: Each SBB station has different locker opening times. Search for your desired station on SBB.ch. The location-specific opening times are displayed there. Go to the stations Go to the lockers Go to luggage storage for large luggage

question: I can’t operate the lockers myself. Where can I leave my luggage at the station?
answer: You can either use the staffed luggage storage facilities at the SBB Travel Centre or request assistance from the SBB Contact Center Handicap, who can help you use the lockers.  More information on luggage storage in the SBB Travel Centre More information on the SBB Contact Center Handicap

question: My smartphone has run out of battery and I can’t open the locker. What now?
answer: Applies only to blue lockers (digital): You can also open the locker using another device because the collection code is always sent to you by e-mail as well as by text message. For example, you can use your laptop or someone else’s smartphone. Here’s how it works:  Log in to your e-mail account on another device. Retrieve the collection code in the e-mail.  You can open the blue lockers (cash payment) and the new lockers (red/grey) without a smartphone.

question: What locker sizes are there?
answer: Different locker sizes are available depending on the SBB station. Search for your desired station on SBB.ch. The location-specific locker sizes are displayed there.  Go to the stations Go to the lockers Go to luggage storage for large luggage

question: Can I still pay for the lockers with coins?
answer: A small number of lockers currently accept cash. In future, all lockers will no longer accept cash. However, you can still pay for your luggage storage in cash at the SBB Travel Centre.  Go to the lockers Go to luggage storage for large luggage

question: Does SBB exclude liability if my luggage is damaged?
answer: Yes. SBB is not liable for the loss of or damage to the items stored.

question: Why do I have to provide my e-mail address and mobile phone number?
answer: You will receive the collection code and the link to open the locker by e-mail and text message.

question: How much does a locker cost?
answer: The cost of renting a locker depends on the size of the locker. Search for your desired station at sbb.ch/en/lockers and check the prices for your location. Go to the lockers Go to luggage storage for large luggage

question: If I cancel my locker rental early, will I get a refund of some of the price I have paid?
answer: No. No amounts will be refunded.

question: How long will my data be stored?
answer: SBB is subject to a retention obligation and stores sales data for at least 10 years.                                             More information                         Link opens in new window.

question: How far in advance can I buy a parking ticket?
answer: P+Rail tickets can generally be purchased up to seven days in advance. Parkingpay tickets can usually only be purchased for immediate use. No advance purchase can be made.

question: I don’t have a SwissPass/SwissPass card. Can I still log in?
answer: Yes. In the P+Rail app you just need a digital SwissPass login. This can be easily created in a few clicks by entering an e-mail address and some other required details. You don’t require a physical SwissPass card to create this kind of login.                                             Go to SwissPass registration                          Link opens in new window.

question: Who should I contact if I encounter problems?
answer: You will find a contact form under ‘Feedback’ in the side menu. We will be happy to provide you with personal support.

question: How can I pay the payment request for outstanding parking penalty?
answer: Most SBB P+Rail car parks are inspected by our subsidiary Transsicura.  To pay the parking penalty, scan the QR code on the payment request for outstanding parking penalty form. You will be taken directly to the payment page, where you can pay the CHF 40 penalty. Alternatively, you can also enter the number found on the payment request for outstanding parking penalty form at sbb.ch/en/gnf and pay the CHF 40 using one of the following payment methods: Mastercard, Visa, PostFinance, Amex, Reka, Diners or Twint.

question: Why have I received a payment request for outstanding parking penalty?
answer: A payment request for outstanding parking penalty is issued for the following reasons:  Parking fee not paid or not paid correctly (e.g. wrong time, wrong registration number) Parked in reserved parking space Parked outside the parking area Two parking spaces occupied Parking time exceeded

question: What does P+Rail mean?
answer: P+Rail stands for ‘Park and Rail’. P+Rail facilities – also sometimes called P+Ride – refer to car parks located directly at railway stations. The name was chosen because these parking facilities are predominantly used by rail customers who park their private motor vehicles and then travel by train.  The P+Rail app was named after this original area of application. However, Parkingpay car parking spaces can now also be paid for via the P+Rail app. Its scope of application now goes far beyond P+Rail.

question: What parking offers are available and how can I purchase them?
answer: We offer tickets for hourly parking, P+Rail Day Passes and P+Rail Monthly and Annual Passes. A reservable parking space service is also available at 31 P+Rail locations. Purchasing options vary depending on the offer and the location.                                             Information on our P+Rail service offer

question: What are the conditions for purchasing a P+Rail one-month or one-year permit?
answer: P+Rail one-month or one-year permits can only be purchased if you hold a GA Travelcard or a monthly or annual public transport travelcard valid at the station in question (Point-to-Point Travelcard, Regional Travelcard, Modular Travelcard). Depending on how busy the facility is, a minimum price or minimum distance can also be defined for this.

question: Why was Parkingpay integrated into the SBB P+Rail app?
answer: As customers requested this directly, SBB added 740 locations with over 180,000 parking spaces throughout Switzerland to the 590 P+Rail locations in the app. This provides customers with an improved user experience.

question: Are additional costs incurred when purchasing tickets for Parkingpay parking spaces?
answer: SBB acts as an intermediary for the sale of Parkingpay tickets. The conditions stipulated by Parkingpay (Digitalparking AG) apply. Extract from Digitalparking’s FAQ: “As a rule, the same tariffs apply for the parking meter/cash register. Where explicitly indicated, surcharges are applicable on the parking spaces of specific operators (e.g. Geneva) and/or for the use of certain Parkingpay functions (e.g. individual charges on the means of payment).” The actual costs are clearly indicated for the user at all times in the P+Rail app.                                              pakingpay.ch                         Link opens in new window.

question: Is my data secure on the SBB P+Rail app?
answer: Yes. SBB attaches great importance to the protection your privacy. SBB ensures compliance with the legal data protection provisions in accordance with the Federal Act on Data Protection (FADP). More information on data protection can be found in our General Terms and Conditions.

question: The app doesn’t work, won’t open or constantly crashes.
answer: Uninstall the app and download it again.  All versions older than V2.8.0 will no longer be supported as of 16 April 2021. You can view the version of your app in the bottom left-hand corner of the side menu (in the P+Rail App).

question: Can I also purchase a P+Rail Annual or Monthly Pass via the app?
answer: No. P+Rail Annual and Monthly Passes cannot currently be purchased via the app.

question: Do I receive a receipt after paying for my parking ticket?
answer: Yes. You receive a receipt sent to the e-mail address stored on your profile. You can find an overview of your valid and expired parking tickets under ‘My car park tickets’ in the side menu (in the P+Rail App). The receipt for P+Rail tickets is sent to you directly after purchasing the ticket.  The receipt Parkingpay tickets is only sent to you once the parking ticket has expired (since you can stop the parking procedure early at any time).

question: Is the P+Rail app free?
answer: Yes. The app is available for iOS and Android and can be downloaded free of charge via the AppStore or the Google PlayStore.

question: Can I buy a one-month or one-year permit for each station on a short term basis?
answer: In order to avoid exceeding capacity, there may be waiting lists or other restrictions for P+Rail facilities with high demand (for example, a quota system, stopping sales during construction work, etc.). Please contact us promptly regarding the availability of one-month or one-year permits for your desired station. Likewise, the same applies if you would like to renew your permit.  One-month and one-year permits can be purchased up to two months in advance of the first day of validity. This is advantageous, especially for P+Rail facilities with high demand.

question: Can I reserve a parking space with the P+Rail app?
answer: No. You can only buy parking tickets in the app. By purchasing a valid parking ticket, you receive the entitlement to park, but you are not guaranteed an available parking space. That is why we recommend purchasing your parking ticket immediately after parking your vehicle.

question: Can I submit several registration numbers for a one-month or one-year permit (for my second car, for example)?
answer: You can enter two different registration numbers on your P+Rail Pass – so for example, one for your second car. You cannot change the car number(s) while the permit is valid. If you need to change your number, we offer an exchange (pro rata refund and new purchase).

question: Can I purchase another parking ticket for the same period even if I already have an active ticket for a different number plate?
answer: Yes. You can purchase or have several parking tickets active simultaneously at the same or a different location.  All purchased P+Rail tickets can be viewed in the P+Rail App on the homescreen while they are valid and additionally in the side menu under ‘My car park tickets’ afterwards.

question: Why do I have to register? Isn’t entering my number plate enough?
answer: The P+Rail app uses the SwissPass login, the official public transport login.  As many of our customers already have this login, they benefit from the convenient transfer of their details and stored payment method. They also receive a personalised receipt which can be used for parking expense claims.

question: What payment methods can I use?
answer: You can pay for your parking tickets with Mastercard, Visa, American Express, PostFinance Card, Reka, Diners Club, Twint and Apple Pay.

question: Can I store several number plates?
answer: Yes. You can enter several number plates in the side menu under ‘Edit registration plate number’ (in the P+Rail App).

question: Am I guaranteed a free parking space?
answer: No, there is no guarantee that a free parking space will be available, even if you have a one-month or one-year permit or purchased the parking ticket in advance.

question: A newly entered number plate is not stored.
answer: Immediately after entering the number plate, click on the Enter/Return button on your keyboard and do NOT click on the back arrow in the top left-hand corner.

question: Where can I download the SBB P+Rail app?
answer: You can find the SBB P+Rail app in the Apple App Store and on Google Play. ‎Go to the P+Rail in the App Store (apple.com)Link opens in new window. Go to the P+Rail app on Google PlayLink opens in new window.

question: Where can I pay with the P+Rail app?
answer: At P+Rail and Parkingpay locations throughout Switzerland. You can purchase parking tickets for over 590 P+Rail facilities in the app. The P+Rail facilities of the following transport companies are currently integrated: SBB, BLS, RBS, Zentralbahn and OeBB.  Over 740 additional car park locations throughout Switzerland have also been available since May 2021 thanks to the integration of Parkingpay. You can use the app wherever you see the blue Parkingpay stickers attached to the on-site parking meters. Select the specified postcode and zone in the app to start the parking procedure.

question: How does the parking inspector know that I have purchased a parking ticket via the P+Rail app?
answer: The on-site inspector has a mobile solution to verify valid parking tickets by checking the number plate.

question: Why are there different booking processes for P+Rail and Parkingpay parking spaces?
answer: The two booking processes are currently optimised to meet the needs of their respective users. P+Rail: planned ticket purchase for switching to rail travel at a location known in advance. You search for the location in the app using the station name. Parkingpay: ad hoc ticket purchase in line with the parking procedure. Blue stickers specifying the postcode and zone are attached to the on-site parking meters. You search for the location in the app using these numbers. The parking procedure is then started.  Based on customer feedback, modification/harmonisation of the two booking processes for P+Rail and Parkingpay locations will be taken into account in future.

question: Which stations can I park at?
answer: You can park at one of over 600 P+Rail stations. An overview of available locations can be found at sbb.ch/en/parking.

question: Payment is not working.
answer: If the payment process cannot be completed, there is often an error with the payment provider. Delete the payment method in the ‘Edit payment method’ side menu (in the P+Rail App) and then add it again.

question: Can I extend my parking ticket?
answer: The answer to this question depends on whether you have purchased a P+Rail ticket or a Parkingpay ticket. Yes, for P+Rail tickets. You can extend currently active P+Rail tickets at any time up to a maximum of seven days of validity.  No, for Parkingpay tickets. You cannot extent currently active Parkingpay tickets. However, you can terminate currently active Parkingpay tickets early at any time. In this case you will only be charged for the actual parking duration.

question: How much does a parking ticket cost and what is the maximum period I can park for?
answer: This varies from location to location. You can select a location via the search field in the app and obtain information about the applicable tariff and maximum parking duration. Before buying a parking ticket, the costs are calculated for you (at the selected location and for the applicable period). This means you will know the final costs before purchasing the ticket and so can avoid any unpleasant surprises.

question: What is the difference between P+Rail and Parkingpay parking spaces? Do I need to know the difference?
answer: No. You don’t generally have to worry about the difference. When purchasing tickets for the various parking spaces, you’ll just notice a few differences in the booking process.  Tickets for P+Rail parking spaces can be purchased up to 7 days in advance. There is also the option of subsequently extending them. Tickets for Parkingpay parking spaces can only be purchased through a check-in/check-out system. You start the parking process directly and enter an end time. The parking duration cannot be extended. However, you can terminate currently active Parkingpay tickets early at any time. In this case you will only be charged for the actual parking duration.

question: Why is my P+Rail location not yet integrated into the app?
answer: In cooperation with other transport companies, we are doing our best to integrate as many P+Rail locations into the app as possible. Please contact us if you are not yet able to make reservations for your P+Rail location. We would be pleased to receive your feedback and suggestions under ‘Feedback’.

question: Do I have to register to use the P+Rail app?
answer: Yes. You have to log in to the app using a SwissPass login. If you already have a SwissPass login (e.g. for SBB Mobile or the SBB.ch webshop), you can use it to log in directly. Your stored details and payment method will then be conveniently transferred to the P+Rail app.  If you do not yet have a SwissPass login, you can obtain one free of charge in just a few clicks.                                             Go to SwissPass registration                         Link opens in new window.

question: How can I distinguish between P+Rail and Digitalparking parking spaces in the app?
answer: All car park locations can be found using the search function. These facilities are labelled with either the P+Rail logo or the Parkingpay logo so they can be clearly distinguished.

question: How far in advance can I purchase P+Rail tickets using the app?
answer: P+Rail tickets can generally be purchased up to seven days in advance.

question: The purchase button is grey and I cannot complete the purchase.
answer: Please select a number plate and a payment method.

question: What are the opening times for the points of sale?
answer: Click on the following link and enter your desired point of sale to find the opening times.                                             You can find an overview here

question: How much does a money transfer cost?
answer: Money transfer fees vary depending on the destination and service.                                             You can find an overview here

question: What should I do if I think I've become a victim of fraud?
answer: Contact our free hotline immediately on 0800 007 107 to stop the transaction. If it has not yet been paid out, you can retrieve the money.

question: Where can I send or receive money?
answer: You can send or receive money at any of SBB's staffed points of sale.                                             You can find an overview here

question: How can I detect fraud?
answer: There are a number of different signs. Most cases of fraud involve asking you to make an advance payment. The following situations are an indication of fraud:  You are surprised that you suddenly have to send money for some reason. You don't know the recipient personally. You are instructed to give certain (false) information if the staff at the point of sale ask you anything. You are pressurised or blackmailed into sending money immediately. Someone you do or don't know e-mails you to ask for an immediate money transfer. You want to take up an excellent offer (an apparent bargain) and have to transfer money in advance. You have won a sum of money or a valuable item even through you haven't entered any prize draws or competitions. Someone asks you to help transfer a very large sum of money. You've been promised a share of the money and you must make your bank account available for the transaction. Due to various expenses, you first have to advance a sum of money that you are told will be returned to you. You've accepted a lucrative job online and receive money in your bank account with the instruction to withdraw it and send it on according to certain instructions. You want to take out a loan with very favourable conditions but must first send money for some reason. You met the recipient on the internet and trust this person. Suddenly, you have to send them a large amount of money. Your pet has run away. Someone contacts you to tell you that they've found it and asks that you send them money for some reason. You want to sell something online. Someone is interested in your offer but first asks that you send them money for some reason. You've received a bank cheque that you must cash before sending the money via Western Union. You want to buy cheap branded products, medication or health tonics from China online and pay via Western Union. You want to buy a pet from abroad online and must pay for it, along with the associated costs, via Western Union. You want to rent a flat (an apparent bargain) and have to send the landlord money via Western Union for some reason.

question: What details must the recipient of my transaction supply for payment to be made?
answer: The recipient must have a valid form of identity and the following information:  Transaction number (Money Transfer Control Number – MTCN) Sender: full name (from whom) Country of origin (from where) Amount (how much) If necessary, the answer to the test question

question: Xiaomi.
answer: Settings > manage apps > SBB FreeSurf > power saving mode > activate No Restrictions.

question: Why is SBB providing free internet access in the first place?
answer: Despite the high and continually increasing number of passengers with an unlimited flat-rate contract, some customers still need free internet access on the train. In collaboration with the mobile phone providers, SBB is covering the needs of this group of customers. A good quality, stable mobile phone connection has become a basic requirement for train passengers. This also has an increasingly strong influence on passengers’ choice of transport modes. SBB is operating on the assumption that SBB FreeSurf is an interim solution. The proportion of customers with an unlimited flat-rate contract is constantly increasing, which is gradually reducing the need for free internet access.

question: There is something wrong with the mobile bill. The costs of browsing the web are too high.
answer: Customers must direct their queries regarding billing to their mobile network provider. SBB only provides the triage system and the notification for activating the data volume during the journey on the train using SBB FreeSurf.

question: Can passengers from abroad also benefit from SBB FreeSurf?
answer: Passengers from abroad can browse the web for free using a SIM card from a participating provider. This is relatively easy thanks to eSIM and DUAL-SIM. There are also various offers for mobile internet in Switzerland. One of these offers is SBB FreeWiFi, available at over 80 Swiss stations.

question: Why are international trains equipped with WiFi?
answer: In contrast to Switzerland, railways abroad often operate on routes that travel through areas with poor coverage. Using WiFi makes sense in this situation because a router pools the existing mobile networks of different providers. The internet connection therefore improves and any gaps in the coverage of individual providers can be balanced out.

question: Does the free offer give the same speed of data transmission as a normal subscription?
answer: SBB FreeSurf gives customers access to the internet with the best possible speed of data transmission along train routes (depending on the availability and capacity of the mobile networks and the individual’s contract with their provider).

question: Where exactly is SBB FreeSurf offered?
answer: SBB FreeSurf is offered on all IC and IR connections within Switzerland operated by SBB, and on the SOB lines from Basel and Zurich–Lugano, as well as Bern–Burgdorf–Olten–Zurich–Chur. The RE lines Aarau–Zurich, Erstfeld–Lugano and Annemasse–St-Maurice are not included in the service. FreeSurf cannot be used on routes where regional rolling stock is sometimes used (e.g. Zurich–Chur).

question: Which devices and software are supported?
answer: iOS (Apple).  All iPhones from the iPhone 6s onwards (an operating system update may be necessary). iOS 14 as a minimum must be installed. The same applies for iPads (with SIM). We recommend that you automatically update the app so that you always benefit from the latest features and improvements.   Android.  To use SBB FreeSurf on your smartphone, the Android 4.8 operating system must be installed as a minimum. The same applies to tablets (with SIM). We recommend that you automatically update the app to always benefit from all the features. Adjust this setting in the Play Store.

question: What does the registration involve?
answer: It is necessary to accept the General Terms and Conditions (GTCs) during the initial registration. SBB uses the phone number provided to check whether the mobile phone contract can be used for SBB FreeSurf. If this is the case, the customer will receive an text message with a code to complete their registration.

question: Registration cannot be completed.
answer: Possible reasons:  You are not a customer of Galaxus Mobile, Quickline, Salt, Sunrise or Swisscom. The registration server is currently offline.  There is currently no data connection available. There is an unknown problem with the system.  Tip: please try the registration at a later time (this does not have to be on the train).

question: Why does SBB not offer WiFi on trains for national longdistance services?
answer: WiFi on trains cannot be compared to WiFi at home. On trains, data is transmitted via the mobile phone network, while a fibre optic network is used at home, which significantly increases the speed. SBB FreeSurf is built upon the excellent mobile phone coverage in Switzerland and offers customers a faster and smoother internet connection with more bandwidth compared to WiFi on a train. Installing WiFi on a train acts like an additional bottleneck because the signals of many users have to be combined and transmitted to the mobile network using just a few connections.  SBB FreeSurf is the more powerful, technology-independent and cost-effective solution compared to WiFi.

question: Who have SBB partnered with in order to make use of free internet access?
answer: Customers of Galaxus Mobile, Quickline, Salt (Das Abo, GoMo, Lidl Connect are included), Sunrise and Swisscom can use the service.

question: I have an unlimited mobile subscription. Does SBB FreeSurf offer me any benefit?
answer: If you have an unlimited subscription, SBB FreeSurf does not offer you any benefit (as would be the case with a WLAN connection). You will already receive the best connection quality via your mobile phone.

question: What do I need exactly in order to use SBB FreeSurf?
answer: You need a current smartphone with an Apple (iOS) or Google (Android) operating system. The SBB FreeSurf app can be downloaded via the App Store or the Play Store.  After a one-time registration, you’ll be able to surf the web for free on SBB long-distance services.

question: For which operating systems is the SBB Free Surf app available?
answer: SBB FreeSurf is available on iOS and Android.

question: A connection with SBB FreeSurf could not be established.
answer: Possible reasons:  You are not a customer of Galaxus Mobile, Quickline, Salt, Sunrise or Swisscom. The SBB FreeSurf server is currently offline.  There is no mobile service available at the moment. Bluetooth connection is not activated. The device used is no longer supported. The mobile service provider has refused to activate the connection. There is a problem with the network provider. There is an unknown problem with the system.  Tip: please try the connection again at a later time. If it still does not work, please write to us at sbb.ch/en/freesurf, so that we can analyse your situation on an individual basis.

question: Can FreeSurf damage my health?
answer: Bluetooth is one of the weakest electromagnetic sources. The technology SBB uses functions in “low energy mode”. At maximum transmission power, these devices cause about one percent of the radiation exposure of a conventional WLAN router. This means that exposure in close range (right beside the source of radiation) amounts to about 0.5% of the maximum exposure from a mobile phone. The fields can barely be measured more than 2m distance from these devices.

question: SBB FreeSurf is unavailable.
answer: The system is constantly monitored. If there is a system failure, the experts will do everything they can to make it available again as quickly as possible.

question: Which devices are not supported?
answer: Laptops with a SIM card cannot be used (as opposed to tablets and iPads). It is possible to set up a hotspot via your mobile phone to secure internet access on your laptop.

question: What exactly is SBB FreeSurf?
answer: With SBB FreeSurf, customers of participating mobile network providers can browse the web for free. SBB takes on the connection costs during journeys on long-distance services within Switzerland. All information is available online: sbb.ch/en/freesurf.

question: What exactly do I need to do to use SBB FreeSurf?
answer: You can start up the SBB FreeSurf app when you board the train. You must have Bluetooth and mobile date activated on your phone. After successfully starting the app, the user will receive confirmation by text from their mobile network provider that they can now browse the web for free. When leaving the train or terminating the connection in the SBB FreeSurf app, the user receives a notification that the free service is no longer active.

question: Why can’t UPC customers use SBB FreeSurf?
answer: Although UPC customers make calls on the Sunrise network, they are on the UPC virtual mobile network and therefore have no access to SBB FreeSurf from Sunrise. Unfortunately, this will remain the case for the foreseeable future. An alternative is to switch (while retaining your number) to a Sunrise mobile subscription, which will give you unrestricted use of SBB FreeSurf. If you have any further questions, please contact Sunrise directly: 0800 707 707.

question: What about other mobile network retailers such as M-Budget, Aldi, Coop etc.?
