answer: All Swiss mobile providers had the opportunity to register their interest in participating in SBB FreeSurf as part of the call for tenders held in spring 2020. All providers who submitted an offer were taken into account for the award. It is possible – though not currently planned – that other providers could be added at a later date.

question: The performance of the SBB FreeSurf service is poor.
answer: All customers have access to the fastest possible connection along the route with SBB FreeSurf (as per the contract with the provider). However, this depends on the network coverage along the route and the number of people who are accessing the same antenna. The rate of data transfer is therefore better on an empty train than a fully occupied one.  However, SBB FreeSurf certainly provides better quality than WiFi on the train would.

question: What happens if I am on a cross-border train?
answer: The SBB FreeSurf service is not offered on cross-border Swiss trains providing long-distance services after the mobile network provider’s network has been exited. It is possible that this may occur without the mobile network provider sending a message to that effect. If the SBB FreeSurf app is nonetheless used abroad, SBB AG will not cover the costs of data traffic. In order to ensure that no charges are incurred: turn off roaming in settings under data options.

question: I recently changed provider and cannot log in.
answer: Please check with your new provider to see if the number has been transferred yet.

question: I’ve just bought a SIM card and I’m getting an error message, why?
answer: The activation of new SIM cards has a small delay. However, you will have use of SBB FreeSurf 24 hours after purchase of the SIM card at the latest.

question: Is data protection for passengers safeguarded?
answer: Yes. SBB complies with the data protection regulations. The service has been approved by the Federal Data Protection Commissioner. SBB guarantees that they are not tracking your movements and that the location data is deleted straight away. This data is used solely to determine the duration of data use for billing. Customers expressly agree to the use of data for analysing errors before they use the free internet access (same approach as for FreeWiFi). The telecoms providers do not receive any location data for passengers on the train. Data is deleted in accordance with federal regulations.

question: Samsung.
answer: Setting > Apps > top right menu > Special access > Optimise battery usage > click on «Apps not optimised» > select «All» > deactivate FreeSurf.

question: Huawei.
answer: Phone settings > Battery > App launch and then set your FreeSurf to «Manage manually» and make sure everything is turned on.

question: I have some queries about my mobile subscription.
answer: Refer all queries about subscriptions and bills to the mobile network provider’s hotline:  Galaxus Mobile: 044 575 95 00 Quickline: 0800 841 020 Salt 0800 700 700 Sunrise: 0800 707 707 Swisscom: 0800 800 800

question: The data usage displayed on the smartphone is too high.
answer: The smartphone always displays the data volume used both during FreeSurf sessions and outside of these sessions. The FreeSurf app cannot influence this. The important thing is that no data volume is charged by the provider or deducted from a data package for the duration of the FreeSurf sessions. You can verify this in the provider’s cockpit.

question: How can I ensure that SBB FreeSurf won’t use mobile data before I connect?
answer: If a customer is charged according to data usage or has a limited data contract, and would like to avoid automatic generation of mobile data:  iOS: in settings, deactivate “Background App Refresh” for all apps to ensure no unwanted data volumes are used in the background before the FreeSurf app is active. Android: in settings, deactivate “Data Saving” for all apps so that no data volumes are used in the background. If you have a prepaid subscription, an amount may be deducted from the credit balance as soon as mobile services are activated in line with the conditions of the pre-paid subscription. Those registered for FreeSurf can use the app even if they have no credit on their account. Stop the FreeSurf connection before leaving the train and do not wait for the text from the mobile network provider informing you that the free service has been terminated.

question: I did not receive a text message after registering.
answer: The wrong number was entered during registration. The text message registration service may be down temporarily. Registration requests will be processed when the system is restored (SMS messages will be sent later than usual).

question: OnePlus.
answer: System Settings > Apps & notifications > Special app access > Battery optimisation > Select FreeSurf > Change to »Don't optimise».

question: How do pre-paid customers benefit from the SBB FreeSurf solution?
answer: If you have a pre-paid subscription, an amount may be deducted from the credit balance as soon as mobile services are activated in line with the conditions of the pre-paid subscription. Those registered for FreeSurf can use the app even if they have no credit on their account. There are different solutions available for Salt and Sunrise subscriptions in order to prevent the daily rate from being charged when the SBB FreeSurf is launched. Since Galaxus Mobile and Quickline do not offer pre-paid subscriptions, their customers are not affected. Salt: the customer is charged the daily rate directly. Salt checks in the background whether the SBB FreeSurf app was launched at the same time. If this is the case, the customer receives a remuneration for the daily rate in real time.   Sunrise: to stop Sunrise subscribers from being charged before using FreeSurf, the use of paid mobile data must be blocked before switching mobile data on. The customer can do this using the USSD code *170# and the call button on the keyboard. The customer enters the USSD code #170# to re-enable the use of paid mobile data outside of FreeSurf. Activation and deactivation are confirmed via a text message. Swisscom: For prepaid and postpaid customers, communication between the SBB app and the SBB server is free of charge. Customers who communicate using VPN services (company VPN, Apple Privacy Services, etc.) can only benefit from the free internet usage once they have activated the SBB FreeSurf app. Prepaid customers who are automatically charged the basic tariff can deactivate this at cockpit.swisscom.ch.

question: I haven’t received my insurance policy, even though there were no payment problems and I received a confirmation from SBB. What can I do?
answer: If you have not received a policy by e-mail from Allianz Travel within 24 hours of ordering, please contact our customer services immediately (Tel. 051 225 78 94, Monday to Friday 7 am–6 pm).

question: Can I purchase the travel insurance or letter of cover if I live abroad?
answer: No. The person insured must be resident in Switzerland.

question: I have ordered the wrong insurance policy by mistake and already paid for and received it. What can I do to exchange the policy?
answer: You can contact Allianz Travel directly. You will find their contact details in the policy you received by e-mail.

question: Are the insurance products valid immediately after purchase?
answer: The definitive policy will be generated within 24 hours by our partner Allianz Travel and will be sent to you with the general policy conditions on behalf of Allianz Travel by e-mail as a PDF. The validity of the insurance will only start when you receive this policy by e-mail.

question: How long is the insurance valid?
answer: Each insurance policy is valid for one year.

question: What insurer does SBB work with?
answer: SBB’s partner is Allianz Travel.

question: What should I do if my luggage is not collected and/or delivered as I ordered?
answer: Contact the SBB Contact Center on +41 (0)848 44 66 88 (CHF 0.08/min.) so that they can start to look into this right away. SBB luggage dispatch or the carrier will contact you directly within 1 hour.

question: Where can I stow my luggage on the train?
answer: In general on trains. The easiest and most secure place to stow your luggage on the move is in the space between and under the seats. That way, you can keep an eye on it at all times. It also means you keep both the walkways and the seats clear. There is a luggage rack above the seats where you can stow smaller items of luggage, such as backpacks and handbags. This video is provided by a third-party platform (www.youtube.com). To play the video, accept marketing cookies in the cookie settings then reload the page. Go to the cookie settings Load and play video.   On double-deck trains (long-distance double-deck trains, IC2000, IR double-deck trains). There is a luggage rack for stowing items of luggage at the top of the stairs leading to the upper deck. If you are travelling with luggage as a family, you can find multi-functional compartments with space to stow luggage in the lower deck of the family coach (recognisable by its jungle or dragon motifs). On the lower deck of the IC2000, you will find enough space to stow pushchairs, luggage or bikes. Trains with family coaches run mainly on the following InterCity routes: IC1: St. Gallen–Zurich HB–Bern–Geneva Airport IC8: Romanshorn–Zurich HB–Bern–Brig IC6: Basel SBB–Bern–Brig IC61: Basel SBB–Bern–Interlaken Ost IC3: Basel SBB–Zurich HB–Chur  Folding seats on long-distance double-deck trains. In several compartments on long-distance double-deck trains, folding seats are available. They can be found both on the lower deck of the family coach with the playing area and in the compartments with a pushchair signet on the door. Look at the info sticker on the window when you are in the compartment itself. If you are travelling as a family, you will find space for pushchairs and luggage there. IC2000 Modernised IC2000 LD double-decker Tips: If the multi-functional compartment fills up or is already full, please place your luggage under the seats and in the dedicated luggage racks. If you are planning a journey with luggage in advance, it is worth taking a look at our luggage services.  Luggage services Image legend: Luggage rack for stowing items of luggage at the top of the stairs leading to the upper deck of long-distance double-deck trains. Image legend: Luggage rack for stowing items of luggage in the “Giruno” train.

question: In the event of a delay, who is liable and what is the procedure?
answer: Procedure if luggage has not yet been collected or delivered. Contact the SBB Contact Center on +41 (0)848 44 66 88 (CHF 0.08/min.) so that the issue can be investigated immediately. SBB luggage dispatch or the carrier will contact you directly within 2 hours. Liability in general. Liability for partial or total loss, damage and delayed delivery of luggage shall be governed by the Swiss Federal Passenger Transport Act (PTA) and the applicable Passenger Transport Ordinance of the Swiss Federal Council. This matter is also described in Tariff 602 Luggage. Liability in the event of delays. In the event of a delay in delivery, the transport company is liable for any proven damage, with receipts provided for emergency purchases of urgently needed clothing and toiletries and for bicycle, ski or skiing equipment rental. This can be up to CHF 200 per item per 24 hour period, or part thereof, that the delivery time is exceeded, but for no longer than 14 days (maximum liability up to CHF 2,000, analogous to that for total loss). Procedure. If you wish to report claims for emergency purchases or the rental of replacement equipment, submit your claim together with all receipts within 7 days of receipt.                                             Link to the damaged luggage form                                                                Please note: complaints about the transport of your luggage – such as collection or delivery periods not being adhered to, lack of notification, or delays (not involving emergency purchases or rental of replacement equipment) – should be submitted using the complaints form.                                             Link to the complaints form

question: Why is the ‘luggage special’ not displayed on the offer page?
answer: To check whether holiday accommodation or a destination is included in the ‘luggage special’ when you are in the SBB shop, you must enter the holiday accommodation or destination in the ‘From’ or ‘To’ field on the home page.  You then need to select the accommodation from the drop-down menu to make sure the ‘luggage special’ is displayed on the offer page. You can then book the offer.    In some holiday destinations, the ‘luggage special’ can be booked to all addresses. In this case, you only need to enter the town (Ardez, Brail, Braunwald, Ftan, Fuldera, Guarda, Lavin, Lü, Martina, Mürren, Müstair, Ramosch, Samnaun-Compatsch, Samnaun-Dorf, Santa Maria Val Müstair, Scuol, Sent, Strada, Susch, Tarasp-Vulpera, Tschierv, Tschlin, Valchava, Vnà, Zernez).

question: How do I know the best place to get on the train with my luggage?
answer: The best thing to do is check which coaches on the train are the least busy before boarding (those with the fewest little figures). Then wait at the appropriate place on the platform. This will give you the best chance to find a place for yourself and your luggage. Suitcase pictograms on the train also indicate luggage racks. Here’s how to get to the occupancy forecast on SBB.ch:  Search for your connection in the online timetable. Click on the connection and then on ‘Show train information’. Find the coach that is most empty and wait for the train to arrive in the appropriate place on the platform. (Please note that the actual train formation is only shown on the day itself.)  Here’s how to get to the occupancy forecast in the SBB Mobile app:                                             Show train information

question: Do I have to label the luggage?
answer: Yes. Every luggage item being transported must be labelled with your name, address and telephone number. We provide you with downloadable luggage labels for this purpose.                                        Downloads.                                            Download luggage label. (PDF, 76 KB)                                                                                                                            Download                 The link destination will be opened in an external application or a new window (PDF, 76 KB)             Link opens in new window.

question: How long will it take for your luggage to be delivered?
answer: The delivery times for receiving your luggage are calculated according to the transport route. You can calculate how long it will take using the luggage timeframe calculator. Please always check the luggage counter opening hours for the check-in and collection stations. (Tip: search for ‘luggage’ in the search bar on the relevant station page.) Go to the luggage timeframe calculatorLink opens in new window. Go to the flight luggage timeframe calculator Go to stations and opening hours

question: What luggage services does SBB offer?
answer: SBB offers the following services for you to register luggage:  from station to station. from door to door. from station to door. from door to station. flight luggage with or without check-in to/from Zurich Airport.  Go to luggage offers and prices  Go to flight luggage offers and prices

question: What is the maximum weight for luggage?
answer: Maximum weight for luggage and ski equipment: 23kg.

question: Can I check in and pick up luggage at any station?
answer: No, it is only possible at selected stations. You can find out if that includes your station of choice from our list.                                             Go to check-in and collection stations

question: Can I also have luggage collected from an address abroad?
answer: This is not possible. Service points are postal addresses in Switzerland and Liechtenstein that can be accessed directly via a road suitable for vehicles. Otherwise, the carrier shall define a suitable handover location when giving notification the day before.

question: Can I send luggage even if I am not travelling by train?
answer: The shipping of luggage is only possible with a valid ticket for the entire transport route or with a valid annual travelcard (GA Travelcard, Half Fare Travelcard, Point-to-Point Travelcard, Regional Travelcard, GA Travelcard for SBB employees, Night GA Travelcard, Modular Travelcard) and is not possible if it involves commercial consignments and private consignments unrelated to travel (e.g. shipping of goods sold/ordered, merchandise, removals, etc.).

question: What objects cannot be transported?
answer: Objects which cannot be transported under Tariff 602 Luggage. Extract from the tariff conditions: items at particular risk of damage, e.g. televisions, computers, laptops, furniture, cameras and mobile phones, precious metals, jewellery, watches, gemstones, cash, securities, cheque books, identity documents and similar documents, moving boxes, containers of any kind, fragile items, works of art, antiques. This list is by no means exhaustive. For luggage with check-in, the provisions of the respective airline also apply.

question: Can I stow my luggage at the station?
answer: You can either lock your luggage in a locker at the station or have it stored at an SBB Travel Centre.                                             Go to lockers and luggage deposit

question: If an item has been damaged, who is liable and what is the procedure?
answer: Liability in general. Liability for partial or total loss, damage and delayed delivery of luggage shall be governed by the Swiss Federal Passenger Transport Act (PTA) and the applicable Passenger Transport Ordinance of the Swiss Federal Council. This matter is also described in Tariff 602 Luggage. Liability for damage. If damage has occurred, the transport company shall be liable for any proven damage up to the amount of CHF 2,000 per item. In case of partial damage, compensation for repair costs – for bicycles, for example – is provided in line with the repair quote and up to the sum given above. Procedure. Notify us of damage claims within 7 days of receipt of the items using the luggage damage form. Please include photographs.                                             Link to the luggage damage form

question: Who is liable if items go missing, and what is the procedure?
answer: Procedure if luggage has not yet been collected or delivered. Contact the SBB Contact Center on +41 (0)848 44 66 88 (CHF 0.08/min.) so that the issue can be investigated immediately. SBB luggage dispatch or the carrier will contact you directly within 2 hours. Liability in general. Liability for partial or total loss, damage and delayed delivery of luggage shall be governed by the Swiss Federal Passenger Transport Act (PTA) and the applicable Passenger Transport Ordinance of the Swiss Federal Council. This matter is also described in Tariff 602 Luggage. Liability for lost items. In the event of an item being lost, the transport company shall be liable for the verifiable value of the lost item and its contents, as well as for the value of replacement and emergency purchases made during the loss period, up to a maximum of CHF 2,000 per item. Procedure. In the case of missing items, a missing luggage report is generated by the relevant office; this launches a search.  If the item be found within 14 days, the liability provisions for a delay will apply. If your item has not been found within a 14-day period, the item will be considered lost. In this case, you will receive a notification of total loss. Submit the loss and all related replacement and emergency purchases up to the amount of CHF 2,000 together with all receipts within seven days of receiving the notification of total loss.                                              Link to the damaged luggage form

question: Can bicycles, bicycle trailers, e-bikes and special bikes be transported to all localities in Switzerland and Liechtenstein?
answer: For logistical reasons, door-to-door delivery or collection of bicycles, bicycle trailers, e-bikes and special bikes is not possible for the following locations:  Belalp/Tschuggen Fiescheralp Melchsee-Frutt Lauchernalp Saas-Fee Stoos Zermatt  We can offer collection from your home for delivery to the train station nearest the location. Return shipping from the station to your home is not currently available for booking in the online shop. For the return journey, please go directly to the station to register your bike and luggage. You will pay at the station.

question: Are there luggage offers for groups?
answer: If you are travelling within Switzerland as a group of 10 or more people and would like to check in luggage or bikes, you can benefit from various luggage services.                                             Go to luggage transport for groups

question: Can I check in a bike or special bike as luggage too?
answer: Yes. Bicycles, bicycle trailers and e-bikes, as well as special bikes such as tandems, recumbent bikes and three-wheelers, can be transported from station to station and from door to door within Switzerland and Liechtenstein.  Bicycles, maximum dimensions: 2m long, 0.8m wide, 1m tall. Children’s seats, luggage racks and bike baskets must be empty.  E-bikes, maximum dimensions: 2m long, 0.8m wide, 1m tall. The battery does not need to be removed for transport. Spare batteries and accumulators must be carried in hand luggage and may not be checked in as luggage. Children’s seats, luggage racks and bike baskets must be empty.  Special bikes, maximum dimensions: 2.4m long, 0.9m wide, 1.1m tall. Bicycle trailers must not be loaded and can only weigh a maximum of 25kg. Cargo bicycles are excluded due to their dimensions and weight. Each bike must be labelled with your name, address and telephone number. Each bike must be packed in your own cover or the cover of the transport company. All types of bicycle can only be checked in for delivery unlocked. Locked bicycles are not accepted.  Go to check-in and collection stations Go to the shop for booking door-to-door transportLink opens in new window. Go to bicycle shipping

question: How long do I have to change or cancel my luggage order?
answer: You can make cancellations by calling the SBB Contact Center on +41 (0)848 44 66 88 (CHF 0.08/min.) by 8pm two days before shipping for a handling fee of CHF 10. In the event of cancellations after 8pm two days prior to collection, additional fees of up to 100% of the price will be charged. You can make changes, for example to the number of luggage items and the collection or delivery address, until 8pm two days before shipping. Changes can only be made after 8pm two days before shipping by arrangement with the responsible transport company.

question: Is the GA Travelcard also valid in Liechtenstein?
answer: Yes, the GA Travelcard is valid on the entire network of the Liechtensteinmobil (LIEmobil) transport company, as well as on the S-Bahn between Buchs SG and Nendeln.

question: Which documents do I need to purchase a GA Travelcard for Children, GA Travelcard for Youth, GA Travelcard for 25 Year Olds, GA Travelcard for Adults and GA Travelcard for Seniors for the first time?
answer: Purchasing online with a SwissPass. If you already have a SwissPass, you will need the following documents to purchase your GA Travelcard for the first time online.  Debit or credit card (PostFinance Card, Mastercard, Visa, Reka Card, American Express, Diners, JCB or myOne), Twint. (The credit card must be in the same name as the contracting party.) Passport or ID card for the travelcard user and for the contracting party (for example, if you are purchasing a GA Travelcard for your child as a parent or for another person).  When buying online, you can enter details for the following types of ID: passports and ID cards issued in Switzerland, Germany, Austria, France, Italy or Liechtenstein.   Purchasing online with an identity check.  When purchasing with the identity check, you can only buy a GA Travelcard for yourself. You will need:  a smartphone with a camera. a debit or credit card (PostFinance Card, Mastercard, Visa, Reka Card, American Express, Diners, JCB or myOne), Twint. a recent, high-quality, digital passport photo. a passport or ID card.  List of the accepted forms of IDLink opens in new window. Questions on the identity checkLink opens in new window.                                             Order form sent by post. To purchase your travelcard for the first time using the order form, you will need the following documents:  a recent, high-quality passport photo.  a copy of the passport or ID for both the travelcard user and the contracting party (for example, if you are purchasing a GA Travelcard for your child as a parent or for another person).  Purchasing at a public transport point of sale. To purchase for the first time at a public transport point of sale, you need a recent analogue or digital passport photo and the passport/ID card for yourself or the other person (for example, if you are purchasing a GA Travelcard for your child as a parent or for another person).

question: How can I buy a GA Travelcard?
answer: First-time purchase online for GA Travelcard for Adults, GA Travelcard for Children, GA Travelcard for Youth, GA Travelcard for 25 Year Olds, GA Travelcard for Seniors. When purchasing online, the most important thing is your customer number in the format 000-000-000-0. If you have or had a SwissPass or a public transport travelcard in the last five years, you can find this number on your SwissPass card and use it to purchase your GA Travelcard online. If you used to have a travelcard but have forgotten the customer number, you can find out what it is by going to a public transport point of sale or phoning the SBB Contact Center on 0848 44 66 88 (CHF 0.08/min.). To purchase a GA Travelcard for another person online, they also need to have a customer number. First-time purchasing online with an identity check. If you don’t have a travelcard or a SwissPass, you can still buy your new GA Travelcard online. If you are buying a travelcard for the first time, we need to verify your identity. This identity check takes place online – you will need your passport or ID card and a smartphone with a camera. You will also need a recent, high-quality, digital passport photo. Online purchase with an identity check is not possible for other persons                                             Questions on the identity check                         Link opens in new window.                                       First-time purchase via (online) order form for GA Travelcard for Disabled Persons. You can order a new GA Travelcard for Disabled Persons online using the PDF order form on SBB.ch. To do so, fill out the PDF form on your computer, print it out and send it to us at the address given on the order form, together with the photo and the required documents. Alternatively, you can print the form out first, fill it out by hand and then send it to us.  First-time purchase via (online) order form for GA Travelcard for Duos, GA Travelcard Familia for Children, GA Travelcard Familia for Youth, GA Travelcard Familia for Adults. To be entitled to purchase any of the GA Travelcards mentioned above, a family member must hold a basic GA Travelcard (GA Travelcard for Adults, GA Travelcard for Youth, GA Travelcard for 25 YearOolds, GA Travelcard for Seniors or GA Travelcard for Disabled Persons).  You can order any of these GA Travelcards on SBB.ch using the PDF order form. To do so, fill out the PDF form on your computer and print it out. Alternatively, you can print the form out first and then fill it out by hand. Please send the completed order form, an original passport photo and all the documents required for the relevant Familia GA Travelcard or GA Travelcard for Duos to the address given on the order form. Purchasing at a staffed public transport point of sale. Of course, you can also order all GA Travelcards at a staffed public transport point of sale. Please bring your SwissPass (if you have one), the completed order form, a recent analogue or digital passport photo(s) and all the documents required for the relevant GA Travelcard(s). PDF order form (to fill out on your computer or by hand) (PDF, 1,3 MB)Link opens in new window. (PDF, 1,3 MB)

question: What happens to my existing travelcards if I switch to the GA Travelcard?
answer: If you choose a GA Travelcard, you will receive a pro-rata refund for travelcards that you no longer need, such as the Half Fare, regional, Point-to-point or Modular Travelcard or Night GA Travelcard as well as one 1-month GA Travelcard. Take your SwissPass on which reference is made to your current travelcard to a staffed public transport point of sale and you will receive a credit.

question: Where is my GA Travelcard valid?
answer: On all SBB trains and those of most other railways in Switzerland, as well as on boats, buses, trams and some mountain lifts and railways. Find more detailed information on the GA Travelcard area of validity map.                                             Go to the GA Travelcard area of validity map

question: Is the GA Travelcard valid for the Klewenalp?
answer: Yes, the journey to the Klewenalp is included in the GA Travelcard area of validity.

question: What do I need to consider when taking my photo?
answer: Requirements. For the travelcard on the SwissPass, you need to provide a recent analogue or digital passport photo which fulfils the following criteria:  Taken from the front. Eyes open and not covered. Plain background. Even lighting (no shadows). Clear with high contrast. Black and white or colour. Approx. size 35mm × 45mm. Analogue passport photo: only original prints, no scans or photos printed out on paper. Digital passport photo: unedited, min. image size 200 × 250 pixels; in .JPG or .JPEG format with a maximum size of 4MB.  Purchasing a GA Travelcard online for the first time. If you already have a SwissPass or used to have another public transport travelcard, we will use the same photo for your new travelcard. In this case, adults will only need to provide a new photo if the previous one was taken more than ten years ago. Children and young people under 25 will only have to do so if their previous photo was taken more than five years ago. First-time purchasing online with an identity check. If you are purchasing a GA Travelcard for the first time, do not already have a SwissPass and have not previously had a travelcard, you can upload your digital passport photo once the purchasing process (including the identity check) is complete.  Purchasing for the first time via the order form. You will need to submit an original, high resolution passport photo taken recently. Your photo will be stored electronically for a maximum of ten years (or five years for children and young people under 25).  Please write your first name and surname in block capitals on the back of the photo. Please attach the photo to the order form in the space indicated.  Purchasing the travelcard for the first time at a staffed point of sale. Please bring a recent analogue or digital passport photo to the counter. Changing your photo. If you would like to update your photo before the 5/10 year period has elapsed, please bring a recent analogue or digital passport photo to a public transport point of sale. You can then get a new SwissPass card with the new photo for a fee of CHF 30.

question: Is the GA Travelcard valid for the Jungfraujoch?
answer: The journey up to the Jungfraujoch is not free with a GA Travelcard, but you do get a discounted price.

question: How do I pay for my GA Travelcard renewal?
answer: You can find information about payment options for subsequent invoices on the SwissPass website.                                             Go to information on paying subsequent invoices                         Link opens in new window.

question: How can I cancel my GA Travelcard and what do I need to be aware of?
answer: You can find all the questions and answers about cancelling your GA Travelcard on the cancellation help page.                                             Go to GA Travelcard cancellation

question: How can I pay for a new GA Travelcard?
answer: Purchasing online. When purchasing online, you can pay by credit card, PostFinance Card, Reka Card or Twint. (Online) order form.  When purchasing using the order form, you have the choice of paying by credit card or invoice. At a staffed public transport point of sale. When purchasing at a staffed point of sale, the following payment methods are available to you: cash, vouchers, Reka Check, Reka Rail, Twint, debit or credit card (PostFinance Card, Mastercard, Visa, Reka Card, American Express, Diners, JCB or myOne). Payment by credit card (please keep in mind the limit on your card). You can pay for your new travelcard with the following credit cards:  Visa (incl. prepaid cards) MasterCard (incl. prepaid cards) American Express Diners Club International JCB MyOne  Please note:  The credit card must be in the same name as the contracting party. The credit card will be charged once the order has been received.  Payment by PostFinance Card (please keep in mind the limit on your card).  Payment with Twint (please keep in mind your limit/credit).  Payment by invoice.  We will send you the invoice together with a payment slip in the post. Please note:  Your order must be placed at least ten days before your travelcard validity begins. Otherwise your payment by invoice cannot be processed and will be returned. We will send you the invoice separately – i.e. not together with your SwissPass card. You must pay the invoice before the first day that your travelcard is valid, otherwise you will receive a payment reminder.  Other payment options at our points of sale.  At a point of sale, you can pay using a Maestro card, PostFinance Card, any of the credit cards listed above, Reka Checks, Reka Card, Twint, voucher or cash.

question: How much does the GA Travelcard cost?
answer: The price for a 2nd class GA Travelcard for Adults is CHF 3,860. Children, young persons and senior citizens benefit from a cheaper price. There is also a discount on the GA Travelcard for families, partners, 25 year olds and travellers with disabilities.                                             Go to summary of prices

question: Is the GA Travelcard valid on boats?
answer: Yes, you can travel free of charge by boat on most large lakes in Switzerland with your GA Travelcard. Boat trips on the following lakes are excluded:  Greifensee (GA Travelcard only partially accepted – discount). Lake Lugano (GA Travelcard only partially accepted – discount). Beckenried–Gersau ferry (no discount with GA Travelcard). Lac de Joux (no discount with GA Travelcard). Lac des Brenets (no discount with GA Travelcard). Lago di Poschiavo (no discount with GA Travelcard). Silsersee (no discount with GA Travelcard). Walensee (no discount with GA Travelcard).

question: Can I also travel in 1st class with my 2nd class GA Travelcard?
answer: Yes, if you purchase a class upgrade. With your 2nd class GA Travelcard and a class upgrade at a discounted rate, you can travel in even greater comfort in 1st class. Class upgrades are available for individual routes, for a day or a month. You can upgrade your 2nd class GA Travelcard to a 1st class GA Travelcard at any time. Tip: Look out for the Saver Class Upgrade: benefit from a reduction of up to 70% when upgrading from 2nd to 1st class on many Swiss public transport lines.                                             More information on upgrading

question: How long does it take to receive my GA Travelcard on the SwissPass?
answer: Already have a SwissPass? Your GA Travelcard will be valid on the SwissPass from its first day of validity.  This is your first SwissPass? Your GA Travelcard on the SwissPass will be delivered by post within around ten days. If you would like your new GA Travelcard to be valid earlier, we can provide a temporary SwissPass. If you order online, you can print it out as a PDF. If you order using the order form, bring all your documents with you to the counter and you will receive it there.

question: How can I renew my GA Travelcard?
answer: When buying a GA Travelcard you take out an indefinite contract. The advantage of this is that your travelcard is automatically renewed at the end of your chosen period of validity – 1 year or 1 month. Thanks to the SwissPass, you no longer have to think about renewing your travelcard yourself. Your SwissPass card is valid for five years and we automatically renew your travelcard on the same card.

question: Is the GA Travelcard valid for the Stanserhorn?
answer: Yes, the journey to the Stanserhorn is included in the GA Travelcard area of validity.

question: How can I cancel my GA Travelcard subject to annual payment?
answer: To the GA cancellation

question: On which mountain lifts/railways is the GA Travelcard valid?
answer: As a general principle, the GA Travelcard is valid on mountain lifts/railways that provide access to residential areas. For journeys on purely tourist-related mountain railways, such as those to the Jungfraujoch, Titlis and others, you pay either a reduced price with your GA Travelcard or the standard full price.

question: Which documents do I need to purchase a GA Travelcard for Disabled Persons for the first time?
answer: Order form sent by post. To purchase your travelcard for the first time using the order form, you will need the following documents:  a recent, high-quality passport photo. a copy of the passport or ID for both the travelcard user and the contracting party (for example, if you are purchasing a GA Travelcard for your child or for another person). a copy of a valid IV (disability insurance) ID for the travelcard user.  or a medical certificate if you are dependent on a wheelchair at all times to use public transport.  You will also need a copy of the valid IV (disability insurance) ID or a new medical certificate for any further purchases at a later date. Purchasing at a public transport point of sale. To purchase for the first time at a public transport point of sale, you need a recent analogue or digital passport photo and the passport/ID card for yourself or the other person (for example, if you are purchasing a GA Travelcard for your child as a parent or for another person).

question: Which documents do I need to purchase a GA Travelcard for Duos?
answer: You will need a recent analogue or digital passport photo. You can find a list of all the other required documents on the SwissPass website.                                             Go to the list of required documents                         Link opens in new window.

question: Which documents do I need to purchase a GA Travelcard Familia for Children, a GA Travelcard Familia for Youth or a GA Travelcard Familia for Adults?
answer: You will need a recent analogue or digital passport photo. You can find a list of all the other required documents on the SwissPass website.                                             Go to the list of required documents                         Link opens in new window.

question: Can I suspend my GA Travelcard if I do not need it?
answer: Yes. If you don’t need your GA Travelcard for a certain period, you can deposit it at the counter during the validity period of your travelcard, for a minimum of five consecutive days and a maximum of 30 days per travelcard year.                                             More information on depositing your travelcard

question: Is the GA Travelcard valid for travel to Constance?
answer: Yes, the GA Travelcard is valid up to Constance.

question: I have lost my GA Travelcard on the SwissPass – what should I do?
answer: Have you lost your SwissPass or has it been damaged? You can order a SwissPass replacement card for CHF 30 online at SBB.ch, via the SBB Contact Center or at a staffed public transport point of sale.                                             Order your SwissPass replacement card here

question: I am on the move and I have forgotten my GA Travelcard on the SwissPass – what happens now?
answer: If you’ve left your SwissPass at home or at the office, you can display it easily in the SBB Mobile app in the Tickets & SwissPass tile (you must have a login with a linked customer number to do so). Alternatively, for a fee of CHF 5 we can issue you with a temporary card, available at any ticket counter, upon presentation of official ID.

question: Can I travel to Domodossola with the GA Travelcard?
answer: Yes, you can travel for free with the GA Travelcard both on the route to Domodossola through the Simplon Tunnel via Brig and to Domodossola from Locarno through the Centovalli. For travel on a panorama train from Locarno, you have to pay a surcharge of 2-3 euros. Trains that are subject to a surcharge are marked in the timetable with ‘Z’.

question: How can I cancel my GA Travelcard subject to monthly payment?
answer: To the GA cancellation

question: How long does it take to receive my Night GA Travelcard on the SwissPass?
answer: Already have a SwissPass? Your Night GA Travelcard on the SwissPass will be valid from its first day of validity. This is your first SwissPass? Your Night GA Travelcard on the SwissPass will be delivered by post within around ten days. If you would like your Night GA Travelcard to be valid earlier, we can provide a temporary SwissPass. If you would like your new GA Travelcard to be valid earlier, we can provide a temporary SwissPass.

question: How can I renew my Night GA Travelcard?
answer: If you wish to renew your Night GA Travelcard after it expires, you can buy a new travelcard. The Night GA Travelcard is not renewed automatically. Before your current Night GA Travelcard expires, we will inform you about how you can renew it. Buy Night GA Travelcard online

question: My SwissPass holding a Night GA Travelcard has been lost or damaged – what can I do?
answer: No problem, order a replacement SwissPass for CHF 30. We are also happy to help you at a staffed point of sale.                                             Order a replacement SwissPass

question: How do I buy a Night GA Travelcard?
answer: First-time purchase online.  When purchasing online, the most important thing is your customer number in the format 000-000-000-0. If you have or had a SwissPass or a public transport travelcard in the last five years, you can find this number on your SwissPass card and use it to purchase your Night GA Travelcard online. If you used to have a travelcard but have forgotten the customer number, you can find out what it is by going to a public transport point of sale or phoning the SBB Contact Center on 0848 44 66 88 (CHF 0.08/min.). First-time purchasing online with an identity check. If you do not yet hold a travelcard or a SwissPass, you can still buy your new Night GA Travelcard online. If you are buying a travelcard for the first time, we need to verify your identity. This identity check takes place online – you will need your passport or ID card and a smartphone with a camera. You will also need a recent, high-quality, digital passport photo. Online purchase with an identity check is not possible for other persons.                                             Questions on the identity check                         Link opens in new window.                                       You may also want to know: if you wish to buy the Night GA Travelcard for your children, you can do so, as long as you and your child hold SwissPass cards with a linked SwissPass login. To buy for your child, select Purchase a travelcard for another person during the purchasing process. Buy Night GA Travelcard online Note: a SwissPass login is linked with SBB.ch if the customer number is stored in your profile on SBB.ch. After signing in, click on your initials, then on Profile and then on Update details in the Personal details tile. If the customer number is displayed in the form 000-000-000-0, it means it is linked.                                              Link customer number                                                                Purchase at a staffed public transport point of sale. Of course, you can also purchase the Night GA Travelcard at a staffed public transport point of sale. Please bring your SwissPass (if you have one), a recent analogue or digital passport photo and your passport/ID card. If you are purchasing for another person, then please bring the documents for this person (e.g. for your child).

question: My train arrives after 5am / 7am. Do I need to buy another ticket?
answer: The Night GA Travelcard is valid up to the last stop reached before 5am / 7am at the weekend and on public holidays. For travel after 5am / 7am, please buy a ticket.  If you hold a Night GA Travelcard and are aged 16 or over, please buy a full price ticket for your chosen route. If you hold a Night GA Travelcard and a Half Fare Travelcard or if you hold a seven25 Travelcard and are 15 years old or younger, buy a half-price ticket for the rest of your journey.

question: I have forgotten my SwissPass holding a Night GA Travelcard – what should I do now?
answer: If you leave your SwissPass at home or in the office, you can display it very easily in the SBB Mobile app in the Tickets & SwissPass tab (you must have a login with linked customer number). Alternatively, you can buy a card with temporary validity for a fee of CHF 5 from a public transport point of sale upon presentation of official ID.

question: I would like to use my Night GA Travelcard to travel in 1st class – what do I need to be aware of?
answer: To travel in 1st class, you need to buy a 1st class upgrade for the route you wish to travel.  If you hold a Night GA Travelcard and are 16 or over, buy a first-class upgrade for the route you wish to travel. If you hold a Night GA Travelcard and a Half Fare Travelcard and are 15 years old or younger, buy a half-price first-class upgrade for the route you wish to travel. You cannot buy a 1-day class upgrade for a Night GA Travelcard.  You can buy class upgrades for a specific route online on SBB.ch, in the SBB Mobile app and from ticket machines. So you always have the option of going 1st class.

question: Is the night supplement included in the Night GA Travelcard?
answer: No, you need to buy night supplements separately.                                             Travel home safely with the nighttime network

question: Do I receive a discount on routes where the Night GA Travelcard is not valid?
answer: No.                                             Go to the Night GA Travelcard area of validity

question: How can I pay for a new Night GA Travelcard?
answer: Purchasing online. When purchasing online, you can pay by credit card, PostFinance Card, Reka Card or Twint. At a staffed public transport point of sale. When purchasing at a staffed point of sale, the following payment methods are available to you: cash, vouchers, Reka Check, Reka Rail, Twint, debit or credit card (PostFinance Card, Mastercard, Visa, Reka Card, American Express, Diners, JCB or myOne). Payment by credit card. You can pay for your new travelcard with the following credit cards:  Visa (incl. prepaid cards) MasterCard (incl. prepaid cards) American Express Diners Club International JCB MyOne  Please note: The credit card will be charged once the order has been received.  Payment by PostFinance Card. Payment with Twint.

question: Who is the Night GA Travelcard suitable for?
answer: The Night GA Travelcard is ideal if you are aged under 25 and are often on the move in the evenings. Because the Night GA Travelcard lets you enjoy unlimited travel in 2nd class on SBB trains, most other railways and many other public transport services in Switzerland from 7pm to 5am (on Saturday, Sunday and public holidays until 7am) – as if you had a GA Travelcard. The Night GA Travelcard is available on the SwissPass.

question: Do I need a Half Fare Travelcard to buy a Night GA Travelcard?
answer: No, you do not need a Half Fare Travelcard to buy a Night GA Travelcard.

question: Does the Night GA Travelcard remain valid after my 25th birthday?
answer: Yes. If you turn 25 while your Night GA Travelcard is valid, you can continue to use it until the end of the period of validity. However, you cannot buy a Night GA Travelcard after your 25th birthday.

question: Where is my Night GA Travelcard valid?
answer: The area of validity for the Night GA Travelcard corresponds to that of the GA Travelcard.                                             Go to the Night GA Travelcard area of validity

question: Can I deposit my Night GA Travelcard or return it and have it refunded?
answer: You cannot deposit or return your Night GA Travelcard. A refund is possible if you purchase a GA Travelcard from the standard GA Travelcard range instead.                                              Go to the refund conditions as per Tariff 600.9 Refunds, Chapter 4 (in German, French and Italian)                         Link opens in new window.

question: My train leaves before 7pm – what ticket do I need?
answer: The Night GA Travelcard is valid from 7pm. Validity is based on the scheduled departure time. For departures before 7pm, a ticket valid as far as the first stop made by the train after 7pm must be purchased. This rule also applies to journeys with EasyRide or other check-in/check-out solutions.

question: How long is the Night GA Travelcard valid for?
answer: The Night GA Travelcard is valid for one year from its first day of validity.

question: How much does the Night GA Travelcard cost?
answer: Until you turn 25, you can buy the Night GA Travelcard for one year for CHF 99. The Night GA Travelcard is available for the 2nd class.                                             More about the Night GA Travelcard

Eyes open and not covered. Plain background. Even lighting (no shadows). Clear with high contrast. Black and white or colour. Approx. size 35mm × 45mm. Analogue passport photo: only original prints, no scans or photos printed out on paper. Digital passport photo: unedited, min. image size 200 × 250 pixels; in .JPG or .JPEG format with a maximum size of 4MB.  Purchasing a Night GA Travelcard online for the first time. If you already have a SwissPass or used to have another public transport travelcard, we will use the same photo for your new travelcard. Children and young people aged at least 6 and under 25 only need a new photo if the current photo was taken more than five years ago. First-time purchasing online with an identity check. If you are purchasing a Night GA Travelcard for the first time and do not yet have a SwissPass or travelcard, you can upload your digital passport photo once the purchasing process (including the identity check) is complete.  Purchasing for the first time via the order form. You will need to submit an original, high resolution passport photo taken recently. Your photo will be stored electronically for a maximum of five years (applicable for children and young people under 25).  Please write your first name and surname in block capitals on the back of the photo. Please attach the photo to the order form in the space indicated.  Purchasing the travelcard for the first time at a staffed point of sale. Please bring a recent analogue or digital passport photo to the counter. Changing your photo. If you would like to update your photo before the 5/10 year period has elapsed, please bring a recent analogue or digital passport photo to a public transport point of sale. You can then get a new SwissPass card with the new photo for a fee of CHF 30.

question: Which documents do I need to purchase a Night GA Travelcard for the first time?
answer: Purchasing online with a SwissPass. If you already have a SwissPass, you will need the following documents to purchase your GA Travelcard for the first time online.  Debit or credit card (PostFinance Card, Mastercard, Visa, Reka Card, American Express, Diners, JCB or myOne), Twint. Passport or ID card. When buying online, you can enter details for the following types of ID: passports and ID cards issued in Switzerland, Germany, Austria, France, Italy or Liechtenstein.   Purchasing online with an identity check. When purchasing with the identity check, you can only buy a Night GA Travelcard for yourself. You will need:  a smartphone with a camera. a debit or credit card (PostFinance Card, Mastercard, Visa, Reka Card, American Express, Diners, JCB or myOne), Twint. a recent, high-quality, digital passport photo. a passport or ID card. To purchase for the first time at a public transport point of sale, you need a recent analogue or digital passport photo and the passport/ID card for yourself or the other person (for example, if you are purchasing a Night GA Travelcard for your child as a parent or for another person).

question: How do I pay when renewing my Half Fare Travelcard?
answer: You can find information about payment options for subsequent invoices on the SwissPass website.                                             Go to information on paying subsequent invoices                         Link opens in new window.

question: Can I suspend or deposit my Half Fare Travelcard?
answer: No. You cannot suspend or deposit the Half Fare Travelcard because after just a few journeys you will already have recovered the cost of the travelcard.

question: How can I renew my Half Fare Travelcard?
answer: Your Half Fare Travelcard renews automatically.  When buying a Half Fare Travelcard you take out an indefinite contract. The advantage is that your travelcard is automatically renewed when your year-long validity period comes to an end. Your SwissPass card is valid for five years and your travelcard will be automatically renewed on this card. We will remind you of the possible cancellation date well ahead of the automatic annual renewal. You will receive this reminder together with your annual invoice. You can also subscribe to an e-mail or SMS reminder for this cancellation date in your customer account on swisspass.chLink opens in new window.. Payment arrears. Please note that if you do not pay your annual Half Fare Travelcard renewal fee on time, you will be in arrears without warning. At this point you can no longer cancel your Half Fare Travelcard. If you are in arrears, we can block your Half Fare Travelcard after one month of validity.

question: I have lost my Half Fare Travelcard on the SwissPass – what should I do?
answer: No problem, you can order a SwissPass replacement card for CHF 30 online at SBB.ch, via the SBB Contact Center or at a staffed public transport point of sale.                                             Order a SwissPass replacement card

question: How long does it take to receive my Half Fare Travelcard on the SwissPass?
answer: Already have a SwissPass? Your Half Fare Travelcard will be valid on the SwissPass from its first day of validity.  This is your first SwissPass? Your Half Fare Travelcard on the SwissPass will be delivered by post within around ten days. If you would like your new Half Fare Travelcard to be valid earlier, we can provide a temporary SwissPass. If you order online, you can print it out as a PDF. If you order using the order form, bring all your documents with you to the counter and you will receive it there.

question: How can I buy a Half Fare Travelcard?
answer: First-time purchase online. When purchasing online, the most important thing is your customer number in the format 000-000-000-0. If you have or had a SwissPass or a public transport travelcard in the last five years, you can find this number on your SwissPass card and use it to purchase your Half Fare Travelcard online. If you used to have a travelcard but have forgotten the customer number, you can find out what it is by going to a public transport point of sale or phoning the SBB Contact Center on 0848 44 66 88 (CHF 0.08/min.). To purchase a Half Fare Travelcard for another person online, they also need to have a customer number. First-time purchasing online with an identity check. If you don’t have a travelcard or a SwissPass, you can still buy your new Half Fare Travelcard online. If you are buying a travelcard for the first time, we need to verify your identity. This identity check takes place online – you will need your passport or ID card and a smartphone with a camera. You will also need a recent, high-quality, digital passport photo. It is not possible to purchase a Half Fare Travelcard for another person online using the identity check. question: How can I cancel my Half Fare Travelcard?
answer: You can find all the questions and answers about cancelling your Half Fare Travelcard on the cancellation help page.                                             Go to Half Fare Travelcard cancellation

question: I have changed my name. How can I change this on my SwissPass?
answer: Go to help with changing your name and address

question: Where can I find information about my Half Fare Travelcard?
answer: You can find all information about your travelcard online at swisspass.ch/loginLink opens in new window.:  Manage your address. Retrieve your invoices. Change your login details. Customise how we contact you. Set up a cancellation reminder. Overview of all services on the SwissPass.

question: I am on the move and I have forgotten my Half Fare Travelcard on the SwissPass. What can I do?
answer: If you leave your SwissPass at home or in the office, you can display it easily in the SBB Mobile app in the Tickets & SwissPass tile (you must have a SwissPass login with a linked customer number).  Alternatively, for a fee of CHF 5 we can issue you with a temporary card valid for two days, available at any ticket counter, upon presentation of official ID.

question: I have a new address. How can I change this on my SwissPass?
answer: Go to help with changing your name and address

question: How can I pay for the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS?
answer: You can pay for the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS at public transport points of sale and online at SBB.ch using the standard payment methods (exception: purchase by invoice not possible). The amount paid in corresponds to the customer deposit.

question: How does the bonus work?
answer: When using the credit as a payment method, the tickets are first paid for from the customer deposit. Once the customer deposit amount has been used up, the bonus phase begins. From this point on, tickets are paid for using the bonus component.  The bonus phase ends either  once a year has passed (on the last day of validity of the package), once the credit has been fully used before the last day of validity of the package (customer deposit and bonus component) or following cancellation.                                              More about the advantages of the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS

question: Can I have my Half Fare Travelcard PLUS credit blocked?
answer: Yes, you can. You can arrange for your Half Fare Travelcard PLUS credit to be blocked as follows:   online via the swisspass.ch platform in person at a public transport point of sale by calling the SBB Contact Center on 0848 44 66 88 (CHF 0.08/min.), every day, 24/7, queues possible at times).

question: What happens if I do not use up my Half Fare Travelcard PLUS credit within one year?
answer: The Half Fare Travelcard PLUS credit for the package you select will end once it has been fully used, one year after the first day of validity at the latest (one travelcard year) or after cancellation of the contract. Once the travelcard year has passed, the remaining (unused) amount of your customer deposit will be reimbursed to your bank/postal account. No offsetting is permitted for the new travelcard period of validity. The (remaining) bonus automatically expires after a year. There is no right to payment or credit for other/new offers for the remaining bonus.

question: What bonus/advantage do I get with the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS?
answer: As the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS consists of a “customer deposit” paid in by you and a bonus component, you travel for free once you have used up your customer deposit.

question: Do I need a Half Fare Travelcard in order to purchase a Half Fare Travelcard PLUS?
answer: No. You are not required to hold a Half Fare Travelcard to benefit from the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS offer. However, from a cost perspective, using a Half Fare Travelcard PLUS without a Half Fare Travelcard is not recommended.

question: Is a Half Fare Travelcard included in the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS?
answer: No. The Half Fare Travelcard is not a component of the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS and must be purchased separately.

question: Where can I purchase the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS?
answer: You can obtain the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS at all public transport points of sale and online at SBB.ch. Over time, the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS will also become available via the digital channels of other transport companies.

question: How can I activate my Half Fare Travelcard PLUS as a payment method?
answer: At SBB.ch. Please verify your cell phone number in your customer account on “swisspass.chLink opens in new window.” (under customer data > correspondence) and enter the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS as a payment method on “SBB.ch” (under profile > payment method). In the SBB Mobile (from version 12.20.0) / Preview app. You can activate your Half Fare Travelcard PLUS in the app once you have successfully concluded the contract and deposited the corresponding credit. You can find the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS in the ‘Tickets & Travelcards’ tab and in the ‘Profile’ tab under your stored payment methods. Tap on the item to start the activation and follow the instructions.

question: Can I withdraw from the contract?
answer: Upon conclusion of the contract, you are granted a 10-day right of withdrawal, but only as long as you have not yet used your credit to pay for tickets. If you conclude your contract but do not pay your customer deposit within 10 days, the contract will be cancelled.

question: How long is the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS contract valid?
answer: Any contracting party residing in Switzerland, Germany, France, Italy, Austria or the Principality of Liechtenstein concludes the contract for an unlimited period. All other contracting parties and minors receive the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS for a limited period of one year.

question: Can I cancel the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS?
answer: You can cancel the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS contract by giving one month’s notice before the end of each travelcard month.  You can cancel:  online via the cancellation form in person at a public transport point of sale in writing by sending a letter to the SBB Contact Center, P.O. Box, 3900 Brig. by calling the SBB Contact Center on 0848 44 66 88 (CHF 0.08/min.), every day, 24/7, queues possible at times).  If you still have Half Fare Travelcard PLUS credit after one year or if you wish to cancel early, the remaining customer deposit (original customer deposit minus credit already used) will be returned to you. If you cancel during the year, a processing fee (deductible) will be applied. The bonus amount expires. It is only possible to pay out the remaining customer deposit to the contracting party’s personal bank/postal account. SBB reserves the right to cancel the contract at any time for justified reasons.                                             Go to the cancellation form

question: How do I pay when renewing my Half Fare Travelcard PLUS?
answer: You can pay for the renewal of the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS at public transport points of sale and online at SBB.ch using the standard payment methods (exception: purchase by invoice not possible). The amount paid in corresponds to the customer deposit.

question: Can I “top up” my Half Fare Travelcard PLUS credit (before it expires)?
answer: Once you have completely used up your customer deposit and are in the bonus phase, you can make another deposit for a new package and then receive the bonus that comes with it. The payment can be made at a staffed public transport point of sale or online at SBB.ch. The validity period is again one year from the selected first day of validity. It is only possible to make a deposit for the same package size. If you would like a different package size, you will have to cancel your contract and conclude a new contract for the new package size.

question: Can I also buy tickets for other passengers using my Half Fare Travelcard PLUS?
answer: No. The Half Fare Travelcard PLUS is personal. As the holder of a Half Fare Travelcard PLUS, you are also the contracting party. Buying tickets for other passengers is not permitted. In the event of a breach of this rule or of misuse, we reserve the right to terminate the contract at any time.

question: Where can I view my current Half Fare Travelcard PLUS balance?
answer: SBB.ch. After successfully logging in via SwissPass, you can view your balance at SBB.ch in your profile under ‘Payment method’. SBB Mobile (from version 12.20.0) / Preview app. You can view your current balance via the SBB Mobile app in the ‘Tickets & Travelcards’ tab and in the ‘Profile’ tab under your stored payment methods.

question: Which tickets can I buy with my Half Fare Travelcard PLUS?
answer: The Half Fare Travelcard PLUS can be used for personal individual tickets and day passes of National Direct Service and the fare networks (including ‘Sparwelt’). It works for both 1st and 2nd class. The Half Fare Travelcard PLUS cannot be combined with other discount models (excluding ‘Sparwelt’).  Tickets via EasyRide. (Supersaver) tickets. (Saver) Day Passes. (Supersaver) class upgrade. Tickets, Day Passes for Dogs and Bike Day Passes. Reservations.  The following are excluded:  Travelcards. Multiple-journey tickets. Municipal (Saver) Day Passes. the promotional range (from partners such as Coop, Interdiscount, Lidl, etc.). the Junior Travelcard. the Children’s Co-Travelcard. international tickets and reservations including the regions on either side of the border.

question: I purchased a ticket with my Half Fare Travelcard PLUS. Can I get a refund for this ticket?
answer: Yes. Personal tickets paid for using your Half Fare Travelcard PLUS credit are refunded to the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS account. If the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS package is no longer active, the credit will be issued in the form of a voucher/coupon. There is no entitlement to a refund for tickets valid outside the validity period of the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS package (advance sale) that were paid for with the bonus portion.

question: Which Half Fare Travelcard PLUS packages are available?
answer: The Half Fare Travelcard PLUS is offered with credit amounts of CHF 1,000, CHF 2,000 and CHF 3,000. There is a difference between the customer deposits and the bonus components for the following two customer groups: ‘Adults’ (aged 25 and older) and ‘Youth’ (aged at least 6 and under 25).                                             Go to the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS packages

question: How can I activate my Half Fare Travelcard PLUS as a payment method?
answer: Activation on SBB.ch.  If you haven’t already: carry out the two-factor authentication of your mobile phone number on swisspass.ch under ‘My account’ > ‘Customer data’ > ‘Correspondence’.  Log in to SBB.ch with your SwissPass login. Under ‘Profile’ select ‘Payment method’. Click on ‘Enter payment method’ for the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS. You will receive an SMS with an activation code. Enter this activation code in the corresponding field and complete the verification process by clicking ‘Confirm’. The Half Fare Travelcard PLUS has now been successfully activated and added as a payment method. The Half Fare Travelcard PLUS is now available to you on SBB.ch and on SBB Mobile / Preview. If you wish to use it, please ensure that you select the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS payment method each time you purchase a ticket.  Activation on SBB Mobile / Preview.   If you haven’t already: carry out the two-factor authentication of your mobile phone number on swisspass.ch under ‘My account’ > ‘Customer data’ > ‘Correspondence’.  Please ensure that you are using the latest version of the SBB Mobile / Preview app (version 12.20.0 onwards / App StoreLink opens in new window., Google PlayLink opens in new window.). Log in to SBB Mobile / Preview with your SwissPass login if you are not already logged in. Under ‘Profile’ select ‘Payment method’. Click on the ֲ‘Half Fare Travelcard PLUSֽ’ payment method. If the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS does not appear, log out of the app and log in again. Click on ‘Activate credit’. You will receive an SMS with an activation code. Enter this activation code in the corresponding field and complete the verification by clicking ‘Confirm’. The Half Fare Travelcard PLUS has now been successfully activated and added as a means of payment. The Half Fare Travelcard PLUS is now available on SBB Mobile / Preview and on SBB.ch. If you wish to use it, please ensure that you select the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS payment method each time you purchase a ticket.

question: How can I renew my Half Fare Travelcard PLUS?
answer: Unless cancelled, at the end of the current travelcard year, you will automatically receive another invoice for the same Half Fare Travelcard PLUS package as in your valid contract. You will receive a reminder of your cancellation options ahead of time. If you do not cancel on time, you must pay the invoice with the outstanding amount by the first day of validity for the new period.

question: Can I use my Half Fare Travelcard PLUS for EasyRide?
answer: Yes. Personal EasyRide tickets can be paid for using Half Fare Travelcard PLUS credit.

question: What is the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS?
answer: The Half Fare Travelcard PLUS is a public transport offer in Switzerland. It is available in various credit sizes (“packages”) and consists of two components: the “customer deposit” (payment by the passenger) and the “bonus”, which the public transport sector grants according to defined rules. When you conclude a Half Fare Travelcard PLUS contract and pay the customer deposit, you will have a personal credit which is stored as the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS payment method in the digital sales channels for public transport. You can use this credit to pay for your personal single tickets in digital channels for a maximum of one year.                                             Go to the Half Fare Plus packages

question: How do I buy tickets and Day Passes in the SBB Mobile app using the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS?
answer: Before you can buy tickets with the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS, you first need to activate the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS as a payment method. (See question ‘How do I activate my Half Fare Travelcard PLUS in the SBB Mobile app?’) You can then select it as a payment method from the first day of validity onwards and use it to buy personal single tickets and Day Passes.

question: How can I pay using Half Fare Travelcard PLUS credit?
answer: From the first day of validity and subject to successful payment, you can use your credit package to pay for personal tickets which you purchase independently via digital channels (prepaid and postpaid). Before you can use the credit, you must activate it on the desired digital sales channels on the swisspass.ch platform using two-factor authentication.

question: Can I suspend or deposit my Half Fare Travelcard PLUS?
answer: No. The validity of the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS cannot be suspended and the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS cannot be deposited However, it is possible to cancel the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS contract.

question: I would like to switch to another Half Fare Travelcard PLUS package. Is that possible?
answer: Yes, it is. However, you must cancel your existing Half Fare Travelcard PLUS package before switching.

question: Can I freely select the start date for the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS?
answer: The first day of validity of the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS is ‘today plus one day’ at the earliest. Example: On 10 January 2024, you can purchase a Half Fare Travelcard PLUS that is valid from 11 January 2024 or later, but not one that is valid from 10 January 2024. Apart from this, the first day of validity may be freely selected (flexible date), provided the advance sale period of two months is observed.

question: Can Point-to-Point and Regional Travelcards be combined?
answer: Yes. If you travel regularly between fare networks or outside a fare network and would like to use the local transport, the Modular Travelcard presents an ideal solution.                                             Go to the Modular Travelcard

question: Which payment methods can I use to pay for my Point-to-Point Travelcard?
answer: Purchasing online. When purchasing online, you can pay by credit card, PostFinance Card, Reka Card, Twint or via invoice. Purchasing at SBB ticket machines (only Point-to-Point Travelcards for one month).                                             Go to payment methods at SBB ticket machines                                                                Payment by invoice.  We will send you the invoice together with a payment slip in the post. Please note:  Your order must be placed at least ten days before your travelcard validity begins. Otherwise your payment by invoice cannot be processed and will be returned. We will send you the invoice separately – i.e. not together with your SwissPass card. You must pay the invoice before the first day that your travelcard is valid, otherwise you will receive a payment reminder.  Purchasing at a staffed public transport point of sale.  When purchasing at a staffed point of sale, the following payment methods are available to you: cash, vouchers, Reka Check, Reka Rail, Twint, debit or credit card (PostFinance Card, Mastercard, Visa, Reka Card, American Express, Diners, JCB or myOne). Payment by credit card (please keep in mind the limit on your card). You can pay for your new travelcard with the following credit cards:  Visa (incl. prepaid cards) MasterCard (incl. prepaid cards) American Express Diners Club International JCB MyOne  Please note:  The credit card must be in the same name as the contracting party. The credit card will be charged once the order has been received.

question: What discounts do Point-to-Point Travelcards provide?
answer: If you buy your Point-to-point Travelcard for 12 months. you only pay for 9. Children and young people aged at least 6 and under 25 benefit from an attractive discount.

question: How long does it take to receive my Point-to-Point Travelcard on the SwissPass?
answer: Already have a SwissPass? Your Point-to-Point Travelcard will be integrated on the SwissPass from its first day of validity.  This is your first SwissPass? Your Point-to-Point Travelcard on the SwissPass will be delivered by post within around 10 days. If you would like your travelcard to be valid earlier, we can provide a temporary SwissPass. If you purchase online, you can print it out as a PDF.

question: When do I buy a Point-to-Point Travelcard, when a Regional Travelcard and when a Modular Travelcard?
answer: If your chosen route lies within a fare network, you can buy a Regional Travelcard, but not a Point-to-Point Travelcard. If you regularly travel between fare networks or outside a fare network and would like to use local transport, the Modular Travelcard is an ideal solution. It is worth noting that purchasing a GA Travelcard is the best option beyond a certain distance.

question: Is a Point-to-Point Travelcard cheaper than a GA Travelcard?
answer: No, not in every case. From a certain distance a GA Travelcard can offer the best value.                                             To the GA Travelcard

question: How can I buy a Point-to-Point Travelcard online?
answer: First-time purchasing online. When purchasing online, the most important thing is your customer number in the format 000-000-000-0. If you have or had a SwissPass or a public transport travelcard in the last five years, you can find this number on your SwissPass card and use it to purchase your Point-to-Point Travelcard online. If you used to have a travelcard but have forgotten the customer number, you can find out what it is by going to a public transport point of sale or phoning the SBB Contact Center on 0848 44 66 88 (CHF 0.08/min.). If you would like to purchase a Point-to-Point Travelcard for another person online, they must also have a customer number. Purchasing online with the identity check. If you don’t have a travelcard or a SwissPass, you can still buy your new Point-to-Point Travelcard online. If you are buying a travelcard for the first time, we need to verify your identity. This identity check takes place online – you will need your passport or ID card and a smartphone with a camera. You will also need a recent, high-quality, digital passport photo. Online purchase with an identity check is not possible for other persons Questions on the identity checkLink opens in new window. Buy the Point-to-Point Travelcard online here

question: Is a Point-to-Point Travelcard cheaper with a Half Fare Travelcard?
answer: No, because you cannot combine a Point-to-Point Travelcard with a Half Fare Travelcard.

question: Where can I purchase Point-to-Point Travelcards?
answer: Point-to-Point Travelcard for 1 month: You can buy the travelcard online, at an SBB ticket machine or a public transport point of sale.   Point-to-Point Travelcard for 12 months: You can buy the travelcard online or at a public transport point of sale.  To make sure you receive the right offer for adults, young people or children when purchasing online, please enter the relevant customer number. You will find the customer number on the SwissPass in the format 000-000-000-0.  Of course, you can also purchase all Point-to-Point Travelcards at a staffed public transport point of sale. Please bring your SwissPass (if you have one), a recent analogue or digital passport photo and your passport/ID card. If you are purchasing the Point-to-Point Travelcard for another person, then please bring the same documents for this person.                                              Buy the Point-to-Point Travelcard online here

question: What do I need to consider when taking my photo?
answer: Requirements. For the travelcard on the SwissPass, you need to provide a recent analogue or digital passport photo which fulfils the following criteria:  Taken from the front. Eyes open and not covered. Plain background. Even lighting (no shadows). Clear with high contrast. Black and white or colour. Approx. size 35mm × 45mm. Analogue passport photo: only original prints, no scans or photos printed out on paper. Digital passport photo: unedited, min. image size 200 × 250 pixels; in .JPG or .JPEG format with a maximum size of 4MB.  Purchasing a Point-to-Point Travelcard online for the first time. If you already have a SwissPass or used to have another public transport travelcard, we will use the same photo for your new travelcard. In this case, adults will only need to provide a new photo if the previous one was taken more than ten years ago.
