answer: The IC trains on lines 2/21 (Basel/Zurich–Ticino) need to be reserved every day of the week during the cycling season from 21 March to 31 October. You can reserve bicycle spaces using the SBB Mobile app. Bicycle spaces on EuroCity trains to/from Italy can also be reserved for journeys within Switzerland. You can reserve bicycle spaces using the SBB Mobile app.

question: Is the annual bike pass non-transferable?
answer: Yes, the annual bike pass is integrated onto a personal SwissPass and is therefore only valid for that person.

question: Can my (e-)scooter come with me on the train?
answer: Yes. You can take both e-scooters and normal scooters on the train.   Please stow your (electric) scooter in a suitable location on the train and ensure that it does not protrude into the passageway or take up bicycle spaces (e.g. under or between the seats). If your (electric) scooter can be folded, we kindly request that you place it folded up under the seat or in the luggage racks/niches. This ensures that more space is available for luggage, prams etc. Both foldable and unfoldable (electric) scooters are transported free of charge, provided the largest wheel has a diameter of no more than 30cm or less than 12 inches).

question: How can I see which coaches have the bike spaces?
answer: The coach and space number is indicated on your reservation confirmation. On the day of your journey, you can check the train formation to see in which sector the coach with your reserved space is located. The train formation can be found in the SBB Mobile app and on the online timetable at SBB.ch. In the app, swipe the desired connection from right to left to do this. For the desired connection, click on the ‘Show details’ button in the online timetable. Then click on the arrow in the bottom left until the route and train formation are shown. Via SBB Mobile: Image legend: Choose a connection in the SBB Mobile app. Then swipe the connection from right to left. Image legend: The train formation will be displayed after you swipe.  In the timetable on SBB.ch: Image legend: Choose your preferred connection in the SBB.ch timetable. Click on the button labelled «Show details» in the connection details. Image legend: By clicking on the arrow in the bottom left (Trip info), you can change the view and show the train formation. At the railway station. At many stations, the coach numbers can be seen on the blue displays on the platform. These may also display the bicycle pictograms.

question: Is it possible to reserve bicycle spaces on trains which do not require reservation?
answer: No, bicycle space reservations can only be made on trains where reservations are compulsory (bicycle symbol with R ). On all other trains, it is not possible to reserve bicycle spaces.

question: Can I take my bike with me as hand luggage?
answer: Yes, you can in certain cases.                                             Go to bicycles as hand luggage

question: Can groups of 10 or more people load their bicycles themselves?
answer: No, we cannot offer self-service loading of bicycles for groups of 10 or more people.                                             More about self-service loading of bicycles for groups

question: Is it possible to rebook or cancel reservations which have already been made using the SBB Mobile app?
answer: No. Unfortunately, this is not possible at the moment.

question: How many bicycle spaces can I reserve at the same time?
answer: If there are enough available spaces in a coach, you can reserve up to 9 bicycle spaces at the same time. However, it is not possible to reserve more spaces at the same time than are available in a given individual coach.

question: On which trains can I reserve bicycle spaces using the SBB Mobile app?
answer: You can reserve bike spaces via the SBB Mobile app on all trains within Switzerland if reservation is mandatory at the time of your journey.

question: Where and how can I buy tickets for my bicycle?
answer: Purchase bike tickets. You can purchase bike tickets online on SBB.ch, via the SBB Mobile app, from ticket machines or at a public transport point of sale. Before you buy a ticket. Have you checked the timetable to see whether a bicycle reservation is necessary for the route you want to take? If a reservation is required, we recommend that you make the reservation first and only then buy the bike ticket. Unfortunately, it is not currently possible to purchase the reservation together with the ticket.                                             Go to bike space reservations.                                                                 Purchase for yourself and for your bike in the SBB Mobile app. If you would like to buy the ticket for your bike together with your own ticket, proceed as follows:  Enter the route and select your desired connection. Select ‘Tickets from CHF...’. Tap on ‘Edit passenger’ (pencil symbol). Tap the plus sign at the bottom next to the bicycle symbol once. Tap on ‘Accept’. The bike ticket will now appear together with your ticket in the overview and you can buy the tickets together. Would you like to buy a ticket and a bike ticket for several people at the same time? Add a bicycle for each co-passenger. Only one bike can be taken per person. Children aged under 16 who are accompanied by an adult do not need a bike ticket.   Purchase in the SBB Mobile app (if you already have a ticket for yourself).  Enter the route and select your desired connection.  Select ‘Tickets from CHF...’. Tap on ‘Edit passenger’ (pencil symbol). (Only if you do NOT have a GA Travelcard: enter a new fictitious co-passenger with your own name. To do this, please swap your first name and last name around and enter a GA Travelcard as the travelcard). Tap the plus sign at the bottom next to the bicycle symbol once (or several times if you want to buy several bike tickets). Tap on ‘Accept’. The bicycle ticket will now appear in the overview and you can buy the ticket.  Online on SBB.ch with a login.  Here’s how it works:  Enter the route into the timetable and select your preferred connection. When entering the passengers, click on ‘Process passengers | reductions’. Enter the number of bike tickets you would like in the field following the ‘Discount cards’ field. If you do not need a ticket for yourself, check the box next to the text ‘Passenger already has a valid ticket or other valid travel document’. Click on ‘Accept’. Choose between ‘single journey’ and ‘single and return journey’. Go to the check-out and purchase the ticket with your preferred payment method.  Online on SBB.ch without a login. Here’s how it works:  Enter the route into the timetable and select your preferred connection. When entering passengers, click on ‘Add passenger’ and add the name of the passenger/co-passenger. At the same time, enter the number of bike tickets you would like in the field following the ‘Discount cards’ field. Enter the number of dog tickets you would like in the field following the ‘Discount cards’ field. If you do not need a ticket for yourself, check the box next to the text ‘Passenger already has a valid ticket or other valid travel document’. Click on ‘Accept’. Choose between ‘single journey’ and ‘single and return journey’. Go to the check-out and purchase the ticket with your chosen payment method.  Where and how can I buy a Bike Day Pass? You can purchase Bike Day Passes online on SBB.ch, via the SBB Mobile app, from ticket machines or at a public transport point of sale. The Bike Day Pass is automatically offered during purchase on SBB.ch or via SBB Mobile (see the question ‘How can I buy tickets for my bicycle?’) as soon as the price for the bike ticket reaches the amount of CHF 15. Alternatively, you can buy the Bike Day Pass directly online at SBB.ch or via the SBB Mobile app in the ‘Shop & Services’ tab.                                             Purchase the Bike Day Pass online.                                                                Please note that the area of validity for the Bike Day Pass differs from that of normal Point-to-Point Tickets and GA/Half Fare Travelcards.                                             Go to the validity of bike tickets (“yes” in column T600 for bikes)                         Link opens in new window.                                       Where and how do I buy an annual bike pass? The annual bike pass is available for CHF 260 per bike per year on the SwissPass. If you already hold a SwissPass, you can purchase an annual bike pass online or at any staffed point of sale. The annual bike pass is integrated onto your SwissPass.  Buy an annual bike pass with SwissPass online  If you do not hold a SwissPass  Please note that the area of validity for the annual bike pass differs from that of normal Point-to-Point Tickets and GA/Half Fare Travelcards.                                             Go to the validity of bike tickets (“yes” in column T600 for bikes)                         Link opens in new window.

question: What ticket do I need for a tandem?
answer: For tandems or special bicycles in general (all types of bicycles which do not fit into the normal bicycle racks or are longer than two metres, e.g. cargo bicycles, recumbent bicycles) you need a Point-to-Point Bike Ticket, a Bike Day Pass ticket or an annual bike pass. Please note the provisions of the transport companies regarding whether and under what conditions the transport of special bicycles is permitted.                                             Go to “Which bikes can I load myself?”

question: I will be travelling in 1st class. Can I also reserve a space for my bicycle in a 1st class coach?
answer: The reservation system allocates spaces automatically. Unfortunately, it is not possible to choose between 1st and 2nd class when making the reservation.

question: How can I transport my folding bicycle on the train?
answer: Folding bicycles should be stowed as luggage items under the seat, in the luggage stowage/niches or in other suitable places where they do not hinder other passengers or occupy any bicycle spaces.  You do not need a reservation or a ticket for this.  No packing/bag is required.

question: Can I change or cancel my bicycle reservation?
answer: No. Unfortunately, this is not possible at the moment.

question: I would like to reserve spaces for three bicycles but a message saying ‘fully booked’ has appeared. Why is this?
answer: Either the train is already fully booked, or the coach does not have three bicycle spaces available in the same coach. Try to split up your reservation (e.g. two bicycles and one bicycle) or choose another connection.

question: Do I have to make a reservation for children’s bicycles?
answer: No reservation is necessary for bicycles, balance bikes and scooters belonging to children below 6 years old. A reservation is required for bicycles belonging to children between the ages of 6 and 16.                                               For more information, see the question: “Do I need tickets for children’s bicycles?”

question: Can I cancel my annual bike pass and have it refunded?
answer: If you have used the annual bike pass for no more than one month and would like to cancel it, you will receive 50% of the purchase price as a refund. If you have used the annual bike pass for two months, you can still get 25% of the purchase price back. Cancellation is not possible if you have used it for more than two months.

question: Can I see the Dog Pass in my account on swisspass.ch?
answer: Yes, the travelcard is shown on swisspass.chLink opens in new window. under the travelcard holder’s login.

question: When do I need a ticket for my dog?
answer: Small dogs (with a wither height of up to 30cm max.) can be carried free of charge in a suitable container (e.g. a basket or pouch).   If you place the transport container on a seat, you need to buy a 2nd class ticket at half price or a Day Pass for Dogs. If you are travelling with a dog without a container, the dog must sit under your seat so that the passage is not blocked for other passengers. Buy a half-price 2nd class ticket or a Day Pass for Dogs for your dog.

question: Are Day Passes for dogs and Dog Passes valid in 1st and 2nd class?
answer: Day Passes for dogs and Dog Passes are not issued for a specific class and are valid both in 1st and 2nd class. The companion must hold a valid ticket for their class of travel.

question: What is a Day Pass for dogs?
answer: If you hold a valid ticket, your dog can enjoy a day’s unlimited travel with the Day Pass for dogs for 25 CHF. The Day Pass for dogs is valid on trains, boats, PostBus routes and tram and bus routes in most cities and agglomerations.

question: How can I renew my Dog Pass?
answer: You can renew your Dog Pass at a staffed point of sale or ticket machine, by phone via the SBB Contact Center on 0848 44 66 88 (CHF 0.08/min.) (credit card required) or conveniently online. To renew online, follow the link you received in the renewal e-mail.

question: How do I buy a dog ticket?
answer: Buy tickets for yourself and for your dog in the SBB Mobile app.  If you would like to buy the ticket for your dog together with your own ticket, proceed as follows:  Enter the route and select your preferred connection. Select ‘Tickets from CHF …’. 3. Tap on ‘Edit passengers’ (pencil symbol). Tap the plus sign at the bottom next to the ‘dog’ symbol once (or several times if you want to take several dogs with you). Tap on ‘Accept’. The dog ticket will now appear together with your ticket in the overview and you can buy the tickets together.  Purchase in the SBB Mobile app for your dog (if you already have a ticket for yourself). Enter the route and select your preferred connection.  Select ‘Tickets from CHF...’. Tap on ‘Edit passengers’ (pencil symbol). (Only if you do NOT have a GA Travelcard: enter a new fictitious co-passenger with your own name. To do this, please swap your first name and last name around and enter a GA Travelcard as the travelcard). Tap the plus sign at the bottom next to the ‘dog’ symbol once (or several times if you want to take several dogs with you). Tap on ‘Accept’. The dog ticket will now appear in the overview and you can buy the ticket.  Online on SBB.ch with a login.  Here’s how it works:  Enter the route into the timetable and select your preferred connection. When entering the passengers, click on ‘Process passengers | reductions’. Enter the number of dog tickets you would like in the field following the ‘Discount cards’ field. If you do not need a ticket for yourself, check the box next to the text ‘Passenger already has a valid ticket or other valid travel document’. Click on ‘Accept’. Choose between ‘single journey’ and ‘single and return journey’. Go to the check-out and purchase the ticket with your preferred payment method.  Online on SBB.ch without a login.  Here’s how it works:  Enter the route into the timetable and select your preferred connection. When entering passengers, click on ‘Add passenger’ and add the name of the passenger/co-passenger. At the same time, enter the number of dog tickets you would like in the field following the ‘Discount cards’ field. Enter the number of dog tickets you would like in the field following the ‘Discount cards’ field. If you do not need a ticket for yourself, check the box next to the text ‘Passenger already has a valid ticket or other valid travel document’. Click on ‘Accept’. Choose between ‘single journey’ and ‘single and return journey’. Go to the check-out and purchase the ticket with your chosen payment method.

question: Is the Dog Pass renewed automatically?
answer: No, the pass is not renewed automatically. We contact the customer (either by text or e-mail, depending on the travelcard holder’s settings on swisspass.chLink opens in new window.) 60 days before the travelcard expires and provide information about different renewal options.

question: What is a Dog Pass?
answer: If your dog regularly travels with you on the train, it’s worth buying an annual Dog Pass for 350 CHF. The Dog Pass is issued to one fixed companion and loaded onto their personal SwissPass. The dog will not receive its own SwissPass.  Note: the Dog Pass replaces the previous GA Travelcard for dogs.

question: What happens if I’ve left my SwissPass with the Dog Pass at home?
answer: If you leave your SwissPass holding the Dog Pass at home, we can issue you a card with temporary validity for two days at any ticket counter if you show your official ID. A charge of 5 CHF is made. The temporary card can also be shown in the mobile app (requirement: login with a linked customer number).

question: Is the Dog Pass transferable?
answer: The Dog Pass is linked with the personal SwissPass of the accompanying person. This means you can take other dogs with you too. However, if other people are taking your dog with them, each companion must purchase their own Dog Pass. For this reason, we have reduced the price (the GA Travelcard for dogs previously cost CHF 805 per year, the Dog Pass now only costs CHF 350).

question: Under what conditions can I take a dog on the train with me for free?
answer: Small dogs with a wither height of 30cm or less can travel for free provided they are in a suitable container (e.g. a transport box, a basket or another animal-friendly container) and placed under your seat.

question: Can a GA Travelcard for dogs be exchanged for a Dog Pass?
answer: You can transfer seamlessly from a GA Travelcard for dogs to a Dog Pass. The valid GA Travelcard for dogs will be refunded pro rata.

question: What do I have to be aware of when purchasing a new Dog Pass?
answer: You will receive the Dog Pass on your personal SwissPass. If you do not already own a SwissPass, you can order one by phone via the SBB Contact Center on 0848 44 66 88 (CHF 0.08/min.) or at a staffed public transport point of sale. Important: please note that when ordering a SwissPass for the first time, you must have an up-to-date, high-quality passport photo. When purchasing for the first time, your personal details will be checked using your ID or passport and you will be newly registered as a customer. This cannot be done over the phone via the Contact Center. You can also send the photo by text message or upload it online. If you already have a SwissPass – for example for your Half Fare or GA Travelcard – you can get the Dog Pass at any staffed point of sale, or conveniently online or at the ticket machine. You can find information on the price of the Dog Pass on the product page.                                             More about the Dog Pass

question: Where and how can I buy a Day Pass for dogs?
answer: The Day Pass for Dogs can be purchased conveniently online at SBB.ch, via a mobile device using the app, from ticket machines or at a public transport point of sale. The Day Pass for Dogs is automatically offered during purchase on SBB.ch or via SBB Mobile (see the question ‘How do I buy a dog ticket?’) as soon as the price for the dog ticket reaches the amount of CHF 25. Alternatively, you can buy the Day Pass for Dogs directly online at SBB.ch or via the SBB Mobile app in the ‘Shop & Services’ tab.                                             Purchase a Day Pass for Dogs online.                                                                                                            More on the Day Pass for dogs

question: Can dogs travel in coaches with Rail Catering services?
answer: Carriage of animals in coaches offering meals and refreshments (with the exception of coaches served by a Minibar) is prohibited. This does not apply to guide dogs and assistance dogs.

question: Can the Dog Pass be cancelled early?
answer: If you no longer need the Dog Pass, and you have not reached the end of the second month of its validity, you can return it. Up to the end of the first month of its validity, you receive 50% of the purchase cost in return, and 25% up to the end of the second month of its validity. Refunds are not possible after this.

question: Where can my dog travel?
answer: Small dogs with a wither height of up to 30cm. There is no cost for taking small dogs with you, provided they are in a suitable container under your seat. However, if a small dog travels outside of a container under the seat or on your lap, you require a separate 2nd class ticket at the half-fare price, a Day Pass for Dogs or a Dog Pass for the dog. If you would like your small dog to travel on a seat, the dog must be in a suitable container and you must buy a separate 2nd class ticket at the half-fare price, a Day Pass for Dogs or a Dog Pass for the dog. Large dogs with a wither height of more than 30cm. Larger dogs must sit under your seat so that passage is not blocked for other passengers. In all cases, you require a separate 2nd class ticket at the half-fare price, a Day Pass for Dogs or a Dog Pass for the dog.

question: Can groups using the Day Pass for Schools take their bikes with them on the train?
answer: No. Self-service loading of bicycles is not available for groups with the Day Pass for Schools. Find out about the other options available to you.

question: What is the Day Pass for Schools?
answer: School classes and Y+S (Youth+Sports) groups with passengers under 25 years old can benefit from the affordable Day Pass for Schools. Children, young people, dogs and accompanying adults can travel for one day as a group of 10 or more in 2nd class for as little as CHF 15 – wherever the GA Travelcard is valid. The usual registration requirement for groups applies.

question: Is the Day Pass for Schools also available for accompanying adults aged 25 or over?
answer: The Day Pass for Schools also costs CHF 15 for accompanying adults aged 25 or over. A maximum of two accompanying adults aged 25 or over are permitted for each eight young people (aged 6–24.99).

question: Who is the Day Pass for Schools available for?
answer: The Day Pass for Schools is valid for travel as a group as part of school trips or Youth+Sports events. The group can be made up of the following passengers aged from 6 and under 25 (up to 24.99 years old):  children aged at least 6 from public or private nurseries. pupils from the 1st to 9th year at public and private middle schools, or schools for the disabled, deaf, blind and visually impaired. students from higher education institutes and universities. young people from disabled youth institutes, orphanages and children’s homes. people taking part in Youth+Sports events, Youth+Sports camps and other official camps and events (training camps, music camps etc.).

question: Which Day Passes for Schools are available?
answer: The Day Pass for Schools is only available in 2nd class and cannot be combined with a class upgrade.

question: Some passengers in our group are wheelchair users. Can they travel together with us?
answer: Yes, you have to tell us when ordering your group journey so that a suitable coach can be reserved for you. At the same time, notify the SBB Contact Center Handicap about your journey. Groups that include more than one wheelchair user can only be carried subject to certain conditions. The double-deck trains for long-distance services enable travel in a group (maximum of ten people in wheelchairs). On board all other trains, groups may only be able to travel in different compartments or split across several trains, depending on the size of the group.                                              Go to the SBB Contact Center Handicap

question: Do I need to book a school trip with a Day Pass for Schools in advance and, if so, how far in advance?
answer: School trips must be booked in advance. When you make the purchase at a staffed public transport point of sale, we ask you to register the journey at the latest two working days before your departure. (For example, if you are travelling on a Thursday, the request must be submitted by Monday evening at the latest).

question: Do people with a GA Travelcard, Point-to-Point Travelcard, Modular Travelcard or Regional Travelcard count as part of the group?
answer: People holding a GA Travelcard, Point-to-Point Travelcard, Modular Travelcard or Regional Travelcard count towards the minimum number of participants provided the area of validity for their travelcard(s) covers the route of the group journey in full.

question: Are luggage offers available for groups?
answer: We provide the following luggage offers for group journeys in Switzerland:                                             Go to group luggage offers for Switzerland

question: Are group reservations on trains always labelled?
answer: No, there is not always a label on the train. For group journeys on RegioExpress, regional and S-Bahn trains, the seating the group needs is provided but no physical reservation label is provided on the train. On long-distance trains travelling before 6am and after 8pm, reservation labels are also not provided.

question: Our school trip costs less than CHF 15 per person. What options do we have?
answer: For group journeys under the price threshold of the Day Pass for Schools (CHF 15 per person), please buy standard group tickets or group tickets from the regional fare networks.

question: Is the Day Pass for Schools also available for dogs?
answer: Dogs can also travel with you for CHF 15. The dog counts towards the minimum number of participants of 10.

question: How can I buy a Day Pass for Schools and book seat reservations?
answer: The Day Pass for Schools is available at staffed public transport points of or via the order form for school trips (order deadline: at least five days in advance). It is best that the person leading the school trip books the required Day Passes for Schools (or other group tickets), including the seat reservations. To ensure we can calculate the price correctly, we need to know the ages of the pupils you are travelling with and how many hold a GA Travelcard, Half Fare Travelcard, Regional Travelcard, Point-to-Point Travelcard or Modular Travelcard for the entire route being travelled.                                              Go to the order form for school trips

question: Can I change the number of participants?
answer: You can change the number of passengers up until 30 minutes before the start of the journey free of charge at a staffed public transport point of sale. If you make a change later, we will charge an excess of CHF 10 for each refund request made if the group becomes smaller. If a change is made, you should always ask train staff to confirm how many passengers actually make the journey in each direction. Do the same if you use additional services from third parties at your destination. If necessary, apply for a refund after your journey.

question: Do I have to reserve seats?
answer: Yes. Seat reservations are included in the price of the tickets and will be made where possible.

question: Can I change or cancel a group trip with the Day Pass for Schools?
answer: If your group journey cannot take place as planned, let us know that you wish to amend or cancel your journey no later than 11am the day before travel. Please observe the special provisions for partner offers, including RailAway. Unfortunately, if you inform us later than this, we cannot guarantee that we will be able to make the changes. Please note that a fee of CHF 10 is charged for cancellation of unused group tickets with the Day Pass for Schools.

question: How long is the Day Pass for Schools valid?
answer: The Day Pass for Schools is only valid for the selected travel date, for journeys from Monday to Sunday from midnight to 5am the following day.

question: My SwissPass holding a Night GA Travelcard has been lost or damaged – what can I do?
answer: No problem, order a replacement SwissPass for CHF 30. We are also happy to help you at a staffed point of sale.                                             Order a replacement SwissPass

question: Which documents do I need to purchase a Night GA Travelcard for the first time?
answer: Purchasing online with a SwissPass. If you already have a SwissPass, you will need the following documents to purchase your GA Travelcard for the first time online.  Debit or credit card (PostFinance Card, Mastercard, Visa, Reka Card, American Express, Diners, JCB or myOne), Twint. Passport or ID card. When buying online, you can enter details for the following types of ID: passports and ID cards issued in Switzerland, Germany, Austria, France, Italy or Liechtenstein.   Purchasing online with an identity check. When purchasing with the identity check, you can only buy a Night GA Travelcard for yourself. You will need:  a smartphone with a camera. a debit or credit card (PostFinance Card, Mastercard, Visa, Reka Card, American Express, Diners, JCB or myOne), Twint. a recent, high-quality, digital passport photo. a passport or ID card.  List of the accepted forms of IDLink opens in new window. Questions on the identity checkLink opens in new window. Purchasing at a public transport point of sale.  To purchase for the first time at a public transport point of sale, you need a recent analogue or digital passport photo and the passport/ID card for yourself or the other person (for example, if you are purchasing a Night GA Travelcard for your child as a parent or for another person).

question: Can I deposit my Night GA Travelcard or return it and have it refunded?
answer: You cannot deposit or return your Night GA Travelcard. A refund is possible if you purchase a GA Travelcard from the standard GA Travelcard range instead.                                              Go to the refund conditions as per Tariff 600.9 Refunds, Chapter 4 (in German, French and Italian)                         Link opens in new window.

question: How can I renew my Night GA Travelcard?
answer: If you wish to renew your Night GA Travelcard after it expires, you can buy a new travelcard. The Night GA Travelcard is not renewed automatically. Before your current Night GA Travelcard expires, we will inform you about how you can renew it. Buy Night GA Travelcard online

question: How long does it take to receive my Night GA Travelcard on the SwissPass?
answer: Already have a SwissPass? Your Night GA Travelcard on the SwissPass will be valid from its first day of validity. This is your first SwissPass? Your Night GA Travelcard on the SwissPass will be delivered by post within around ten days. If you would like your Night GA Travelcard to be valid earlier, we can provide a temporary SwissPass. If you would like your new GA Travelcard to be valid earlier, we can provide a temporary SwissPass.

question: How much does the Night GA Travelcard cost?
answer: Until you turn 25, you can buy the Night GA Travelcard for one year for CHF 99. The Night GA Travelcard is available for the 2nd class.                                             More about the Night GA Travelcard

question: I would like to use my Night GA Travelcard to travel in 1st class – what do I need to be aware of?
answer: To travel in 1st class, you need to buy a 1st class upgrade for the route you wish to travel.  If you hold a Night GA Travelcard and are 16 or over, buy a first-class upgrade for the route you wish to travel. If you hold a Night GA Travelcard and a Half Fare Travelcard and are 15 years old or younger, buy a half-price first-class upgrade for the route you wish to travel. You cannot buy a 1-day class upgrade for a Night GA Travelcard.  You can buy class upgrades for a specific route online on SBB.ch, in the SBB Mobile app and from ticket machines. So you always have the option of going 1st class.

question: My train leaves before 7pm – what ticket do I need?
answer: The Night GA Travelcard is valid from 7pm. Validity is based on the scheduled departure time. For departures before 7pm, a ticket valid as far as the first stop made by the train after 7pm must be purchased. This rule also applies to journeys with EasyRide or other check-in/check-out solutions.

question: How do I buy a Night GA Travelcard?
answer: First-time purchase online.  When purchasing online, the most important thing is your customer number in the format 000-000-000-0. If you have or had a SwissPass or a public transport travelcard in the last five years, you can find this number on your SwissPass card and use it to purchase your Night GA Travelcard online. If you used to have a travelcard but have forgotten the customer number, you can find out what it is by going to a public transport point of sale or phoning the SBB Contact Center on 0848 44 66 88 (CHF 0.08/min.). First-time purchasing online with an identity check. If you do not yet hold a travelcard or a SwissPass, you can still buy your new Night GA Travelcard online. If you are buying a travelcard for the first time, we need to verify your identity. This identity check takes place online – you will need your passport or ID card and a smartphone with a camera. You will also need a recent, high-quality, digital passport photo. Online purchase with an identity check is not possible for other persons.                                             Questions on the identity check                         Link opens in new window.                                       You may also want to know: if you wish to buy the Night GA Travelcard for your children, you can do so, as long as you and your child hold SwissPass cards with a linked SwissPass login. To buy for your child, select Purchase a travelcard for another person during the purchasing process. Buy Night GA Travelcard online Note: a SwissPass login is linked with SBB.ch if the customer number is stored in your profile on SBB.ch. After signing in, click on your initials, then on Profile and then on Update details in the Personal details tile. If the customer number is displayed in the form 000-000-000-0, it means it is linked.                                              Link customer number                                                                Purchase at a staffed public transport point of sale. Of course, you can also purchase the Night GA Travelcard at a staffed public transport point of sale. Please bring your SwissPass (if you have one), a recent analogue or digital passport photo and your passport/ID card. If you are purchasing for another person, then please bring the documents for this person (e.g. for your child).

question: Where is my Night GA Travelcard valid?
answer: The area of validity for the Night GA Travelcard corresponds to that of the GA Travelcard.                                             Go to the Night GA Travelcard area of validity

question: What do I need to consider when taking my photo?
answer: Requirements. For the travelcard on the SwissPass, you need to provide a recent analogue or digital passport photo which fulfils the following criteria:  Taken from the front. Eyes open and not covered. Plain background. Even lighting (no shadows). Clear with high contrast. Black and white or colour. Approx. size 35mm × 45mm. Analogue passport photo: only original prints, no scans or photos printed out on paper. Digital passport photo: unedited, min. image size 200 × 250 pixels; in .JPG or .JPEG format with a maximum size of 4MB.  Purchasing a Night GA Travelcard online for the first time. If you already have a SwissPass or used to have another public transport travelcard, we will use the same photo for your new travelcard. Children and young people aged at least 6 and under 25 only need a new photo if the current photo was taken more than five years ago. First-time purchasing online with an identity check. If you are purchasing a Night GA Travelcard for the first time and do not yet have a SwissPass or travelcard, you can upload your digital passport photo once the purchasing process (including the identity check) is complete.  Purchasing for the first time via the order form. You will need to submit an original, high resolution passport photo taken recently. Your photo will be stored electronically for a maximum of five years (applicable for children and young people under 25).  Please write your first name and surname in block capitals on the back of the photo. Please attach the photo to the order form in the space indicated.  Purchasing the travelcard for the first time at a staffed point of sale. Please bring a recent analogue or digital passport photo to the counter. Changing your photo. If you would like to update your photo before the 5/10 year period has elapsed, please bring a recent analogue or digital passport photo to a public transport point of sale. You can then get a new SwissPass card with the new photo for a fee of CHF 30.

question: Who is the Night GA Travelcard suitable for?
answer: The Night GA Travelcard is ideal if you are aged under 25 and are often on the move in the evenings. Because the Night GA Travelcard lets you enjoy unlimited travel in 2nd class on SBB trains, most other railways and many other public transport services in Switzerland from 7pm to 5am (on Saturday, Sunday and public holidays until 7am) – as if you had a GA Travelcard. The Night GA Travelcard is available on the SwissPass.

question: How long is the Night GA Travelcard valid for?
answer: The Night GA Travelcard is valid for one year from its first day of validity.

question: Do I need a Half Fare Travelcard to buy a Night GA Travelcard?
answer: No, you do not need a Half Fare Travelcard to buy a Night GA Travelcard.

question: Do I receive a discount on routes where the Night GA Travelcard is not valid?
answer: No.                                             Go to the Night GA Travelcard area of validity

question: My train arrives after 5am / 7am. Do I need to buy another ticket?
answer: The Night GA Travelcard is valid up to the last stop reached before 5am / 7am at the weekend and on public holidays. For travel after 5am / 7am, please buy a ticket.  If you hold a Night GA Travelcard and are aged 16 or over, please buy a full price ticket for your chosen route. If you hold a Night GA Travelcard and a Half Fare Travelcard or if you hold a seven25 Travelcard and are 15 years old or younger, buy a half-price ticket for the rest of your journey.

question: How can I pay for a new Night GA Travelcard?
answer: Purchasing online. When purchasing online, you can pay by credit card, PostFinance Card, Reka Card or Twint. At a staffed public transport point of sale. When purchasing at a staffed point of sale, the following payment methods are available to you: cash, vouchers, Reka Check, Reka Rail, Twint, debit or credit card (PostFinance Card, Mastercard, Visa, Reka Card, American Express, Diners, JCB or myOne). Payment by credit card. You can pay for your new travelcard with the following credit cards:  Visa (incl. prepaid cards) MasterCard (incl. prepaid cards) American Express Diners Club International JCB MyOne  Please note: The credit card will be charged once the order has been received.  Payment by PostFinance Card. Payment with Twint.

question: Does the Night GA Travelcard remain valid after my 25th birthday?
answer: Yes. If you turn 25 while your Night GA Travelcard is valid, you can continue to use it until the end of the period of validity. However, you cannot buy a Night GA Travelcard after your 25th birthday.

question: Is the night supplement included in the Night GA Travelcard?
answer: No, you need to buy night supplements separately.                                             Travel home safely with the nighttime network

question: I have forgotten my SwissPass holding a Night GA Travelcard – what should I do now?
answer: If you leave your SwissPass at home or in the office, you can display it very easily in the SBB Mobile app in the Tickets & SwissPass tab (you must have a login with linked customer number). Alternatively, you can buy a card with temporary validity for a fee of CHF 5 from a public transport point of sale upon presentation of official ID.

question: What do I need to buy a ticket online?
answer: You need:   a computer, tablet or smartphone with an Internet connection. an up-to-date Internet browser. a valid e-mail address so that we can send you a confirmation. a credit card (Visa, Mastercard, American Express Switzerland, Diners Club, myOne), or a prepaid card (Visa/Mastercard), or Twint, a PostFinance Card, Reka Card or a billing address in Switzerland (for monthly invoicing). a PDF reader and a printer if you wish to print your ticket.

question: How far in advance can I purchase tickets for Switzerland?
answer: You can buy tickets for Switzerland up to 6 months before your journey. Please note the following restrictions:  Tickets for journeys taking place after the timetable change (mid-December each year) can only be purchased once the timetables have been published, usually no earlier than mid-October. Day Passes/Saver Day Passes can always be purchased 6 months in advance, as they do not depend on the timetable. A reduced advance purchase deadline of 60 days applies to certain kinds of ticket: Tickets within the fare network. City Tickets. Group tickets. All types of travelcards and flat-rate tickets (e.g. Swiss Travel Pass).

question: What are the technical requirements?
answer: JavaScript OK SSL (https), 128 Bit OK Session Cookies OK

question: Can I buy tickets online for other people too?
answer: Yes. You need the other person’s surname, first name and date of birth to do this. You can purchase group tickets online if you are travelling as a group of 10 or more people. You must have a SwissPass login to do so.                                             Go to group tickets

question: What are the differences between a ticket purchased online and a normal ticket?
answer: Tickets purchased online:  can be bought via the Internet until shortly before departure. can be displayed directly on your desktop or on your tablet/smartphone or printed out. They can be displayed even without SBB Mobile. are specific to a person, i.e. only valid with a personal ID document (passport, ID, driving licence, Half Fare Travelcard, GA Travelcard). are always limited to a set time and date.

question: Why is my coupon code not working?
answer: It could be for one of the following reasons:  In some cases, advertising campaigns or mailings for specific offers restrict the use of coupon codes and only allow them to be redeemed for specific items. Please check the conditions of the coupon and the item in your shopping basket. You have entered the wrong code. Please check your coupon code and enter it again. The coupon code has been used up or the promotion has expired. The coupon code can therefore no longer be used.

question: I am having problems downloading. What can I do?
answer: If you are unable to download the ticket you purchased online via the download link displayed, you can download it and print it out by clicking on the link in the confirmation e-mail. If you have not received an e-mail, check that you have entered your e-mail address correctly and that the confirmation e-mail has not gone to your spam folder. If you are logged in to SBB.ch, click on your initials in the top right-hand corner, and then select ‘Profile’. You will find your purchased tickets in the ‘Orders’ tile. These can be opened and reprinted at any time.

question: Which documents do I have to show to the ticket inspector?
answer: Tickets purchased online are personal and non-transferable and are only valid in conjunction with a valid form of ID belonging to the person travelling (passport, identity card, driving licence). If you have a Half Fare/GA travelcard, this is also a valid form of ID.

question: Was my purchase successful?
answer: You will see your ticket under ‘Orders’ (if you purchased it with a login). If the ticket is listed there, the transaction has been successfully completed. If the ticket that you have just purchased is not listed, click on “Update tickets”. If you have not received a confirmation e-mail and the ticket you have purchased is not displayed, the transaction was not completed and no payment was charged to your card.

question: Are tickets purchased online transferable?
answer: No. Tickets purchased online are personal and are not transferable. For this reason, you must present a valid form of personal ID (passport, ID card, driving licence) to the ticket inspector. If you have a Half Fare/GA travelcard, this is also a valid form of ID. Important: Please always present your Half Fare Travelcard/GA Travelcard as well as your ticket.

question: What happens to my personal data (name, address, etc.)?
answer: All data is sent in encrypted format (SSL) and is only used to create and issue tickets. You can find further information in SBB’s data protection policy.                                             Go to the SBB privacy policy

question: What advantages does purchasing tickets online offer?
answer: You can benefit from the following advantages:  Fast, simple and personal ticket purchasing. Purchase at short notice up until the train departs. Supersaver ticket offers, if available for your desired connection. Automatic via and ticket selection based on the selected timetable connection.  Advantages of registering on SBB.ch with a SwissPass login:  Enter your co-passengers directly in your profile. Accept the T&Cs only once – it will be saved for future purchases. No need to re-enter your personal details or payment methods. Clearly display and manage your ticket purchases and orders.

question: Can I reserve seats online?
answer: The purchase of seat reservations on SBB.ch is set to be introduced in April 2024.                                             Help with seat reservations

question: How do I redeem coupon codes on SBB.ch?
answer: SBB.ch. To use a coupon code when making a purchase online at SBB.ch, enter it directly in the ‘Coupon’ field during payment. The discount will be displayed and deducted immediately. Then complete the purchase as usual. Can I redeem coupon codes for the entire range? Yes. However, in some cases, advertising campaigns or mailings for specific offers restrict the use of coupon codes and only allow them to be redeemed for specific items. Can I redeem several coupons? No, you cannot. You can only redeem one coupon per purchase. If you have more than one coupon and wish to purchase more than one item/offer, we recommend that you purchase each item separately and redeem the relevant coupons. What happens to any remaining amount on the coupon? It is not possible to deduct smaller amounts when redeeming the coupon code, i.e. the remaining amount is forfeited. This means the best option is to use the code for payment when the ticket costs reach or exceed the value of the coupon. Where can I redeem coupons? You can redeem coupon codes at SBB Travel Centres, online at SBB.ch and in the SBB Mobile app. In some cases, advertising campaigns or mailings for specific offers restrict the use of coupon codes and only allow them to be redeemed for specific items. Please check the conditions of the coupon and the item in your shopping basket.

question: How long are tickets purchased online valid?
answer: Point-to-Point Tickets are valid for the calendar day specified at the time of purchase. If you do not return on the same day or by 5am the following day, please buy a new single ticket for your journey. Supersaver tickets are only valid on the connection that was selected during the purchasing process. Regional transport tickets are time-limited, with the exception of Day Passes.

question: How do I pay for tickets purchased online?
answer: You can pay for your online purchases on SBB.ch in the following ways: By invoice. Monthly invoice (except GA Travelcard/Half Fare Travelcard, e-vouchers, international tickets, seat reservations and bike space reservations). By credit card.  Mastercard (e.g. Swiss Bankers Travel, Swiss Bankers Life etc.). Visa. American Express Switzerland. Diners Club.  MyOne.  By debit card.  PostFinance Card. Debit Mastercard. Visa Debit. Reka Card.  Debit cards from other providers are not accepted. Note about PostFinance Card: If you wish to pay with a PostFinance Card, you must identify yourself with the PostFinance card reader when registering. After a one-time registration process with the reader in the secure PostFinance environment, no further verification is required for payments. Tickets purchased using the SBB Mobile app will be paid for with the registered PostFinance Card. For security reasons, PostFinance has set a limit of CHF 500 per month. If the limit is exceeded, you must identify yourself with the card reader each time you buy a ticket. With prepaid cards.  Mastercard. Visa.  Prepaid cards from other providers are not accepted. With other payment methods.  E-voucher. Promo-Codes. Twint.

question: How can I record, change or delete my travel companions’ data?
answer: If you would like to amend the details of your travel companions, click on ‘Sign in’ in the top right-hand corner on SBB.ch and then on your initials, select ‘Profile’ and then under the ‘Co-passengers’ tile navigate to ‘Change co-passengers’. You can either amend, re-enter or delete the details.

question: What tickets can I purchase or order online?
answer: Tickets and travelcards for Switzerland.  Tickets for single and return journeys (Point-to-Point Tickets) and City-Tickets. Supersaver tickets. Day Passes (Day Pass for the Half Fare travelcard, Day Pass Children, Day Pass for dogs, Bike Day Pass, Saver Day Pass). Class upgrades and Saver Class Upgrades. Group tickets. STS offers (for foreign visitors). Park+Rail. RailAway offers. Seat reservations for journeys within Switzerland.                                              Issuing tickets.  Depending on the offer, tickets and travelcards are issued in the following formats:  Screen ticket (the ticket is displayed on a screen). Printed on paper (PDF format). On the SwissPass card (only for travelcards loaded onto the SwissPass e.g. Half Fare Travelcard, GA Travelcard).  Tickets from private operators. Some routes offered by certain private railways or bus companies cannot be calculated by the system. For this reason, you cannot purchase tickets online for these routes. In these cases, you can purchase your ticket at a public transport point of sale, from the train crew or at local ticket machines. Night supplements. Depending on the nighttime network, night supplements are available via SBB Mobile, from ticket machines, at the counter during operating hours or from the train crew. Find out more information directly from your nighttime network.                                             More information on night supplements

question: Is payment still triggered if a purchase is aborted?
answer: With a login: If you have not received an e-mail with the download link after making an online purchase and if the ticket you purchased online is not displayed under “Orders”, the transaction was not completed and no payment was charged to your card. Without a login: Did you enter your e-mail address correctly? If not or if you’re not sure, we will need the following information from you:  The payment method (e.g. Mastercard, Visa, PostFinance Card, purchasing via invoice, Reka, Twint, etc.). The first six and last four digits of the credit card number or the transaction ID for PostFinance Card. The amount in CHF. The date and time of the purchase. The e-mail address used when placing the order. The full name of the person who ordered the ticket.  Please provide us with this information using the form for online tickets.                                             Go to the form for online tickets                                                                If you have any questions about your payment method, please contact your payment provider.

question: Can I buy tickets online for dogs?
answer: Yes. You can buy tickets for dogs online at half the price of a 2nd class ticket. When purchasing the ticket, please enter the name and date of birth of the person travelling with the dog and add the word DOG in capital letters after the surname. Example: First name: Joe; Surname: Bloggs DOG; Date of birth: date of birth of the person travelling with the dog; Discount card: Half Fare Travelcard.

question: Can I also display tickets I purchased online via the app?
answer: Yes. It is possible to display tickets purchased online at SBB.ch in the SBB Mobile app and vice versa; you can also print out tickets purchased via SBB Mobile on SBB.ch. The only requirement is that the ticket must have been purchased using the same SwissPass login.

question: RailAway-Angebote für Schulen kaufen
answer: You can purchase tickets online before the train departs. All passengers must be in possession of a valid ticket before they start their journey (when the train actually departs). If you buy your ticket only after the train has departed, you will be deemed a passenger without a valid ticket and the train crew will issue you a new ticket and charge you a surcharge of CHF 90.

question: How do I get the ticket that I’ve purchased online?
answer: If you have a laptop, tablet or smartphone with internet access, a ticket purchased online is available to you digitally and you can present it as a screen ticket directly on your device.   If you purchased the ticket with a login, go to your profile on SBB.ch. Your ticket will be listed there under ‘Display orders’ and you can present this for inspection.  If you made the purchase without a login you will find your ticket in the confirmation e-mail.  You can also print out a paper version of your ticket purchased online at home or in the office and present this. Please note that some offers must be printed regardless (e.g. leisure travel offers).

question: How do I redeem an e-voucher?
answer: We have modified our voucher system. Please exchange your “SBB e-voucher” for a new voucher.                                             Exchange e-voucher now:                         Link opens in new window.

question: Do I need a SwissPass card to register?
answer: No, you don’t need a SwissPass card to register. You can complete a one-time registration without a public transport card via SBB.ch, even during the purchasing process. You can enter your access details (e-mail and password) when making an online purchase on SBB.ch or via the SBB Mobile app and you will be logged in straight away.                                             Go to SwissPass login

question: Why am I just seeing random characters or an empty window?
answer: Your computer or smartphone may be trying to open the ticket (PDF file) with an application which is not a PDF reader. If you don’t have a PDF reader yet, you can download Adobe Reader free of charge here.                                             Go to Adobe Reader download                         Link opens in new window.

question: Do I have to sign in / register to buy tickets?
answer: No. If you only occasionally shop online at SBB.ch, you can use the ‘Purchase as a guest’ option after selecting your travel offer. However, if you use this option, you will have to re-enter your address and payment methods each time you make a purchase. You are required to sign in with a SwissPass login only if you are purchasing a Half Fare Travelcard, a GA Travelcard, a Point-to-Point Travelcard, a Regional Travelcard or a group ticket. However, we recommend you register with a SwissPass login anyway. That way you can benefit from lots of advantages. And you won’t have to re-enter your personal details and payment methods every single time.                                             Go to SwissPass login

question: Does the confirmation e-mail for the purchase also count as a ticket?
answer: Yes, the ticket is generally shown in the order confirmation email or you receive a link to download the ticket.

question: Which browsers support SBB.ch?
answer: Microsoft EdgeLink opens in new window. FirefoxLink opens in new window. OperaLink opens in new window. Safari (Mac OS)Link opens in new window. ChromeLink opens in new window.

question: Why is the downloaded ticket not displayed?
answer: You need a PDF reader to display and print out tickets purchased online. If you don’t have a PDF reader yet, you can download Adobe Reader free of charge here.                                             Go to Adobe Reader download                         Link opens in new window.

question: Can I get a refund for tickets purchased online for Switzerland?
answer: Yes, that is possible. You can access the ticket in question in your profile in SBB.ch under ‘Orders’ or directly in the confirmation e-mail. You can usually have a ticket refunded online before the start of validity. To do so, go to the ticket in your profile on SBB.ch and click on ‘Refund’. Please note that supersaver tickets and Saver Day Passes, as well as other special offers, generally cannot be refunded. Please use the refund claim form for all other refund requests.                                             Go to ticket refunds

question: Are Junior Travelcards and Children’s Co-Travelcards valid with a supersaver ticket/Saver Day Pass?
answer: Yes.

question: I bought a normal ticket and only then realised that there were also supersaver tickets available for the same route. Can I get a refund on the normal ticket?
answer: Yes. You can have tickets purchased at the standard fare refunded free of charge in your profile before the first day of validity.                                              Help with refunds                                                                Alternatively, you can have the standard fare ticket refunded at the ticket counter or via the refund form for a fee of CHF 10.                                             Go to the refund form

question: I can no longer take the connection I originally booked at the supersaver price because of a delay or cancellation in the public transport system or due to a connection that was not made. Do I need to purchase a new ticket?
answer: No. In the event of train cancellations, delays or line interruptions, you can take the next possible train without purchasing a new ticket provided you obtain confirmation from ticket control or sales staff. If there is an adjustment to the timetable between the purchase of the supersaver ticket and the journey (for example, due to construction work), those passengers affected can use the next available connection.

question: Can I have the supersaver ticket or the Saver Day Pass refunded or exchanged?
answer: No. As a basic principle, saver offers cannot be refunded or exchanged. Information on refunds More on the refund conditions for saver offers (Tariff 600.9, section 8 – in German, French and Italian)Link opens in new window.

question: How can I get a supersaver ticket for a return journey?
answer: The easiest way to purchase supersaver tickets for a return journey is via SBB.ch. Online purchase at SBB.ch.  First select the outward journey.  In the next step, click on the ‘Single and return journey’ symbols under ‘Travel options’. To check whether there are still supersaver tickets available for a specific departure time, click on ‘Choose return journey’ (at the bottom on the right) and enter your desired return date and time.  Purchase via the app. On SBB Mobile and SBB Preview, you can only purchase supersaver tickets for a single journey. If you are planning a return journey for the same day, it is worth checking whether the Saver Day Pass is cheaper than a supersaver ticket for both the outward and return journey.                                             Go to the Saver Day Pass

question: Why can I only buy supersaver tickets/Saver Day Passes on the internet or with an app?
answer: The availability and prices for saver offers are constantly changing. We can quickly adjust the prices online and in the apps so you can find a suitable supersaver ticket as quickly and easily as possible.

question: Is the Half Fare Travelcard valid for supersaver tickets/Saver Day Passes?
answer: Yes. You can benefit from an additional discount of up to 70% on the standard half-price fare with the Half Fare travelcard.

question: Why do I have to provide my full name and date of birth when I purchase a supersaver ticket/Saver Day Pass?
answer: Supersaver tickets/Saver Day Passes are personalised digital tickets. You must therefore prove your identity using your Half Fare Travelcard, SwissPass card or an official form of identification (e.g. ID card) during the ticket inspection.

question: Are supersaver tickets also available for dogs and bicycles?
answer: For dogs, you can purchase a 2nd class supersaver ticket with a Half Fare travelcard (even if you are travelling in 1st class). Please enter the following information when purchasing a supersaver ticket for your dog: First name: your first name; Surname: your surname(s) and the word DOG in capital letters after it; Date of birth: your date of birth.  Supersaver tickets are not available for bicycles.

question: For which routes are supersaver tickets available?
answer: Supersaver tickets are available for most public transport routes. Super saver tickets are also available in the Frimobil, Mobilis, Ostwind and Passepartout regional transport networks. Other networks are currently examining the possibility of implementing them.

question: Why are different prices offered for the same route?
answer: The prices depend on the capacity and popularity of the connections concerned.

question: How far in advance can I buy supersaver tickets/Saver Day Passes for Switzerland?
answer: You can buy supersaver tickets up to 6 months before your journey.  For journeys taking place after the timetable change (mid-December each year) supersaver tickets can only be purchased in mid-October at the earliest (once the timetables have been published). You can always get Saver Day Passes 6 months in advance, as they do not depend on the timetable.

question: Can I combine supersaver tickets with normal tickets?
answer: Yes. Combining a supersaver ticket for the outward journey and a single Point-to-Point Ticket at the standard fare for the return journey (or vice versa) is still cheaper than a return Point-to-Point Ticket at the standard fare for the same route.

question: Aren’t commuters at a disadvantage since supersaver tickets are not available during commuting hours?
answer: No. Commuters can benefit from supersaver tickets in their leisure time too.

question: Won’t GA and Half Fare travelcard holders be disadvantaged by supersaver tickets?
answer: No. GA Travelcard holders still enjoy unlimited travel on the entire public transport network for one whole year at an attractive all-inclusive price. As of 12 December 2021, passengers with a 2nd class GA Travelcard can now purchase a Saver Class Upgrade at a greatly reduced price for travel in 1st class. And passengers with a Half Fare Travelcard benefit from lower prices thanks to supersaver tickets.

question: I missed the connection I booked at the supersaver price due to my own reasons. Can I now choose a later connection and still use the supersaver ticket?
answer: No. If you have missed your booked connection or want to travel at another time, you can purchase a ticket at the standard fare for the same day and obtain a refund for your supersaver ticket after your journey. Only tickets for the exact same route can be refunded. A fee of CHF 10 will be retained for refunds as per T600.9.                                             Go to the refund form                                                                You can also have the refund carried out at points of sale with an electronic sales device and access to the customer dossier.  Tariff 600.9, paragraph 8, Refunds (in German only)Link opens in new window. Help with refunds

question: Why can I only purchase the Supersaver Class Upgrade via the app?
answer: Most class upgrades are purchased spontaneously via the SBB Mobile and SBB Preview apps. For this reason, the Supersaver Class Upgrade will initially only be available via the apps. When and whether you will also be able to buy the Supersaver Class Upgrade online on SBB.ch has not been decided.

question: Why do I have to provide my full name and date of birth when I make a purchase?
answer: Supersaver Class Upgrades are personal and only available through digital channels. You must therefore prove your identity using your Half Fare Travelcard or an official form of identification (e.g. your ID card) during the ticket inspection.

question: I missed the connection for which I booked the Supersaver Class Upgrade. Can I now choose a later connection and use the Supersaver Class Upgrade?
answer: No. The Supersaver Class Upgrade gives you a discount of up to 70% on the standard class upgrade price – the Supersaver Class Upgrade is however only valid for one specific connection. If you have missed the connection for which you booked the Supersaver Class Upgrade, it will no longer be valid and cannot be credited towards the purchase of a new Supersaver Class Upgrade or any other class upgrade. In the event of train cancellations, delays or line interruptions, you can take the next train if you obtain written confirmation from ticket control or sales staff. If there is an adjustment to the timetable between the purchase of the Supersaver Class Upgrade and the journey (for example, due to construction work), those passengers affected can use the next available connection.

question: Can I purchase the Supersaver Class Upgrade on the train?
answer: No. Always buy the Supersaver Class Upgrade (if available) via the SBB Mobile or SBB Preview apps before the train departs.

question: What is a Supersaver Class Upgrade?
answer: The Supersaver Class Upgrade enables you upgrade from 2nd to 1st class at a discounted price. Benefit from a discount of up to 70% on many Swiss public transport routes. Supersaver Class Upgrades are only available via the SBB Mobile and SBB Preview apps – availability is restricted.

question: Many people choose 1st class so they can have more space. Doesn’t the Supersaver Class Upgrade devalue 1st class?
answer: No. We only offer Supersaver Class Upgrades if a train still has plenty of available seats in 1st class. This is usually the case during off-peak hours. You will therefore not experience any loss of comfort in 1st class.

question: Can I combine the Supersaver Class Upgrade with the Municipal Day Pass?
answer: Yes.  Please note that if you hold a Half Fare Travelcard or are aged between 6 and under 16, you can purchase a Supersaver Class Upgrade at a discounted price. In other cases, you will need to purchase a Supersaver Class Upgrade at the full price.

question: How can I get a Supersaver Class Upgrade for a return journey?
answer: You can easily purchase a Supersaver Class Upgrade for a return journey in either the SBB Mobile or the SBB Preview app. Purchase the outward journey first, and then the return journey.  If you are making a return journey on the same day, check in advance whether or not a 1-day class upgrade would be cheaper.

question: Doesn’t the Supersaver Class Upgrade put passengers with a 1st class GA Travelcard at a disadvantage?
answer: No. If you have a GA Travelcard for 1st class, you can continue to travel on the entire public transport network for a whole year at a very advantageous flat-rate price. The GA Travelcard also provides full flexibility, while the Supersaver Class Upgrade is limited to connections that have a relatively low occupancy and is only valid on the connection chosen at the time of purchase.

question: Can I also buy a class upgrade (upgrade from 2nd to 1st class) on the train?
answer: As a general rule, you must always have a valid ticket for the right class of travel with you by the time the train departs. Tip: buy your class upgrade in the SBB Mobile app. It’s quick and it means you can make sure that you are in possession of a valid ticket, even if you decide to upgrade your class on the spur of the moment. However, there are also trains where you can buy a class upgrade from the train crew. Option of buying a class upgrade on the train. If you are travelling on a long-distance train with passenger attendants, you also have the option of buying a class upgrade on the train from the train crew.  The minimum price of a class upgrade bought on the train is CHF 10. Please actively seek out train crew to speak to if you would like to purchase a class upgrade. Trains that can sell class upgrades:  InterCity (IC). EuroCity (EC). InterCityExpress (ICE). Railjet (RJX). InterRegio (IR), but not on BLS trains running entirely or partly on the SBB network: IR 17 Bern–Olten. IR 65 Bern–Biel/Bienne. IR 66 Bern–Neuchâtel–La Chaux-de-Fonds.    It is also possible to buy class upgrades on SOB trains running entirely or partly on the SBB network:  IR 46/IR 26 “Treno Gottardo”. IR 35 “Aare-Linth”. IR “Voralpen-Express”.  No option of buying a class upgrade on the train. If you are travelling on a regional train without passenger attendants, you must always purchase any class upgrades before the train departs. This concerns the following train categories:  S-Bahn (S). Regio (R). RegioExpress (RE). IR 17, IR 65 and IR 66 operated by BLS.  If you travel in 1st class without buying a class upgrade beforehand (or a 1st class ticket), we will consider you to be travelling without a valid ticket.

question: What is a class upgrade?
answer: If you have a 2nd class ticket, a Day Pass or a GA Travelcard, a class upgrade allows you to travel in 1st class. You always have the option of spontaneously choosing to travel in 1st class. To do so, buy a class upgrade for the relevant route or the whole day using the SBB Mobile app, online at SBB.ch, from a ticket machine or at a ticket counter.  If you have a 2nd class GA Travelcard, you also have the option of buying a 1-month class upgrade. You can get one online or at staffed public transport points of sale.  Buy a 1-month class upgrade for the GA Travelcard here  More information on class upgrade options

question: Are Junior Travelcards and Children’s Co-Travelcards valid in combination with the Supersaver Class Upgrade?
answer: Yes.

question: Are Supersaver Class Upgrades available for dogs or bikes?
answer: No. You never need a 1st class ticket for dogs and bikes – the 2nd class ticket covers you even for travel in 1st class. You pay the reduced price (the Half Fare Travelcard price) for dogs or bikes. Note: please specify the name of the person travelling with the dog (not the name of the dog) during the purchase process.

question: Is the Half Fare Travelcard valid for the Supersaver Class Upgrade?
answer: Yes. With the Half Fare Travelcard, you can also benefit from a discount of up to 70% in addition to the already halved price for the class upgrade.

question: Why do I pay different prices for the same route?
answer: The prices change depending on the occupancy rate and the desirability of each connection.

question: I purchased a standard class upgrade and only then saw that there was in fact a Supersaver Class Upgrade also available for this route. Can I get the standard class upgrade refunded?
answer: You can exchange your class upgrade independently in the app without any fees before the first day of validity (provided you used a login during purchase). If you use the refund form, a CHF 10 fee will be retained.

question: Can I have the Supersaver Class Upgrade refunded or exchanged?
answer: No. As a basic principle, saver offers cannot be refunded or exchanged. Information on refunds More on the refund conditions for saver offers (Tariff 600.9, section 8 – in German, French and Italian)Link opens in new window.

question: Can a Supersaver Class Upgrade be combined with any 2nd class ticket or travelcard?
answer: Supersaver Class Upgrades can be combined with almost all 2nd class tickets or travelcards (e.g. GA Travelcard, Point-to-Point Travelcard, Saver Day Pass, etc.). The only exception is supersaver tickets in 2nd class, which cannot be combined with the Supersaver Class Upgrade.

question: Which routes are Supersaver Class Upgrades available for?
answer: You can purchase Supersaver Class Upgrades for most public transport routes, but not for routes within integrated fare networks.

question: I have a Point-to-Point Travelcard. How do I buy a zone upgrade?
answer: You can buy a zone upgrade from a ticket machine, online at SBB.ch or in the SBB Mobile app.  Enter the additional route you require. Buy the ticket and present it alongside your Point-to-Point Travelcard during the ticket inspection.

question: I have a Regional Travelcard. How do I buy a zone upgrade to a destination outside of my fare network?
answer: You can buy a zone upgrade from a ticket machine, online at SBB.ch or in the SBB Mobile app. Enter the additional route you require. Buy the ticket and present it alongside your Regional Travelcard during the ticket inspection. Please note the stopping points of your chosen means of transport. In order to buy the right zone upgrade, you need to know where your chosen means of transport (train, s-bahn, bus, tram, etc.) stops. This is because on journeys that go beyond the borders of the network, zone tickets or travelcards are only valid until the last scheduled stop within the zones included in your ticket or travelcard. In this case, buy a ticket from the last stop your chosen means of transport calls at within the zones your travelcard/ticket is valid for. Example: you want to travel from A to D. Your travelcard/ticket is valid, for example, up to and including zone 30. If your chosen means of transport stops at location C, you should buy a zone upgrade from C to D. If your chosen means of transport stops in A and B, but not in C, you should buy a zone upgrade from B to D. If your chosen means of transport is travelling from A to D without stopping, purchase a standard ticket for the journey from A to D.

question: What type of zone upgrade should I buy?
answer: This depends on the type of travelcard you have. With a Point-to-Point Travelcard. Buy a normal ticket for the missing route. With a Regional Travelcard (e.g. ZVV, Libero, TNW, Passepartout, etc.). Buy a zone upgrade for the missing number of zones within a fare network. Travelling to a destination outside of your fare network?                                             For more information, see section ‘I have a Regional Travelcard. How do I buy a zone upgrade to a destination outside of my fare network?’                                                                For details on the different fare networks, please refer to the pages of the respective networks.                                             Go to the overview of the fare networks

question: I have a Regional Travelcard. How do I buy a zone upgrade to a destination within my fare network?
answer: You can buy a zone upgrade from an SBB ticket machine, online at SBB.ch or in the SBB Mobile app. At SBB ticket machines.  Go to ‘Fare network extension tickets’. Select ‘Extension ticket’ or if available ‘Extension Day Pass’ or ‘Extension multiple-journey ticket’. Select the additional zones you require (tip: refer to the zone map). Select ‘Immediate departure’ or ‘Later departure’. Buy the ticket.  At SBB.ch.  Go to sbb.ch/buying. Select ‘Regional fare networks’. Go to your desired fare network and select the relevant ‘Extension ticket’ option. Enter the additional route you require in the timetable (tip: refer to the zone map and validity). Buy the ticket for the additional route required.  Via SBB Mobile. Store your Regional Travelcard in the SBB Mobile app as follows:  Go to the menu and select ‘Settings’. Go to ‘My Travelcards’. Select ‘Store travelcard manually’ (if not already available). Select ‘Add regional travelcard’.  For connection requests within the same fare network (without the Z-Pass), the travelcard is then automatically credited when you buy a zone upgrade. For this to happen, you must select ‘Zone upgrade’ under ‘Ticket options’ when making your purchase. Your Regional Travelcard will not be taken into account if you buy a “normal” ticket. Tip: most fare networks have a maximum number of zones, and the zone ticket becomes valid for all zones when the maximum number is reached. You may therefore not need the full number of missing zones. Please refer to the rules of your fare network. ZVV as an example: if your existing ZVV ticket or ZVV travelcard plus zone upgrade gives you a total of 8 zones, you are entitled to unlimited travel across the whole ZVV network (all zones) during the validity period of the zone upgrade.                                             Go to the fare networks

question: Where and when do I need to buy a night-time supplement or pay a night-fare?
answer: This depends on the service. Night supplements or special night-time fares generally apply from around 1am until the early morning. The connections where such supplements are required are marked accordingly in the timetable. Before your trip, please find out which connections require a night supplement online at SBB.ch or in the SBB Mobile app.

question: Where can I buy a night supplement?
answer: You can find detailed information on buying night supplements and special night-time fares in the table on the night-time services page.                                              Go to night-time services

question: Who has to buy a night supplement or night fare?
answer: The night supplement applies to all passengers. In this case, having a GA Travelcard, Half Fare Travelcard, GA Night Travelcard or another Regional or Point-to-Point Travelcard makes no difference. Exception: travellers with reduced mobility who have a valid Companion Card (and are travelling with their companion) only need one single supplement.                                             Go to Disabled Passenger’s ID Card

question: What level of discount is available with a group ticket?
answer: With a group ticket, you benefit from a 30% discount on your journey by public transport.

question: How many participants do I need to get the group discount for an international journey?
answer: 10 is the minimum number of travellers for group travel abroad. For smaller group journeys (between six and nine people), purchase tickets for individual passengers at SBB.ch or your local point of sale. You can buy tickets for a maximum of five to nine passengers per request, depending on the country. You may need to split up the booking.

question: How can I buy group tickets including seat reservations for a school trip?
answer: You can book a school trip yourself online. Please note that you must place the booking at least 7 weekdays before the desired travel date. School trips at short notice (i.e. if the travel date is in fewer than 7 weekdays’ time) can only be booked at staffed public transport points of sale or by calling the SBB Contact Center on 0848 44 66 88 (CHF 0.08/min.).                                              Book school trips online

question: Can I change the number of passengers in the group?
answer: You can change the number of passengers up to 30 minutes before starting your journey free of charge at a staffed public transport point of sale. If you make a change later, we will charge an excess of CHF 10 for each refund request made if the group becomes smaller.  If a change is made, you should always ask train staff to confirm how many passenger actually make the journey in each direction. Do the same if you use additional services from third parties at your destination. If necessary, apply for a refund after your journey.
