question: Can I calculate the fare for my group journey myself?
answer: Yes, you can calculate an indicative price. Here is our step-by-step guide for SBB.ch:  Enter your chosen route on SBB.ch and click on ‘search for connection’. You will be shown the connections. Choose one and click on it. Then click on the button ‘Tickets from CHF xx.xx’. If you are not registered, select ‘Purchase as a guest’. On the screen ‘Passengers’, enter a fictional name with the date of birth 01.01.1980 to see the price for adults. Select the discount card: no discount (= full price) or Half Fare Travelcard (choose also for children and young people under 25) and then click on ‘Accept’. Now the price is shown for the discount chosen. Pay attention to the class of travel (you can choose 1st or 2nd class) and change it if necessary. The 2nd class price is given by default. Note the price with and without discount. PLEASE NOTE: do not choose supersaver tickets or Day Passes if available – choose only normal fares! To get an indicative group price per person, multiply the half-fare price and/or the full price by 0.7 (× 0.7 = 30% discount) and round up to the next 20 cents (example: normal fare with Half Fare Travelcard: 29.50; indicative group price: 29.50 × 0.7 = 20.65; rounded up to the next 20 cents = 20.80). Important: to be able to travel at the discounted group fare, at least 10 people must travel together. Passengers with a GA Travelcard count as part of the group, but pay nothing.   No liability is taken for the accuracy of the information, rounding differences may occur. An example calculation. Your group travels from Zürich HB to Fribourg in 2nd class. roud up included, in CHF                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               Adult with Half Fare Travelcard                                                                                                         29.50                                                       20.80                                                                                                                                                                                 Adult without discount (= full price)                                                                                                        59.–                                                       41.40                                                                                                                                                                                 Children and young people under 25 (= price for adults with a Half Fare Travelcard)                                                                                                        29.50                                                       20.80                                                                                                                                                                                 People with GA Travelcard (travel for free)                                                                                                        0.–                                                       0.–                                                                                                                                                                 Please note: school classes and Jugend+Sport groups have the option of buying a Day Pass for Schools for max. CHF 15 per day.                                             Go to the Day Pass for Schools

question: Some of the passengers in our group are wheelchair users. Can they travel together with us?
answer: Yes, you have to tell us when ordering your group journey so that a suitable coach can be reserved for you. At the same time, notify the SBB Contact Center Handicap about your journey. Groups that include more than one wheelchair user can only be carried subject to certain conditions. The double-deck trains operated by Long-Distance Services allow groups to travel together (maximum ten people in wheelchairs). On board all other trains, groups may only be able to travel in different compartments or split across several trains, depending on the size of the group.                                             Go to SBB Contact Center Handicap

question: How do I buy group tickets including seat reservations?
answer: The easiest and most convenient way to calculate and/or book your group journey is online from the comfort of your home – avoid having to rush or queue. Ideally you should name one person as group leader for your group journey. This person books the journey and group tickets required (including the reservation). So that we can calculate the price correctly, we need to know the age of the passengers you are travelling with and how many hold a GA or a Half Fare Travelcard. If travellers in the group hold a Modular or Point-to-Point Travelcard covering the whole route, enter these people under ‘GA Travelcard’. If you wish to buy group tickets (including the reservation) online, you / the group leader will need a SwissPass login.  You can also reserve group journeys and buy group tickets at staffed public transport points of sale or by calling the SBB Contact Center on 0848 44 66 88 (CHF 0.08/min.).                                             Buy group tickets online

question: What is a group journey in Switzerland?
answer: In Switzerland, 10 or more people can travel as a group. Groups benefit from discounted fares. To calculate the price, we take certain travelcards and the age of the people travelling into account. Group journeys must be booked in advance. For the journey, you will need a group ticket. It includes a free seat reservation.

question: Can I amend or cancel a group journey?
answer: If your group journey cannot take place as planned, let us know that you wish to amend or cancel your journey no later than 11am the day before travel. Please observe the special provisions for partner offers, including RailAway. Unfortunately, if you inform us later than this, we cannot guarantee that we will be able to make the changes. Please note, that a fee of CHF 10 is charged for cancellation of unused group tickets. These provisions apply to group tickets for travel within Switzerland. Special provisions apply to group journeys to other European countries.

question: Do I need to reserve seats?
answer: Yes. Seat reservations are included in the price of the tickets and will be made where possible. When buying online, the reservation will be made automatically. Online reservations can only be made when you buy a group ticket at the same time.                                             Buy group tickets online

question: Do I need to book a group journey in advance and, if so, how far in advance?
answer: Group journeys must be booked in advance.  If you buy group tickets at a staffed public transport point of sale, by telephone from the SBB Contact Center or online, we ask you to register your journey at least two working days before the start of travel. (E.g. if you travel on Sunday, the request must reach us by Wednesday evening at the latest).  You cannot book in writing or reserve by contact form, e-mail or letter.                                              Buy group tickets online

question: How soon before I travel can I book an international group journey?
answer: It’s best to book an international group journey as early as possible. International group ticket requests and bookings must be made at least 15 working days before the departure date. Travel to and via Germany is an exception, in which case bookings must be made at least 25 days in advance. To book group travel at shorter notice, please purchase tickets for individual passengers on SBB.ch or at your nearest point of sale. You can buy tickets for a maximum of five to nine passengers per request, depending on the country. You may need to split up the booking.

question: What group tickets are available?
answer: We offer single and return group tickets for 1st and 2nd class.

question: Do people with GA or Half Fare Travelcards or day passes count as part of the group?
answer: Passengers with the following tickets are counted as part of the group and benefit from group discount:  Adults without discount (30% discount on the full fare). Adults with Half Fare Travelcards (30% discount on the half-fare price). Passengers with GA (travel for free). Passengers with Regional, Point-to-Point or Modular Travelcards (the entire route must be included; they then travel for free) (counts as a GA Travelcard). Children and young persons aged at least 6 and under 25 (30% discount on the half-fare price). Children under 6 (travel for free). Dogs (30% discount on the half fare price).  Passengers with the following tickets are not counted as part of the group (they travel with the group for free, but their details have to be entered for the obligatory seat reservation):  Adults, children and dogs with a day pass (including Leisure Travelcard). Young people with a GA Night Travelcard (for journeys after 7pm). Accompanied children with Junior Travelcard or Children's Co-Travelcard. Companions of passengers with a Disabled Passenger’s ID card.

question: Are group reservations on trains always labelled?
answer: No, there is not always a label on the train. For group journeys on Regio-Express, regional and S-Bahn trains, the seating the group needs is provided but no physical reservation label is provided on the train. On long-distance trains travelling before 6 am and after 8 pm, reservation labels are also not provided.

question: Can groups make use of self-service loading of bicycles?
answer: No. Self-service loading of bicycles is not available for groups. Find out about the other options available to you.                                             Further information about transporting bicycles

question: How long is my group ticket valid for?
answer: Group tickets for single journeys are valid for 10 days. Group tickets for return journeys are valid for 1 month. When you buy tickets online, the validity date is fixed when you make the purchase.

question: Are there luggage offers for groups?
answer: We provide the following luggage offers for group journeys in Switzerland:                                             Go to group luggage offers for Switzerland

question: Where and how can I book an international group journey?
answer: Tickets and reservations for group travel abroad can be requested using the online form. We will determine the best prices for the group journey for you and provide you with a non-binding offer.                                             Go to booking request for international group journeys for private groups, schools, youth groups and clubs                                                                Please note that requests for international group travel can no longer be processed directly at SBB Travel Centres, over the phone with the SBB Contact Center or via e-mail. Instead, your details will be recorded in the form and then processed by our specialists. Our staff will be happy to help you fill in the form.

question: What information will the booking office need to book an international group journey?
answer: To ensure we can provide you with a suitable offer, we need:  the complete itinerary with departure dates and times,  the number of travellers, and any travelcards for reduced fares (both for Switzerland and abroad). For travel to Italy, for travel on night trains and for travel on regional trains in France the list of participants with last names, first names and dates of birth is required.  You can also indicate whether you would like to take out an insurance policy to protect your group against unforeseen events before and during the trip. If you wish to take out travel insurance, we need to know the number of people you wish to insure as well as the surname, first name, address and date of birth.

question: Which requests for international group travel are processed by SBB?
answer: We will be happy to process your request as long as the group journey starts in Switzerland and the passengers’ and the trip organiser’s country of residence is Switzerland. We cannot process requests from groups residing abroad nor for connections that do not pass through Switzerland.  In such cases, please contact the railway company in your country of residence or in the country where you will start your group journey.

question: Can the Dog Pass be cancelled early?
answer: If you no longer need the Dog Pass, and you have not reached the end of the second month of its validity, you can return it. Up to the end of the first month of its validity, you receive 50% of the purchase cost in return, and 25% up to the end of the second month of its validity. Refunds are not possible after this.

question: Where and how can I buy a Day Pass for dogs?
answer: The Day Pass for Dogs can be purchased conveniently online at SBB.ch, via a mobile device using the app, from ticket machines or at a public transport point of sale. The Day Pass for Dogs is automatically offered during purchase on SBB.ch or via SBB Mobile (see the question ‘How do I buy a dog ticket?’) as soon as the price for the dog ticket reaches the amount of CHF 25. Alternatively, you can buy the Day Pass for Dogs directly online at SBB.ch or via the SBB Mobile app in the ‘Shop & Services’ tab.                                             Purchase a Day Pass for Dogs online.                                                                                                            More on the Day Pass for dogs

question: Is the Dog Pass transferable?
answer: The Dog Pass is linked with the personal SwissPass of the accompanying person. This means you can take other dogs with you too. However, if other people are taking your dog with them, each companion must purchase their own Dog Pass. For this reason, we have reduced the price (the GA Travelcard for dogs previously cost CHF 805 per year, the Dog Pass now only costs CHF 350).

question: Can I see the Dog Pass in my account on swisspass.ch?
answer: Yes, the travelcard is shown on swisspass.chLink opens in new window. under the travelcard holder’s login.

question: What is a Dog Pass?
answer: If your dog regularly travels with you on the train, it’s worth buying an annual Dog Pass for 350 CHF. The Dog Pass is issued to one fixed companion and loaded onto their personal SwissPass. The dog will not receive its own SwissPass.  Note: the Dog Pass replaces the previous GA Travelcard for dogs.

question: Can a GA Travelcard for dogs be exchanged for a Dog Pass?
answer: You can transfer seamlessly from a GA Travelcard for dogs to a Dog Pass. The valid GA Travelcard for dogs will be refunded pro rata.

question: What happens if I’ve left my SwissPass with the Dog Pass at home?
answer: If you leave your SwissPass holding the Dog Pass at home, we can issue you a card with temporary validity for two days at any ticket counter if you show your official ID. A charge of 5 CHF is made. The temporary card can also be shown in the mobile app (requirement: login with a linked customer number).

question: What is a Day Pass for dogs?
answer: If you hold a valid ticket, your dog can enjoy a day’s unlimited travel with the Day Pass for dogs for 25 CHF. The Day Pass for dogs is valid on trains, boats, PostBus routes and tram and bus routes in most cities and agglomerations.

question: When do I need a ticket for my dog?
answer: Small dogs (with a wither height of up to 30cm max.) can be carried free of charge in a suitable container (e.g. a basket or pouch).   If you place the transport container on a seat, you need to buy a 2nd class ticket at half price or a Day Pass for Dogs. If you are travelling with a dog without a container, the dog must sit under your seat so that the passage is not blocked for other passengers. Buy a half-price 2nd class ticket or a Day Pass for Dogs for your dog.

question: How do I buy a dog ticket?
answer: Buy tickets for yourself and for your dog in the SBB Mobile app.  If you would like to buy the ticket for your dog together with your own ticket, proceed as follows:  Enter the route and select your preferred connection. Select ‘Tickets from CHF …’. 3. Tap on ‘Edit passengers’ (pencil symbol). Tap the plus sign at the bottom next to the ‘dog’ symbol once (or several times if you want to take several dogs with you). Tap on ‘Accept’. The dog ticket will now appear together with your ticket in the overview and you can buy the tickets together.  Purchase in the SBB Mobile app for your dog (if you already have a ticket for yourself). Enter the route and select your preferred connection.  Select ‘Tickets from CHF...’. Tap on ‘Edit passengers’ (pencil symbol). (Only if you do NOT have a GA Travelcard: enter a new fictitious co-passenger with your own name. To do this, please swap your first name and last name around and enter a GA Travelcard as the travelcard). Tap the plus sign at the bottom next to the ‘dog’ symbol once (or several times if you want to take several dogs with you). Tap on ‘Accept’. The dog ticket will now appear in the overview and you can buy the ticket.  Online on SBB.ch with a login.  Here’s how it works:  Enter the route into the timetable and select your preferred connection. When entering the passengers, click on ‘Process passengers | reductions’. Enter the number of dog tickets you would like in the field following the ‘Discount cards’ field. If you do not need a ticket for yourself, check the box next to the text ‘Passenger already has a valid ticket or other valid travel document’. Click on ‘Accept’. Choose between ‘single journey’ and ‘single and return journey’. Go to the check-out and purchase the ticket with your preferred payment method.  Online on SBB.ch without a login.  Here’s how it works:  Enter the route into the timetable and select your preferred connection. When entering passengers, click on ‘Add passenger’ and add the name of the passenger/co-passenger. At the same time, enter the number of dog tickets you would like in the field following the ‘Discount cards’ field. Enter the number of dog tickets you would like in the field following the ‘Discount cards’ field. If you do not need a ticket for yourself, check the box next to the text ‘Passenger already has a valid ticket or other valid travel document’. Click on ‘Accept’. Choose between ‘single journey’ and ‘single and return journey’. Go to the check-out and purchase the ticket with your chosen payment method.

question: What do I have to be aware of when purchasing a new Dog Pass?
answer: You will receive the Dog Pass on your personal SwissPass. If you do not already own a SwissPass, you can order one by phone via the SBB Contact Center on 0848 44 66 88 (CHF 0.08/min.) or at a staffed public transport point of sale. Important: please note that when ordering a SwissPass for the first time, you must have an up-to-date, high-quality passport photo. When purchasing for the first time, your personal details will be checked using your ID or passport and you will be newly registered as a customer. This cannot be done over the phone via the Contact Center. You can also send the photo by text message or upload it online. If you already have a SwissPass – for example for your Half Fare or GA Travelcard – you can get the Dog Pass at any staffed point of sale, or conveniently online or at the ticket machine. You can find information on the price of the Dog Pass on the product page.                                             More about the Dog Pass

question: How can I renew my Dog Pass?
answer: You can renew your Dog Pass at a staffed point of sale or ticket machine, by phone via the SBB Contact Center on 0848 44 66 88 (CHF 0.08/min.) (credit card required) or conveniently online. To renew online, follow the link you received in the renewal e-mail.

question: Is the Dog Pass renewed automatically?
answer: No, the pass is not renewed automatically. We contact the customer (either by text or e-mail, depending on the travelcard holder’s settings on swisspass.chLink opens in new window.) 60 days before the travelcard expires and provide information about different renewal options.

question: Can dogs travel in coaches with Rail Catering services?
answer: Carriage of animals in coaches offering meals and refreshments (with the exception of coaches served by a Minibar) is prohibited. This does not apply to guide dogs and assistance dogs.

question: Are Day Passes for dogs and Dog Passes valid in 1st and 2nd class?
answer: Day Passes for dogs and Dog Passes are not issued for a specific class and are valid both in 1st and 2nd class. The companion must hold a valid ticket for their class of travel.

question: Where can my dog travel?
answer: Small dogs with a wither height of up to 30cm. There is no cost for taking small dogs with you, provided they are in a suitable container under your seat. However, if a small dog travels outside of a container under the seat or on your lap, you require a separate 2nd class ticket at the half-fare price, a Day Pass for Dogs or a Dog Pass for the dog. If you would like your small dog to travel on a seat, the dog must be in a suitable container and you must buy a separate 2nd class ticket at the half-fare price, a Day Pass for Dogs or a Dog Pass for the dog. Large dogs with a wither height of more than 30cm. Larger dogs must sit under your seat so that passage is not blocked for other passengers. In all cases, you require a separate 2nd class ticket at the half-fare price, a Day Pass for Dogs or a Dog Pass for the dog.

question: Under what conditions can I take a dog on the train with me for free?
answer: Small dogs with a wither height of 30cm or less can travel for free provided they are in a suitable container (e.g. a transport box, a basket or another animal-friendly container) and placed under your seat.

question: What does transport or carriage of bikes mean?
answer: Self-service loading of bicycles means taking one bicycle or e-bike per person with you on the train. You can do this on most SBB trains and most trains of other transport companies, as well as with some bus companies (e.g. PostBuses). You place or hang the bicycle or e-bike in the designated area in the vehicle yourself.                                             All information about self-service loading of bicycles

question: Can I transport a bicycle trailer on the train?
answer: Yes. Please note that boarding doors and the doors between coaches on some SBB trains are only suitable for trailer widths of a maximum of 80cm and 70cm respectively. Your bicycle trailer counts as hand luggage and therefore does not require a ticket.

question: How many bicycle spaces can I reserve at the same time?
answer: If there are enough available spaces in a coach, you can reserve up to 9 bicycle spaces at the same time. However, it is not possible to reserve more spaces at the same time than are available in a given individual coach.

question: My bike is less than two meters long and still doesn’t fit in the rack on the train. What can I do?
answer: In older coaches, the bicycle mounts are sometimes not set up for modern mountain bikes with 29-inch wheels and wider tires. Due to the limited space available, it is unfortunately not possible to optimise these bicycle spaces. Therefore, try turning the handlebars, removing a wheel, or maybe even let some air out of the tyre or use a bike lock to attach your bicycle to the hook. If none of this helps, contact the on-board staff so that an alternative location on the train can be found if necessary.

question: How much does it cost to reserve a bicycle space?
answer: A bike space reservation costs CHF 2 for all trains within Switzerland that require a reservation. For connections involving changes, the reservation on the connecting train is free of charge.

question: When do I need a bike space reservation and for which trains?
answer: From 21 March to 31 October, you will need a bike space reservation for your bike on InterCity (IC) trains. In the timetable, trains requiring reservation are marked with the bike reservation symbol.  Every day for the IC2/21 lines through the Gotthard Base Tunnel (Basel/Zurich–Ticino). Every day for the IC5/51 lines at the southern foot of the Jura (Basel–Biel/Bienne, Rorschach/Zurich–Biel/Bienne–Lausanne/Geneva). From Friday to Sunday as well as Easter Monday, Ascension Day, Whit Monday and 1 August for all other InterCity lines.   You will also need a reservation throughout the year for the Swiss section of the route for the following trains operating internationally: EuroCity (EC), Intercity-Express (ICE), Railjet (RJX) and InterCity (IC) (Zurich–Schaffhausen). Please make sure to check whether your chosen train is subject to reservation in good time so that you can take your bike along with you. The online and mobile timetables are updated daily. Please note that you cannot cancel or rebook reservations for bicycle spaces.

question: Can groups of 10 or more people load their bicycles themselves?
answer: No, we cannot offer self-service loading of bicycles for groups of 10 or more people.                                             More about self-service loading of bicycles for groups

question: On which trains can I reserve bicycle spaces using the SBB Mobile app?
answer: You can reserve bike spaces via the SBB Mobile app on all trains within Switzerland if reservation is mandatory at the time of your journey.

question: What general rules apply to the self-service loading of bicycles on trains?
answer: When taking a bike on public transport, it is a requirement that you are able to load and unload it independently and store it in the holder provided. Furthermore, only one bike can be taken per person. Self-service loading of bicycles is only possible if there is sufficient space in the vehicles and it does not hinder other passengers. On modes of transport which require reservation, bicycle transport is only guaranteed if you have bought a bike space reservation in advance (check the online timetable). Escape routes, entrances and exits and access points to the engine driver’s cabin must always be kept clear. Bicycles that are very dirty may be excluded from carriage.

question: Is it possible to rebook or cancel reservations which have already been made using the SBB Mobile app?
answer: No. Unfortunately, this is not possible at the moment.

question: Which bikes can I load myself?
answer: We distinguish between ordinary bicycles and special bicycles. Ordinary bicycles. The total length of ordinary bicycles must not exceed two metres. For self-service loading of bicycles, it does not matter whether the bicycle is electrically assisted or not.  Mountain bikes. Racing bikes. Gravel bikes. Everyday bikes etc.  Special bicycles. All bicycles which are longer than two meters, usually tandems, recumbent bicycles and cargo bicycles. Bikes allowed on InterCity (IC), InterRegio (IR), EuroCity (EC), InterCityExpress (ICE) and Railjet (RJX) trains within Switzerland.  Ordinary bicycles that are no more than two meters long. Bikes allowed on RegioExpress (RE), S-Bahn (S) and Regio (R) train categories.   In these train categories you can transport ordinary bicycles and special bicycles. Particularly in the case of special bikes, please note that escape routes, entrances and exits must always be kept clear. If you are taking special bikes along with you, you are advised to avoid peak travel times.                                              More about bikes that are allowed

question: I have an annual bike pass. Do I also need a reservation?
answer: Yes, even with an annual bike pass, you still need a reservation for trains where reservations are required.

question: Which bikes and vehicles cannot be transported on public transport?
answer: Vehicles with combustion engines (e.g. mopeds), triple tandem bikes, multi-seater horizontal bicycles, personal transporter (e.g. Segways) and electric mopeds.

question: For which trains to Ticino can I reserve a bicycle storage space and how can I do so?
answer: The IC trains on lines 2/21 (Basel/Zurich–Ticino) need to be reserved every day of the week during the cycling season from 21 March to 31 October. You can reserve bicycle spaces using the SBB Mobile app. Bicycle spaces on EuroCity trains to/from Italy can also be reserved for journeys within Switzerland. You can reserve bicycle spaces using the SBB Mobile app.

question: Do I need to pay for my bike?
answer: Yes. You also need a separate ticket for your bike for self-service loading of bicycles.

question: How can I transport my folding bicycle on the train?
answer: Folding bicycles should be stowed as luggage items under the seat, in the luggage stowage/niches or in other suitable places where they do not hinder other passengers or occupy any bicycle spaces.  You do not need a reservation or a ticket for this.  No packing/bag is required.

question: What ticket do I need for a tandem?
answer: For tandems or special bicycles in general (all types of bicycles which do not fit into the normal bicycle racks or are longer than two metres, e.g. cargo bicycles, recumbent bicycles) you need a Point-to-Point Bike Ticket, a Bike Day Pass ticket or an annual bike pass. Please note the provisions of the transport companies regarding whether and under what conditions the transport of special bicycles is permitted.                                             Go to “Which bikes can I load myself?”

question: Do I need a reservation for my scooter?
answer: You do not need a reservation for your (e-)scooter, even on trains which require reservations. Exception: your (e-)scooter is too big to be stowed in a luggage stowage/niche or under or between the seats.

question: Can my (e-)scooter come with me on the train?
answer: Yes. You can take both e-scooters and normal scooters on the train.   Please stow your (electric) scooter in a suitable location on the train and ensure that it does not protrude into the passageway or take up bicycle spaces (e.g. under or between the seats). If your (electric) scooter can be folded, we kindly request that you place it folded up under the seat or in the luggage racks/niches. This ensures that more space is available for luggage, prams etc. Both foldable and unfoldable (electric) scooters are transported free of charge, provided the largest wheel has a diameter of no more than 30cm or less than 12 inches).

question: Where and how can I buy tickets for my bicycle?
answer: Purchase bike tickets. You can purchase bike tickets online on SBB.ch, via the SBB Mobile app, from ticket machines or at a public transport point of sale. Before you buy a ticket. Have you checked the timetable to see whether a bicycle reservation is necessary for the route you want to take? If a reservation is required, we recommend that you make the reservation first and only then buy the bike ticket. Unfortunately, it is not currently possible to purchase the reservation together with the ticket.                                             Go to bike space reservations.                                                                 Purchase for yourself and for your bike in the SBB Mobile app. If you would like to buy the ticket for your bike together with your own ticket, proceed as follows:  Enter the route and select your desired connection. Select ‘Tickets from CHF...’. Tap on ‘Edit passenger’ (pencil symbol). Tap the plus sign at the bottom next to the bicycle symbol once. Tap on ‘Accept’. The bike ticket will now appear together with your ticket in the overview and you can buy the tickets together. Would you like to buy a ticket and a bike ticket for several people at the same time? Add a bicycle for each co-passenger. Only one bike can be taken per person. Children aged under 16 who are accompanied by an adult do not need a bike ticket.   Purchase in the SBB Mobile app (if you already have a ticket for yourself).  Enter the route and select your desired connection.  Select ‘Tickets from CHF...’. Tap on ‘Edit passenger’ (pencil symbol). (Only if you do NOT have a GA Travelcard: enter a new fictitious co-passenger with your own name. To do this, please swap your first name and last name around and enter a GA Travelcard as the travelcard). Tap the plus sign at the bottom next to the bicycle symbol once (or several times if you want to buy several bike tickets). Tap on ‘Accept’. The bicycle ticket will now appear in the overview and you can buy the ticket.  Online on SBB.ch with a login.  Here’s how it works:  Enter the route into the timetable and select your preferred connection. When entering the passengers, click on ‘Process passengers | reductions’. Enter the number of bike tickets you would like in the field following the ‘Discount cards’ field. If you do not need a ticket for yourself, check the box next to the text ‘Passenger already has a valid ticket or other valid travel document’. Click on ‘Accept’. Choose between ‘single journey’ and ‘single and return journey’. Go to the check-out and purchase the ticket with your preferred payment method.  Online on SBB.ch without a login. Here’s how it works:  Enter the route into the timetable and select your preferred connection. When entering passengers, click on ‘Add passenger’ and add the name of the passenger/co-passenger. At the same time, enter the number of bike tickets you would like in the field following the ‘Discount cards’ field. Enter the number of dog tickets you would like in the field following the ‘Discount cards’ field. If you do not need a ticket for yourself, check the box next to the text ‘Passenger already has a valid ticket or other valid travel document’. Click on ‘Accept’. Choose between ‘single journey’ and ‘single and return journey’. Go to the check-out and purchase the ticket with your chosen payment method.  Where and how can I buy a Bike Day Pass? You can purchase Bike Day Passes online on SBB.ch, via the SBB Mobile app, from ticket machines or at a public transport point of sale. The Bike Day Pass is automatically offered during purchase on SBB.ch or via SBB Mobile (see the question ‘How can I buy tickets for my bicycle?’) as soon as the price for the bike ticket reaches the amount of CHF 15. Alternatively, you can buy the Bike Day Pass directly online at SBB.ch or via the SBB Mobile app in the ‘Shop & Services’ tab.                                             Purchase the Bike Day Pass online.                                                                Please note that the area of validity for the Bike Day Pass differs from that of normal Point-to-Point Tickets and GA/Half Fare Travelcards.                                             Go to the validity of bike tickets (“yes” in column T600 for bikes)                         Link opens in new window.                                       Where and how do I buy an annual bike pass? The annual bike pass is available for CHF 260 per bike per year on the SwissPass. If you already hold a SwissPass, you can purchase an annual bike pass online or at any staffed point of sale. The annual bike pass is integrated onto your SwissPass.  Buy an annual bike pass with SwissPass online  If you do not hold a SwissPass  Please note that the area of validity for the annual bike pass differs from that of normal Point-to-Point Tickets and GA/Half Fare Travelcards.                                             Go to the validity of bike tickets (“yes” in column T600 for bikes)                         Link opens in new window.

question: Do I need tickets for children’s bicycles?
answer: For children under 6 years old, children’s bikes are considered hand luggage and can be transported free of charge. Bambini e ragazzi in possesso di un AG Ragazzi o di un AG Famiglia Ragazzi possono portare gratuitamente la bici anche senza accompagnamento. Children with a GA Travelcard for Children or a GA Travelcard Familia for Children can take their bike with them for free even when on their own. If these conditions are not met, you will need a ticket for each children’s bike. For bicycles belonging to children aged 6 and over, you must buy a bike space reservation for trains where reservations for bicycles are compulsory.                                             Go to “Do I have to make a reservation for children’s bicycles?”

question: I will be travelling in 1st class. Can I also reserve a space for my bicycle in a 1st class coach?
answer: The reservation system allocates spaces automatically. Unfortunately, it is not possible to choose between 1st and 2nd class when making the reservation.

question: Can I change or cancel my bicycle reservation?
answer: No. Unfortunately, this is not possible at the moment.

question: How do I buy a bike space reservation?
answer: If a bike space reservation is mandatory on your desired connection, it is best to purchase one with the SBB Mobile app. You can identify mandatory bicycle reservations by the bicycle symbol with R . With the SBB Mobile app.  Open the app. Enter the route and select your desired connection. Tap on ‘Tickets from CHF...’. Tap on ‘Edit passenger’ (pencil symbol). Tap the plus sign at the bottom next to the bicycle symbol once. Tap on ‘Accept’. Scroll down to ‘Additional offers’ then select ‘Seat reservation only’. Click on ‘Purchase ticket for CHF 2.00’.  Would you like to reserve bicycle spaces for other co-passengers? Tap the plus sign next to the bike symbol several times until you reach the desired number of bike reservations. Then complete the reservation as described above. On SBB.ch. The purchase of bike space reservations on SBB.ch is set to be introduced in April 2024. At the station.  All bike space reservations are also available at staffed public transport points of sale. Via the SBB Contact Center. Alternatively, you can reserve your bicycle space via the SBB Contact Centre on 0848 44 66 88 (CHF 0.08/min.) no later than 3 working days before the start of your journey.

question: Do I have to make a reservation for children’s bicycles?
answer: No reservation is necessary for bicycles, balance bikes and scooters belonging to children below 6 years old. A reservation is required for bicycles belonging to children between the ages of 6 and 16.                                               For more information, see the question: “Do I need tickets for children’s bicycles?”

question: I have made a reservation for my bicycle, but I have only received a coach number, and no bike space number. Why is this?
answer: If your reservation only provides a coach number, you can store your bicycle in the train’s luggage compartment. SBB staff will assist you with loading and unloading.

question: Is the annual bike pass non-transferable?
answer: Yes, the annual bike pass is integrated onto a personal SwissPass and is therefore only valid for that person.

question: Is it possible to reserve bicycle spaces on trains which do not require reservation?
answer: No, bicycle space reservations can only be made on trains where reservations are compulsory (bicycle symbol with R ). On all other trains, it is not possible to reserve bicycle spaces.

question: Can I take my e-moped on the train?
answer: No. You are not allowed to transport e-mopeds on the train. By e-mopeds, we mean any motorcycle-like vehicle which runs on electricity alone, regardless of its power.

question: I would like to reserve spaces for three bicycles but a message saying ‘fully booked’ has appeared. Why is this?
answer: Either the train is already fully booked, or the coach does not have three bicycle spaces available in the same coach. Try to split up your reservation (e.g. two bicycles and one bicycle) or choose another connection.

question: How can I see which coaches have the bike spaces?
answer: The coach and space number is indicated on your reservation confirmation. On the day of your journey, you can check the train formation to see in which sector the coach with your reserved space is located. The train formation can be found in the SBB Mobile app and on the online timetable at SBB.ch. In the app, swipe the desired connection from right to left to do this. For the desired connection, click on the ‘Show details’ button in the online timetable. Then click on the arrow in the bottom left until the route and train formation are shown. Via SBB Mobile: Image legend: Choose a connection in the SBB Mobile app. Then swipe the connection from right to left. Image legend: The train formation will be displayed after you swipe.  In the timetable on SBB.ch: Image legend: Choose your preferred connection in the SBB.ch timetable. Click on the button labelled «Show details» in the connection details. Image legend: By clicking on the arrow in the bottom left (Trip info), you can change the view and show the train formation. At the railway station. At many stations, the coach numbers can be seen on the blue displays on the platform. These may also display the bicycle pictograms.

question: Can I choose the storage space when making a reservation?
answer: The reservation system allocates spaces automatically. Unfortunately, it is not possible to select a specific coach.

question: Can I take my bike with me as hand luggage?
answer: Yes, you can in certain cases.                                             Go to bicycles as hand luggage

question: Can I cancel my annual bike pass and have it refunded?
answer: If you have used the annual bike pass for no more than one month and would like to cancel it, you will receive 50% of the purchase price as a refund. If you have used the annual bike pass for two months, you can still get 25% of the purchase price back. Cancellation is not possible if you have used it for more than two months.

question: Can seat reservations be refunded?
answer: Generally no. Seat reservations cannot be refunded or exchanged. Special conditions apply to trains subject to a surcharge. There is an exception if the rolling stock used for the train changes at short notice and your reservations are made invalid. Ask the train crew to provide you with written confirmation. You can obtain a refund of the CHF 5 at the ticket counter or you can exchange it for a promotional code online (to be used for any service when making your next online or mobile booking).

question: I already have an Interrail Pass. Where can I make a seat reservation?
answer: Online: at interrail.euLink opens in new window.. By telephone: via the SBB Contact Center on 0848 44 66 88 (CHF 0.08/min.). In person: at any public transport point of sale.

question: Which trains within Switzerland can I reserve seats for?
answer: Trains for which you can reserve seats are marked with an R (meaning a reservation is possible) or an R in a rectangular frame (meaning a reservation is compulsory) in the timetable.  For seat reservation for touristic trains such as the Gotthard Panorama Express, the Bernina Express or the Glacier Express etc. please contact a public transport point of sale.

question: Can I exchange a seat reservation for a journey to Europe that I booked online for one at another time / on another date?
answer: In some cases it is possible to exchange your seat reservation before the departure of the train and in accordance with the conditions that you were informed of during booking. Not all products and services can be exchanged. Please refer to the supplementary travel details you received when you made your online purchase on SBB.ch. If you have any questions, please contact the SBB Contact Center on 0848 44 66 88 (CHF 0.08/min.) or go to a public transport point of sale.

question: How much does it cost to reserve a seat?
answer: The reservation fee for seats is CHF 5 per person. For connections involving changes, the reservation on the connecting train is free of charge. For trains subject to a surcharge (e.g. the Glacier Express), the reservation fee is included in the surcharge.

question: For reservations for more than one person, are all the seats always next to each other?
answer: Yes. However, if there are not enough seats next to each other available, you will get a message asking you to split up the reservation. Even if the seat numbers are not always consecutive, the seats will still be in the same compartment.

question: Can I reserve seats in the family coach?
answer: Yes. Please visit a staffed public transport point of sale or contact the SBB Contact Center on 0848 44 66 88 (CHF 0.08/min.).

question: How do I reserve seats for a group of 10 or more people?
answer: There are special rules for groups of 10 or more people.                                              Go to information and seat reservations for groups of 10 or more people

question: Which trains to Europe require a seat reservation?
answer: When reserving seats for train journeys to Europe, different prices and provisions apply according to the country.                                             Go to the country overview for seat reservations

question: I already have a Eurail Pass. Where can I make a seat reservation?
answer: Online: at eurail.comLink opens in new window.. By telephone: via the SBB Contact Center on 0848 44 66 88 (CHF 0.08/min.). In person: at any public transport point of sale.

question: Who can I buy tickets to Europe online for?
answer: International tickets for Europe are available online for passengers aged 16 or over. You can buy tickets online for yourself as well as for people who are travelling together with you (e.g. children of any age, other adults etc.). International tickets for children and young people aged under 16 travelling alone are not available online. These tickets can only be purchased at ticket counters or by calling the SBB Contact Center (0848 44 66 88 (CHF 0.08/min.).

question: Bookable countries.
answer: For travel to the countries listed below, you can buy tickets on SBB.ch. Depending on the journey destinations and duration, Interrail Passes are a practical and inexpensive alternative. question: I would like to take my bike with me on a train to another country. Is this possible?
answer: You can find international connections that permit you to take your bike on the train (excluding Italy) by visiting the route planer (hafas.bene-system.com) and selecting the number of bicycles from the drop-down menu ‘carriage of Bicycles required’.                                             Go to the route planner                         Link opens in new window.                                       In France, bicycles and trailers can be transported free of charge on regional trains, provided there is enough space. Tandem bicycles can only be transported in trains with luggage vans.                                             More information on taking your bike with you in France                          Link opens in new window.                                                                                   Help with bike tickets and reservations for Europe

question: Can I have my luggage sent abroad?
answer: Please contact Swiss Post to have your luggage transported from Switzerland to Germany or Austria.                                             More information on luggage dispatch at post.ch/en                          Link opens in new window.                                       The following shipping options are available for transporting luggage from Germany to Switzerland.                                             More information on luggage dispatch with DHL                          Link opens in new window.

question: I experienced a major delay on my international journey. Can I receive compensation for this?
answer: You can receive 25% of the transport price as a refund if the delay was 60 minutes or more. You can be refunded 50% of the transport price for a delay of 120 minutes or more.                                             More information on compensation

question: I would like to travel flexibly through Europe. What options does Interrail offer?
answer: Interrail offers Interrail Passes for both individual and multiple European countries.                                             More information on Interrail products

question: The train I booked has been impacted by a strike or a suspension of service on the line. What do I need to do?
answer: If a train is cancelled due to a strike, the ticket can usually be refunded or rebooked for a train running on the same day free of charge (up to a maximum of one month after the date of travel). Please contact the office that issued your ticket to request a refund. In the event of a suspension of service on the line, please enquire as to whether your train is being rerouted, whether your ticket is valid on another connection and whether it is possible to get a free refund. Any potential free refund is only available from the office that issued your ticket.

question: I can no longer make my journey abroad and would like to have my ticket refunded or exchanged. What can I do?
answer: You will be shown or informed of the exchange and refund conditions when making the purchase. Refunds are generally only possible up until one day before departure. The deductible shown at the time of purchase will be applied (this can be as high as 100% depending on the train or offer).  If necessary, contact your cancellation insurance provider to have the costs covered for insured reasons. A tip for your next trip: purchase your cancellation costs insurance the same day as your ticket – either separately online as an additional service or at a staffed ticket counter.                                             Buy Ticket Insurance Europe or annual travel insurance                         Link opens in new window.                                       For a small number of offers, a partial refund is possible even after a train has departed if a passenger has confirmation of non-use – but usually only up until one month after the travel date at the latest. Please note that the person who was supposed to travel must provide the confirmation of non-use.  Please contact the office that issued your ticket to get a refund. You must have the original ticket to do this. For international tickets purchased online at SBB.ch, please go to a public transport point of sale or call the SBB Contact Center on 0848 44 66 88 (CHF 0.08/min.).                                             Fare regulations and conditions for travel to Europe

question: What conditions apply to tickets to Europe for exchanges and refunds?
answer: You can see the conditions and validity for offers before you confirm the booking. Please make sure you check them before you make the purchase.  In many cases, tickets are only valid on the train that you have booked. There are certain offers (mostly saver offers) that cannot be exchanged or refunded – not even in exceptional cases. These conditions are set by the respective railway companies and cannot be changed by SBB.  For this reason, we always recommend that you take out cancellation costs insurance. It is best to purchase this insurance the same day as you purchase your ticket – either separately online as an additional service or at a staffed ticket counter. The insurance can be purchased for a single journey or as an annual policy. Buy Ticket Insurance Europe or annual travel insuranceLink opens in new window. Fare regulations and conditions for travel to Europe

question: How can I present an international ticket that I have purchased on SBB.ch when on the train?
answer: The following options are available for presenting international tickets on the train:  Printed on white A4 paper (print@homeLink opens in new window.). Displayed as a screen ticket/PDF on a mobile device.  Please note that an internet connection is required on the train in order to display your ticket as a screen ticket/open the PDF. To be on the safe side, we recommend that you save the PDF from the confirmation email to your device before you travel.

question: How far in advance can I book journeys abroad?
answer: Booking will become available at varying times depending on the country in question. In some cases, you can book up to 6 months in advance. Please note that bookings are severely restricted in the period before the timetable change (in mid-December and also in June for some countries) and are sometimes only possible a few weeks in advance.  The booking periods for the most relevant countries:  Germany: 180 days Austria: 180 day (92 days for some trains) Italy: 180 days France: 120 days or 180 days (TGV/ICE France–Germany).

answer: For travel to the following countries, you can buy tickets for certain routes online at SBB.ch.
