question: I have received the ‘Travel without a valid ticket’ or ‘Travel with a partly valid ticket’ form and have a question about it.
answer: On the“RogF SBB Servicecenter Revenue” form, please select the category “Another reason”.                                             Link to the "RogF SBB Servicecenter Revenue” form

question: Does the requirement to have a ticket also apply to foreign trains (TGV, ICE, Railjet etc.)?
answer: Yes, on their Swiss routes.

question: I have received a bill, but I was not travelling by train. What now?
answer: Think about who might have been able to misuse your identity. Misuse of your identity is a criminal act. For this reason, you could make a complaint to the police. Please also contact us without delay:                                             Click here for the contact form

question: What do I have to do to submit a request for the retraction of debt enforcement or the deletion of the entry in the debt collection register?
answer: Please complete the following form:                                             Link to the form requesting retraction of debt enforcement form / deletion of the entry in the debt collection register

question: Are you required to hold a ticket on all SBB trains?
answer: Yes, you must hold a valid ticket to travel on all SBB trains (local, regional and long-distance services). This means that all passengers are responsible for making sure that they have a ticket or travelcard. Customers must have a valid ticket or travelcard before the start of the journey (actual departure). The purchase and ordering process (tickets purchased digitally) and the acquisition of authorisation to travel (check-in) must be fully completed before actual departure. Tickets are not sold aboard the train.

question: What are the payment deadlines?
answer: If you receive an invoice, payment reminder or demand notice from us regarding a travel without a valid ticket, these must be paid by the following deadlines:  Invoice: within 30 days Demand notice: within 10 days                                              Did you forget your travelcard or your SwissPass? Were you unable to present a valid personal travelcard or SwissPass during ticket inspection? Presentation at a later date incurs a fee of CHF 5. You can pay this when you submit the form at the counter or online within 10 days. The fee rises to CHF 30 after 10 days. You will receive the invoice from the SBB Servicecenter Revenue by post.                                             Click here to pay the travelcard/SwissPass fee online

question: I have received a bill but I believe that I have already paid it. Should I ignore the bill?
answer: No, on no account! First check to whom you have paid this debt. Did you perhaps pay the debt to a different debt collection agency (e.g. Zurich Transport Network, Bernmobil)? If not, please contact us.                                             Click here for the contact form

question: Consolidation of all debts.
answer: Would you like to request consolidation of all your outstanding debts?  Please complete the following form:                                             Go to the form for the consolidation of all debts

question: I have a different question about debt enforcement and the reminder before start of debt collection.
answer: In the form ‘Reminder before start of debt collection procedure (RogF)’, select the category ‘Other reason’.                                             Go to the form ‘Reminder before start of debt collection procedure (RogF)’

question: I have received a demand notice. This includes reminder fees of CHF 40. Is SBB allowed to charge this fee?
answer: Yes, the fees for SBB ancillary services are included in Tariff 610. According to SBB Tariff 610 section 23.200, the SBB Revenue Service Centre can charge a reminder fee of CHF 40. Furthermore, the invoice also makes it clear that a reminder fee of CHF 40 will be charged if the invoice is not paid.

question: Deadline extension.
answer: Have you received an invoice or demand notice with regard to a journey without a valid ticket? Would you like to extend the deadline? We offer a deadline extension of up to three months from the date of travel. If you would like a deadline extension of more than three months, a payment postponement of a maximum of six months may be granted. However, this is only possible if there is a guardianship or similar and a debt restructuring plan is submitted. Please note that no further travel without a valid ticket or with only a partly valid ticket is permitted within the payment period. Otherwise, the agreement will be void and the debts shall become due for payment immediately. Have you read the above terms and conditions and wish to extend your deadline? Then please complete the following form:                                             Go to the deadline extension form

question: What should I do if I would like to request a deadline extension, a deferral, an overview of outstanding claims or payment by instalments?
answer: You have the option to indicate your requests in the form ‘Reminder before start of debt collection procedure (RogF)’.                                             Go to the form ‘Reminder before start of debt collection procedure (RogF)’

question: Can I face criminal prosecution for travel without a valid ticket or travel with only a partly valid ticket?
answer: Yes, we can take you to court for infringement of the Swiss Passenger Transport Act (PBG). Bear in mind that if you are taken to court you will incur further costs (court costs, penalties, etc.).

question: I have a completely different question regarding invoices or demand notices.
answer: On the“Rog FSBB Servicecenter Revenue” form, please select the category “Another reason”.                                             Link to the "RogF SBB Servicecenter Revenue” form

question: What does ‘travel with a partly valid ticket’ mean?
answer: You will be given a ‘travel with only a partly valid ticket’ form, if you are travelling with a ticket that is valid for the entire route, but is insufficient for one of the following specific reasons: RemitF on all services.  have a ticket for the wrong customer group (e.g. a half-price or reduced-price ticket without justification)  have chosen the wrong mode of transport for part of a route (e.g. on the Berne − Zurich Enge via Zurich HB route, part of the journey is made by tram) max. 1 missing zone for regional transport tickets or max. 1 missing stop for national transport tickets.  RemitF on regional services.  who are not in possession of a class upgrade who are not in possession of a route upgrade or hold a ticket for a different route (which has the same departure and destination stations or the same departure and destination zones, but another direct and similar route)

question: I’ve received a reminder before start of debt collection procedure. It includes an administrative fee of CHF 40. Is SBB allowed to charge this fee?
answer: Yes, because the SBB Revenue Service Centre is not a professional representative as per Art. 27 para. 2 of DEBA.

question: What surcharges are charged?
answer: Overview of the surcharges charged.                                                                                                                            Prices and product specifications subject to change.                                                                                                                      Surcharges                                                       Cost in CHF 1st occasion                                                       Cost in CHF 2nd occasion                                                       Cost in CHF 3rd and subsequent occasions                                                                                                                                                                                             Travel without a valid ticket (RogF)                                                                                                                                                          90.00                                                       130.00                                                       160.00                                                                                                                               Travel with only a partly valid ticket (RemitF)                                                                                                                                                          70.00                                                       110.00                                                       140.00                                                                                                                                   Prices and product specifications subject to change.                                                    Comments:  The fee is collected against a bill. The passenger and travel data are recorded on the train. In order to determine the surcharge, cases occurring in regional traffic (RV) and long-distance traffic (FV) are graded in the national SynServ database. In regional services, a flat-rate fare is billed in addition to the surcharges. In long-distance services, the actual fare is billed in addition to the surcharges. The surcharges are differentiated depending on whether the ticket is invalid or partially valid. Additionally, the surcharges increase in the 2nd and 3rd instances. The obligation to buy a ticket before travelling applies generally on transport company networks for direct services in Switzerland.

question: May I deal with a bill over the telephone on behalf of my son/daughter (adult) or another third party?
answer: Yes, however data protection legislation means that we require your power of attorney.

question: Do you wish to pay your outstanding debts in instalments?
answer: No problem – you should note the following conditions:   Minimum monthly instalment: CHF 40 There is a one-off fee of CHF 40 for the instalment agreement (administrative expenses). Maximum number of monthly instalments: 24  Are you interested, and can you meet these conditions? If yes, then please complete the following form:                                             Go to the form for instalment payments

question: My case was at the debt collection office and I have paid my debt in full. Will this case now automatically be deleted from the register of judgements?
answer: No. Please submit a written request to have the entry deleted (retraction costs: CHF 50).                                             Go to Application for withdrawal of debt collection proceedings/deletion of an entry in the debt collection register

question: My case was at the debt collection office and I have paid my debt in full. Will this case now automatically be deleted from the register of judgements?
answer: No. Please submit a written request to have the entry deleted (retraction costs: CHF 50).                                             Go to Application for withdrawal of debt collection proceedings/deletion of an entry in the debt collection register

question: What is CembraPay?
answer: Based in Zurich, CembraPay AG is a payment processor which handles purchasing by invoice for SBB.                                              More information on CembraPay                         Link opens in new window.

question: What requirements do I need to meet to be able to pay by invoice?
answer: You must be at least 18 years old. You must be a resident of Switzerland or the Principality of Liechtenstein. You must have a SwissPass login. You must have registered with CembraPay and been subject to a one-off address and credit check. You must have access to a mobile phone with a Swiss or Liechtenstein dialling code (pay-as-you-go or contract).

question: Which products or services can I not pay for by invoice?
answer: Purchasing by invoice is not possible for:   e-vouchers  reservations (for seats and bike spaces) multiple-journey tickets international journeys (only partially possible at the moment) SwissPass Parking

question: What is the credit limit for purchases by invoice? How can I increase the credit limit?
answer: The standard credit limit is CHF 500. You can request an increase to this limit from CembraPay. Your current limit is printed on the invoice.                                             Apply for an increased credit limit                         Link opens in new window.

question: Can I pay my monthly invoice by Debit Direct, direct debit or eBill?
answer: No. CembraPay does not offer Debit Direct, direct debit or eBill.

question: In what format will I receive the monthly invoice?
answer: You can choose your preferred format for your invoice during registration:  by e-mail (invoice payment only possible via e-banking) by post incl. an payment slip (CHF 2.65 per dispatch)

question: What do I have to consider when changing the address or the e-mail address?
answer: After registration, you have a contractual relationship with CembraPay. Any change of address or e-mail registered with SBB will not be forwarded to CembraPay. The new address or e-mail must be disclosed separately to CembraPay. Report your new address  Link opens in new window.Report your new e-mail addressLink opens in new window.

question: Can I pay my monthly invoice at the counter?
answer: No. It is not possible to pay your monthly invoice over the counter. This is because the entire payment processing operation is carried out by CembraPay. SBB is therefore unable to provide any information regarding either the invoice or any demand notices. Please always contact CembraPay directly.                                             More information on CembraPay at cembrapay.ch                         Link opens in new window.

question: Can I use EasyRide on both SBB Preview and SBB Mobile?
answer: You can only use EasyRide on one SBB app and one device at the same time. Please note that journeys in SBB Mobile and SBB Preview are charged separately.

question: I’ve been overcharged for a journey. What can I do?
answer: Open the app and go to the “Tickets & Travelcards” tab. Tap “Expired” and then “Show EasyRide journeys”. Choose the relevant journey there and then tap “Report problem”. Complete the form and submit it. Customer service will check your journey and contact you directly.

question: How can I see the fare?
answer: Once you have checked out, the “Provisional price” and the “Calculated price” will be displayed directly in the overview of the journey made. You can view an overview of the trips you have taken and the corresponding charges at any time by selecting “Show EasyRide journeys” under “Expired” in the “Tickets & Travelcards” tab.

question: How and when will I receive a final invoice for my journeys?
answer: You will receive a final invoice the day after your trip. The invoice will be sent to you by email and is VAT compliant. The 24h-tickets for the Zurich Transport Network are not available for EasyRide. Instead, a day pass valid for a calendar day is available.

question: I forgot to check out. What can I do?
answer: Open the app and go to the “Tickets & Travelcards” tab. Tap “Expired” and then “Show EasyRide journeys”. Choose the relevant journey there and then tap “Report problem”. Complete the form and describe what happened to customer service. There is no entitlement to credit if you forget to check out.

question: What’s the difference between the “Provisional price” and the “Calculated price”?
answer: These two prices are generally identical. However, if you make several journeys on the same day, you may benefit from a special price. Example: you use EasyRide three times in one day in the same zone. The zone ticket costs CHF 3 per journey while the Day Pass for the zone is CHF 6. Both the “Provisional price” and the “Calculated price” would be CHF 6 for the first two tickets. For the third ticket, however, the “Provisional price” would be CHF 3 once again, but the “Calculated price” would be CHF 0, since the price of the Day Pass would already have been reached.

question: When will the journey be charged to my payment method?
answer: So that we can charge you the cheapest price for all of the journeys you have made over the course of a day, we don’t take payment from your payment method until public transport has shut down for the day, i.e. at night. If, for example, you have made five individual journeys over the course of one day and a Day Pass would have worked out cheaper for you, we will only charge you the price of a Day Pass. A final statement showing all the journeys completed, tickets issued and debits will be sent to the e-mail account registered in your SwissPass login at the latest two days after the journey. Please also check your spam folder.

question: How can I see an overview of my past journeys?
answer: Open the app and tap on “Show EasyRide journeys” under “Expired” in the “Tickets & Travelcards” tab. There you will find a list of your previous journeys. Please note: if you re-register, your previous journeys will no longer be shown.

question: Why do I not see any details of the EasyRide journeys on the payment method “monthly invoice”?
answer: EasyRide is a service from our technology partner Fairtiq. Monthly invoices are sent from our separate partner CembraPay. For technical reasons, it is not currently possible to show travel information, such as the routes you have travelled or the tickets you have purchased with EasyRide, in the monthly invoice.  Your EasyRide journeys are shown on your statement with the reference “SBB journey / EasyRide”. To verify these items on your statement, we recommend that you compare them with the EasyRide receipt sent to you by e-mail.

question: Why are there price differences between tickets purchased via SBB.ch or SBB Mobile and EasyRide or other automatic ticketing vendors on the market?
answer: EasyRide combines the single tickets purchased for travel into cheaper ticket combinations, insofar as this is possible in accordance with the fare provisions applicable to the journey. All automatic ticketing service providers calculate prices on the same basis. If you travel several times in one day, EasyRide uses an algorithm to optimise the calculation of your “day price” based on the routes travelled. However, problems with trip recording due to check-in/check-out or missing or bad location data during or after the trip can lead to price differences with the normal Point-to-Point Ticket on SBB.ch and SBB Mobile. With SBB Mobile and SBB.ch, you purchase a ticket prior to departure for a predefined route with relevant ‘via’ and transfer stations; these fares are fixed. Please note that when you purchase tickets from SBB.ch or SBB Mobile, you have access to supersaver tickets and Saver Day Passes that are not offered in EasyRide.

question: I’ve received a debt collection notification. What do I need to do?
answer: Your GA Travelcard/Half Fare Travelcard has been cancelled due to outstanding payments. Please notify the collection agency about your query using the form mentioned in the debt collection notification. Please note: we are unable to provide you with any further information at the ticket counter or via the SBB Contact Center from this point in time.

question: Where can I view my travelcard invoices and receipts?
answer: You can view all invoices and receipts for travelcards stored on your SwissPass at swisspass.ch in your customer account. Please be aware of the distinction between the contracting party and the passenger. Go to your invoice overviewLink opens in new window. Go to the distinction between the contracting party and the passenger

question: When and how will I receive my invoice for the GA and Half Fare Travelcard?
answer: We will send you the invoice for your GA or Half Fare Travelcard’s next validity period by e-mail or post two months before the annual automatic renewal. For a GA Travelcard with monthly invoicing, you will receive the invoice every month. You also have the option of receiving your invoices by e-bill. Here’s how it works: We will send the e-bill to the invoice mailbox of your e-banking account. This means that you do not need to scan in the payment slip but can simply check the invoice and approve the payment with a few clicks. To receive e-bills, log into the e-banking platform provided by your financial institution and register with SBB under the E-bill/biller menu option. Please note: If you pay by e-bill, we will not send any further billing information by post or e-mail. We recommend that you subscribe to the reminder service on swisspass.ch. Then you will be reminded of the possible cancellation date for your travelcard by e-mail or text message in good time.

question: Why does SBB charge a CHF 15 reminder fee?
answer: The purpose of charging a reminder fee is to cover the additional expense involved. You took note of this when confirming the GTC. The reminder fee is therefore justified.

question: Why have I received a final reminder with a reminder fee?
answer: If an invoice is more than 15 days overdue, we send a final reminder with a fee. Invoices are sent automatically. You can find an overview of your current invoice status at swisspass.ch.                                             Go to the invoice overview                          Link opens in new window.

question: How can I pay my travelcard invoice?
answer: You can choose how you would like to pay your travelcard invoices from several different options. You can find an overview of your options at swisspass.ch: Overview for payment of subsequent invoices (in the case of automatic travelcard renewal)Link opens in new window. Overview for payment for a new travelcardLink opens in new window.

question: How can I pay in the SBB Mobile app?
answer: For buying online, the following payment methods are available: Invoice: Monthly invoicing.                                             More information on monthly invoicing                                                                For buying online, the following payment methods are available: Invoice: Monthly invoicing. Credit cards.  Mastercard (e.g. Swiss Bankers Travel, Swiss Bankers Life etc.). Visa. American Express Switzerland. Diners Club.  Debit cards.  PostFinance Card. Debit Mastercard. Visa Debit. Reka Card.  Debit cards from other providers are not accepted. Prepaid cards.  Mastercard. Visa.  Prepaid cards from other providers are not accepted. Other payment methods and wallets.  Twint.  Apple Pay.

question: How can I pay for products or services purchased on SBB.ch?
answer: For buying online, the following payment methods are available: Invoice: Monthly invoicing (except GA Travelcard, e-vouchers, international tickets and seat reservations).                                             More information on monthly invoicing                                                                Credit cards.   Mastercard (e.g. Swiss Bankers Travel, Swiss Bankers Life etc.). Visa. American Express Switzerland. Diners Club.  Debit cards.  PostFinance Card. Debit Mastercard. Visa Debit. Reka Card.  Debit cards from other providers are not accepted. Prepaid cards.  Mastercard. Visa.  Prepaid cards from other providers are not accepted. Other payment methods.  E-voucher. Twint.

question: How can I redeem my promotional code?
answer: On SBB.ch: Enter your promotional code on sbb.ch/en/buy in the ‘Enter promotional code’ field and click on ‘Redeem’. Follow the steps in the instructions given. Alternatively, you can also enter the promotional code in the basket directly before clicking on ‘Purchase’ (step 3: Payment) in the ‘Payment method (e-voucher / promotional code)’ field. Please check that the value of your promotional code was deducted before you commit to making the purchase. After your purchase is made, you can no longer use your promotional code towards it. Please note that some promotional codes can only be redeemed against certain offers. In the SBB Mobile app: Scroll right down in the ‘Ticket options’ page before making your payment and enter the code under ‘Redeem promotional code’. Follow the steps in the instructions given. Please check that the value of your promotional code was deducted before you commit to making the purchase. After your purchase is made, you can no longer use your promotional code towards it. Please note that some promotional codes can only be redeemed against certain offers.

question: My payment transaction was aborted. Was I charged for my purchase?
answer: If you do not receive an e-mail with a download link following your purchase on SBB.ch or via the app, and if the ticket you purchased is not available under ‘Orders’ in your profile on SBB.ch or in the ‘Trips and Tickets’ tile in the app, it means the booking was not completed and your payment method was not charged. For further questions about your payment method, please contact your bank.                                             Go to my orders in my profile

question: My means of payment was declined (unauthorised). What can I do?
answer: We cannot give any information on the exact reasons for your means of payment being refused. Please enter a different means of payment.

question: How can I redeem my e-voucher?
answer: On SBB.ch, you can redeem e-vouchers just before finalising your purchase – on the payment screen. You can use it to pay the whole sum or parts of it. If the voucher does not cover the entire value of the purchase, you will also need to use another payment method.  E-vouchers cannot currently be redeemed in the SBB Mobile app.

question: How can I pay at the ticket machine?
answer: The following payment methods are available at the ticket machine:  CHF coins. CHF notes. EUR notes. Reka. Maestro.  PostFinance Card. V Pay. Credit cards (Mastercard, Visa, American Express, Diners and JCB). Apple Pay. Samsung Pay.  Twint. SBB Gift Card.  Please note:  All change is given in Swiss francs.  The new machines will give change up to max. 100 francs in notes and coins.  The older machines will only give change in coins up to max. 20 francs.  No more than 35 coins, 15 notes or 19 Reka cheques may be used in a single transaction.  Bitcoins, Western Union transactions, Prepaid top ups (Pay as you go credit, Phone cards, Paysafecard) are not possible with credit cards and Reka cheques.  Please check the information displayed on the machine.

question: Do I have to register to buy a ticket on SBB.ch or in the SBB Mobile app?
answer: No – unless you are buying a GA, Half Fare Travelcard or group travel. However, we do recommend that you register. Registration offers you the following advantages:  Your data (address and payment method)  is stored and does not need to be entered the next time you make a purchase online. You can store your payment method and set it as your default payment method for added convenience. This method is then used every time you make a purchase at SBB.ch or using the SBB Mobile app. You can also use your login in the SBB Mobile app and buy tickets there. You can have tickets for Switzerland refunded directly online, in some cases without fees.  If you only make occasional online purchases at SBB, you can select the “Buy without logging in” option once you have chosen your ticket. However, if you choose this option, you will need to enter your address and payment details again each time you buy a ticket.

question: How can I see whether my purchase was successful?
answer: On SBB.ch: You can view your ticket under ‘Orders’ in your profile on SBB.ch. If the ticket is listed there, the purchase was completed successfully. If the ticket you have just bought is not displayed, select ‘Search orders’ (amending the date if necessary). If you have not received a confirmation e-mail and the ticket you bought is not displayed, your purchase could not be completed and your payment method was not charged.                                             Go to my orders in my profile                                                                On SBB Mobile: You can see the tickets you have bought in the app in the ‘Tickets & SwissPass’ tile. If the ticket is listed there, the purchase was completed successfully. If the ticket you have just bought is not listed, refresh the page by pulling the page down with your finger. If you have not received a confirmation e-mail and the ticket you bought is not displayed, your purchase could not be completed and your payment method was not charged.

question: What does ‘travel with a partly valid ticket’ mean?
answer: You will be given a ‘travel with only a partly valid ticket’ form, if you are travelling with a ticket that is valid for the entire route, but is insufficient for one of the following specific reasons: RemitF on all services.  have a ticket for the wrong customer group (e.g. a half-price or reduced-price ticket without justification)  have chosen the wrong mode of transport for part of a route (e.g. on the Berne − Zurich Enge via Zurich HB route, part of the journey is made by tram) max. 1 missing zone for regional transport tickets or max. 1 missing stop for national transport tickets.  RemitF on regional services.  who are not in possession of a class upgrade who are not in possession of a route upgrade or hold a ticket for a different route (which has the same departure and destination stations or the same departure and destination zones, but another direct and similar route)

question: What differences are there between regional and long-distance services?
answer: On long-distance services (IC, ICN, IR and international trains), it is still possible to purchase a class or route upgrade on board the train without paying a supplement. The minimum price for a class upgrade is 10 francs. It is not possible to purchase ticket upgrades on regional services (RE, R, S, SN).

question: Does the requirement to have a ticket also apply to foreign trains (TGV, ICE, Railjet etc.)?
answer: Yes, on their Swiss routes.

question: Do you wish to pay your outstanding debts in instalments?
answer: No problem – you should note the following conditions:   Minimum monthly instalment: CHF 40 There is a one-off fee of CHF 40 for the instalment agreement (administrative expenses). Maximum number of monthly instalments: 24  Are you interested, and can you meet these conditions? If yes, then please complete the following form:                                             Go to the form for instalment payments

question: What should I do if I would like to request a deadline extension, a deferral, an overview of outstanding claims or payment by instalments?
answer: You have the option to indicate your requests in the form ‘Reminder before start of debt collection procedure (RogF)’.                                             Go to the form ‘Reminder before start of debt collection procedure (RogF)’

question: Consolidation of all debts.
answer: Would you like to request consolidation of all your outstanding debts?  Please complete the following form:                                             Go to the form for the consolidation of all debts

question: What are the payment deadlines?
answer: If you receive an invoice, payment reminder or demand notice from us regarding a travel without a valid ticket, these must be paid by the following deadlines:  Invoice: within 30 days Demand notice: within 10 days                                              Did you forget your travelcard or your SwissPass? Were you unable to present a valid personal travelcard or SwissPass during ticket inspection? Presentation at a later date incurs a fee of CHF 5. You can pay this when you submit the form at the counter or online within 10 days. The fee rises to CHF 30 after 10 days. You will receive the invoice from the SBB Servicecenter Revenue by post.                                             Click here to pay the travelcard/SwissPass fee online

question: Are you required to hold a ticket on all SBB trains?
answer: Yes, you must hold a valid ticket to travel on all SBB trains (local, regional and long-distance services). This means that all passengers are responsible for making sure that they have a ticket or travelcard. Customers must have a valid ticket or travelcard before the start of the journey (actual departure). The purchase and ordering process (tickets purchased digitally) and the acquisition of authorisation to travel (check-in) must be fully completed before actual departure. Tickets are not sold aboard the train.

question: What does ‘travel without a valid ticket’ mean?
answer: If you are unable to present a ticket that is valid for all of the route you are travelling, you will be given a ‘travel without a valid ticket’ document. If you travel without a valid ticket, you will pay a surcharge in addition to the fare.  Whether you didn’t have enough to time to buy a ticket, or you checked in too late, or if you were no longer able to find the ticket, it makes no difference. Furthermore, your personal details will be electronically recorded and kept for at least two years. You will be charged both the cost of the ticket and the supplement.

question: My case was at the debt collection office and I have paid my debt in full. Will this case now automatically be deleted from the register of judgements?
answer: No. Please submit a written request to have the entry deleted (retraction costs: CHF 50).                                             Go to Application for withdrawal of debt collection proceedings/deletion of an entry in the debt collection register

question: Can I face criminal prosecution for travel without a valid ticket or travel with only a partly valid ticket?
answer: Yes, we can take you to court for infringement of the Swiss Passenger Transport Act (PBG). Bear in mind that if you are taken to court you will incur further costs (court costs, penalties, etc.).

question: I have a different question about debt enforcement and the reminder before start of debt collection.
answer: In the form ‘Reminder before start of debt collection procedure (RogF)’, select the category ‘Other reason’.                                             Go to the form ‘Reminder before start of debt collection procedure (RogF)’

question: I have received the ‘Travel without a valid ticket’ or ‘Travel with a partly valid ticket’ form and have a question about it.
answer: On the“RogF SBB Servicecenter Revenue” form, please select the category “Another reason”.                                             Link to the "RogF SBB Servicecenter Revenue” form

question: I have received a demand notice. This includes reminder fees of CHF 40. Is SBB allowed to charge this fee?
answer: Yes, the fees for SBB ancillary services are included in Tariff 610. According to SBB Tariff 610 section 23.200, the SBB Revenue Service Centre can charge a reminder fee of CHF 40. Furthermore, the invoice also makes it clear that a reminder fee of CHF 40 will be charged if the invoice is not paid.

question: What do I have to do to submit a request for the retraction of debt enforcement or the deletion of the entry in the debt collection register?
answer: Please complete the following form:                                             Link to the form requesting retraction of debt enforcement form / deletion of the entry in the debt collection register

question: May I deal with a bill over the telephone on behalf of my son/daughter (adult) or another third party?
answer: Yes, however data protection legislation means that we require your power of attorney.

question: Deadline extension.
answer: Have you received an invoice or demand notice with regard to a journey without a valid ticket? Would you like to extend the deadline? We offer a deadline extension of up to three months from the date of travel. If you would like a deadline extension of more than three months, a payment postponement of a maximum of six months may be granted. However, this is only possible if there is a guardianship or similar and a debt restructuring plan is submitted. Please note that no further travel without a valid ticket or with only a partly valid ticket is permitted within the payment period. Otherwise, the agreement will be void and the debts shall become due for payment immediately. Have you read the above terms and conditions and wish to extend your deadline? Then please complete the following form:                                             Go to the deadline extension form

question: I have received a bill, but I was not travelling by train. What now?
answer: Think about who might have been able to misuse your identity. Misuse of your identity is a criminal act. For this reason, you could make a complaint to the police. Please also contact us without delay:                                             Click here for the contact form

question: I have a completely different question regarding invoices or demand notices.
answer: On the“Rog FSBB Servicecenter Revenue” form, please select the category “Another reason”.                                             Link to the "RogF SBB Servicecenter Revenue” form

question: What surcharges are charged?
answer: Overview of the surcharges charged.                                                                                                                            Prices and product specifications subject to change.                                                                                                                      Surcharges                                                       Cost in CHF 1st occasion                                                       Cost in CHF 2nd occasion                                                       Cost in CHF 3rd and subsequent occasions                                                                                                                                                                                             Travel without a valid ticket (RogF)                                                                                                                                                          90.00                                                       130.00                                                       160.00                                                                                                                               Travel with only a partly valid ticket (RemitF)                                                                                                                                                          70.00                                                       110.00                                                       140.00                                                                                                                                   Prices and product specifications subject to change.                                                    Comments:  The fee is collected against a bill. The passenger and travel data are recorded on the train. In order to determine the surcharge, cases occurring in regional traffic (RV) and long-distance traffic (FV) are graded in the national SynServ database. In regional services, a flat-rate fare is billed in addition to the surcharges. In long-distance services, the actual fare is billed in addition to the surcharges. The surcharges are differentiated depending on whether the ticket is invalid or partially valid. Additionally, the surcharges increase in the 2nd and 3rd instances. The obligation to buy a ticket before travelling applies generally on transport company networks for direct services in Switzerland.

question: My case was at the debt collection office and I have paid my debt in full. Will this case now automatically be deleted from the register of judgements?
answer: No. Please submit a written request to have the entry deleted (retraction costs: CHF 50).                                             Go to Application for withdrawal of debt collection proceedings/deletion of an entry in the debt collection register

question: Why can I no longer buy tickets on the train?
answer: Market research has shown that service is of course important to customers – but that ticket sales is not at the top of their wish list. What is at the top of the list, however, is the purchase of class upgrades and changes of route. These services will therefore continue to be available on long-distance trains .

question: I’ve received a reminder before start of debt collection procedure. It includes an administrative fee of CHF 40. Is SBB allowed to charge this fee?
answer: Yes, because the SBB Revenue Service Centre is not a professional representative as per Art. 27 para. 2 of DEBA.

question: Are there exceptions where I do not have to pay a surcharge?
answer: Yes, the exceptions are as follows:  Forgotten your personal travelcard: you pay a fee of CHF 5 only. Families: children do pay an increased surcharge. Groups: the increased surcharge is charged once only.

question: I have received a bill but I believe that I have already paid it. Should I ignore the bill?
answer: No, on no account! First check to whom you have paid this debt. Did you perhaps pay the debt to a different debt collection agency (e.g. Zurich Transport Network, Bernmobil)? If not, please contact us.                                             Click here for the contact form

question: Can I use my Half Fare Travelcard PLUS for EasyRide?
answer: Yes. Personal EasyRide tickets can be paid for using Half Fare Travelcard PLUS credit.

question: What is the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS?
answer: The Half Fare Travelcard PLUS is a public transport offer in Switzerland. It is available in various credit sizes (“packages”) and consists of two components: the “customer deposit” (payment by the passenger) and the “bonus”, which the public transport sector grants according to defined rules. When you conclude a Half Fare Travelcard PLUS contract and pay the customer deposit, you will have a personal credit which is stored as the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS payment method in the digital sales channels for public transport. You can use this credit to pay for your personal single tickets in digital channels for a maximum of one year.                                             Go to the Half Fare Plus packages

question: How can I activate my Half Fare Travelcard PLUS as a payment method?
answer: At SBB.ch. Please verify your cell phone number in your customer account on “swisspass.chLink opens in new window.” (under customer data > correspondence) and enter the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS as a payment method on “SBB.ch” (under profile > payment method). In the SBB Mobile (from version 12.20.0) / Preview app. You can activate your Half Fare Travelcard PLUS in the app once you have successfully concluded the contract and deposited the corresponding credit. You can find the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS in the ‘Tickets & Travelcards’ tab and in the ‘Profile’ tab under your stored payment methods. Tap on the item to start the activation and follow the instructions.

question: What happens if I do not use up my Half Fare Travelcard PLUS credit within one year?
answer: The Half Fare Travelcard PLUS credit for the package you select will end once it has been fully used, one year after the first day of validity at the latest (one travelcard year) or after cancellation of the contract. Once the travelcard year has passed, the remaining (unused) amount of your customer deposit will be reimbursed to your bank/postal account. No offsetting is permitted for the new travelcard period of validity. The (remaining) bonus automatically expires after a year. There is no right to payment or credit for other/new offers for the remaining bonus.

question: Can I also buy tickets for other passengers using my Half Fare Travelcard PLUS?
answer: No. The Half Fare Travelcard PLUS is personal. As the holder of a Half Fare Travelcard PLUS, you are also the contracting party. Buying tickets for other passengers is not permitted. In the event of a breach of this rule or of misuse, we reserve the right to terminate the contract at any time.

question: Can I freely select the start date for the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS?
answer: The first day of validity of the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS is ‘today plus one day’ at the earliest. Example: On 10 January 2024, you can purchase a Half Fare Travelcard PLUS that is valid from 11 January 2024 or later, but not one that is valid from 10 January 2024. Apart from this, the first day of validity may be freely selected (flexible date), provided the advance sale period of two months is observed.

question: Can I “top up” my Half Fare Travelcard PLUS credit (before it expires)?
answer: Once you have completely used up your customer deposit and are in the bonus phase, you can make another deposit for a new package and then receive the bonus that comes with it. The payment can be made at a staffed public transport point of sale or online at SBB.ch. The validity period is again one year from the selected first day of validity. It is only possible to make a deposit for the same package size. If you would like a different package size, you will have to cancel your contract and conclude a new contract for the new package size.

question: How does the bonus work?
answer: When using the credit as a payment method, the tickets are first paid for from the customer deposit. Once the customer deposit amount has been used up, the bonus phase begins. From this point on, tickets are paid for using the bonus component.  The bonus phase ends either  once a year has passed (on the last day of validity of the package), once the credit has been fully used before the last day of validity of the package (customer deposit and bonus component) or following cancellation.                                              More about the advantages of the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS

question: Can I suspend or deposit my Half Fare Travelcard PLUS?
answer: No. The validity of the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS cannot be suspended and the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS cannot be deposited However, it is possible to cancel the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS contract.

question: How do I pay when renewing my Half Fare Travelcard PLUS?
answer: You can pay for the renewal of the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS at public transport points of sale and online at SBB.ch using the standard payment methods (exception: purchase by invoice not possible). The amount paid in corresponds to the customer deposit.

question: How do I buy tickets and Day Passes in the SBB Mobile app using the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS?
answer: Before you can buy tickets with the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS, you first need to activate the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS as a payment method. (See question ‘How do I activate my Half Fare Travelcard PLUS in the SBB Mobile app?’) You can then select it as a payment method from the first day of validity onwards and use it to buy personal single tickets and Day Passes.

question: How long is the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS contract valid?
answer: Any contracting party residing in Switzerland, Germany, France, Italy, Austria or the Principality of Liechtenstein concludes the contract for an unlimited period. All other contracting parties and minors receive the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS for a limited period of one year.

question: Can I withdraw from the contract?
answer: Upon conclusion of the contract, you are granted a 10-day right of withdrawal, but only as long as you have not yet used your credit to pay for tickets. If you conclude your contract but do not pay your customer deposit within 10 days, the contract will be cancelled.

question: Where can I purchase the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS?
answer: You can obtain the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS at all public transport points of sale and online at SBB.ch. Over time, the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS will also become available via the digital channels of other transport companies.

question: Which Half Fare Travelcard PLUS packages are available?
answer: The Half Fare Travelcard PLUS is offered with credit amounts of CHF 1,000, CHF 2,000 and CHF 3,000. There is a difference between the customer deposits and the bonus components for the following two customer groups: ‘Adults’ (aged 25 and older) and ‘Youth’ (aged at least 6 and under 25).                                             Go to the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS packages

question: How can I activate my Half Fare Travelcard PLUS as a payment method?
answer: Activation on SBB.ch.  If you haven’t already: carry out the two-factor authentication of your mobile phone number on swisspass.ch under ‘My account’ > ‘Customer data’ > ‘Correspondence’.  Log in to SBB.ch with your SwissPass login. Under ‘Profile’ select ‘Payment method’. Click on ‘Enter payment method’ for the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS. You will receive an SMS with an activation code. Enter this activation code in the corresponding field and complete the verification process by clicking ‘Confirm’. The Half Fare Travelcard PLUS has now been successfully activated and added as a payment method. The Half Fare Travelcard PLUS is now available to you on SBB.ch and on SBB Mobile / Preview. If you wish to use it, please ensure that you select the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS payment method each time you purchase a ticket.  Activation on SBB Mobile / Preview.   If you haven’t already: carry out the two-factor authentication of your mobile phone number on swisspass.ch under ‘My account’ > ‘Customer data’ > ‘Correspondence’.  Please ensure that you are using the latest version of the SBB Mobile / Preview app (version 12.20.0 onwards / App StoreLink opens in new window., Google PlayLink opens in new window.). Log in to SBB Mobile / Preview with your SwissPass login if you are not already logged in. Under ‘Profile’ select ‘Payment method’. Click on the ֲ‘Half Fare Travelcard PLUSֽ’ payment method. If the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS does not appear, log out of the app and log in again. Click on ‘Activate credit’. You will receive an SMS with an activation code. Enter this activation code in the corresponding field and complete the verification by clicking ‘Confirm’. The Half Fare Travelcard PLUS has now been successfully activated and added as a means of payment. The Half Fare Travelcard PLUS is now available on SBB Mobile / Preview and on SBB.ch. If you wish to use it, please ensure that you select the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS payment method each time you purchase a ticket.

question: How can I renew my Half Fare Travelcard PLUS?
answer: Unless cancelled, at the end of the current travelcard year, you will automatically receive another invoice for the same Half Fare Travelcard PLUS package as in your valid contract. You will receive a reminder of your cancellation options ahead of time. If you do not cancel on time, you must pay the invoice with the outstanding amount by the first day of validity for the new period.

question: Can I have my Half Fare Travelcard PLUS credit blocked?
answer: Yes, you can. You can arrange for your Half Fare Travelcard PLUS credit to be blocked as follows:   online via the swisspass.ch platform in person at a public transport point of sale by calling the SBB Contact Center on 0848 44 66 88 (CHF 0.08/min.), every day, 24/7, queues possible at times).

question: I would like to switch to another Half Fare Travelcard PLUS package. Is that possible?
answer: Yes, it is. However, you must cancel your existing Half Fare Travelcard PLUS package before switching.

question: I purchased a ticket with my Half Fare Travelcard PLUS. Can I get a refund for this ticket?
answer: Yes. Personal tickets paid for using your Half Fare Travelcard PLUS credit are refunded to the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS account. If the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS package is no longer active, the credit will be issued in the form of a voucher/coupon. There is no entitlement to a refund for tickets valid outside the validity period of the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS package (advance sale) that were paid for with the bonus portion.

question: Can I cancel the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS?
answer: You can cancel the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS contract by giving one month’s notice before the end of each travelcard month.  You can cancel:  online via the cancellation form in person at a public transport point of sale in writing by sending a letter to the SBB Contact Center, P.O. Box, 3900 Brig. by calling the SBB Contact Center on 0848 44 66 88 (CHF 0.08/min.), every day, 24/7, queues possible at times).  If you still have Half Fare Travelcard PLUS credit after one year or if you wish to cancel early, the remaining customer deposit (original customer deposit minus credit already used) will be returned to you. If you cancel during the year, a processing fee (deductible) will be applied. The bonus amount expires. It is only possible to pay out the remaining customer deposit to the contracting party’s personal bank/postal account. SBB reserves the right to cancel the contract at any time for justified reasons.                                             Go to the cancellation form

question: Where can I view my current Half Fare Travelcard PLUS balance?
answer: SBB.ch. After successfully logging in via SwissPass, you can view your balance at SBB.ch in your profile under ‘Payment method’. SBB Mobile (from version 12.20.0) / Preview app. You can view your current balance via the SBB Mobile app in the ‘Tickets & Travelcards’ tab and in the ‘Profile’ tab under your stored payment methods.

question: How can I pay for the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS?
answer: You can pay for the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS at public transport points of sale and online at SBB.ch using the standard payment methods (exception: purchase by invoice not possible). The amount paid in corresponds to the customer deposit.

question: How can I pay using Half Fare Travelcard PLUS credit?
answer: From the first day of validity and subject to successful payment, you can use your credit package to pay for personal tickets which you purchase independently via digital channels (prepaid and postpaid). Before you can use the credit, you must activate it on the desired digital sales channels on the swisspass.ch platform using two-factor authentication.

question: What bonus/advantage do I get with the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS?
answer: As the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS consists of a “customer deposit” paid in by you and a bonus component, you travel for free once you have used up your customer deposit.

question: Is a Half Fare Travelcard included in the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS?
answer: No. The Half Fare Travelcard is not a component of the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS and must be purchased separately.

question: Do I need a Half Fare Travelcard in order to purchase a Half Fare Travelcard PLUS?
answer: No. You are not required to hold a Half Fare Travelcard to benefit from the Half Fare Travelcard PLUS offer. However, from a cost perspective, using a Half Fare Travelcard PLUS without a Half Fare Travelcard is not recommended.

question: Which tickets can I buy with my Half Fare Travelcard PLUS?
answer: The Half Fare Travelcard PLUS can be used for personal individual tickets and day passes of National Direct Service and the fare networks (including ‘Sparwelt’). It works for both 1st and 2nd class. The Half Fare Travelcard PLUS cannot be combined with other discount models (excluding ‘Sparwelt’).  Tickets via EasyRide. (Supersaver) tickets. (Saver) Day Passes. (Supersaver) class upgrade. Tickets, Day Passes for Dogs and Bike Day Passes. Reservations.  The following are excluded:  Travelcards. Multiple-journey tickets. Municipal (Saver) Day Passes. the promotional range (from partners such as Coop, Interdiscount, Lidl, etc.). the Junior Travelcard. the Children’s Co-Travelcard. international tickets and reservations including the regions on either side of the border.

question: When I enter the security code which has been sent to me, I get an error message.
answer: We advise you to delete your browser history and request another password change. Copy the security code sent by e-mail (without spaces).

question: Do I always need to log out of the SBB Mobile / Preview app?
answer: No, you can stay logged into the app.

question: Where can I log in?
answer: On SBB.ch: Click on Sign in at the top right of the page. In the SBB Mobile / Preview app: Click on the three bars in the top left of the app and select Login. On swisspass.ch: Click on the Sign in button.

question: I already have a SwissPass login and would like to link my customer number to it subsequently.
answer: Sign in with your login on swisspass.ch. On the homepage, you will be asked to enter your customer number, postal code and your date of birth. Then click on Link now. Your customer number is the number with the format 000-000-000-0 on your SwissPass card.                                             Go to sign in on swisspass.ch                         Link opens in new window.

question: What do I need a login / to sign in for?
answer: You need a login / to sign in to access your account. SBB.ch When you sign into SBB.ch, you can manage your personal details such as address, access details, payment methods, other people travelling with you and notifications. You also have access to all purchases you have previously made. SBB Mobile app. When you sign into the SBB Mobile app, you can manage your personal details such as your address, access details, payment methods, other people travelling with you and notifications. You also have access to the travelcards on your SwissPass. swisspass.ch. When you sign in on swisspass.chLink opens in new window., you can see not only your personal details and the travelcards on your SwissPass but also other partner offers and services. You can also manage your data conveniently online (change address, upload photo for SwissPass, store and cancel travelcard).

question: What is the difference between the contracting party and the person travelling?
answer: In most cases, the contracting party and the person travelling are the same person because you buy a travelcard (or a ticket) for yourself. However, if you purchase a travelcard (or a ticket) for another person (e.g. a child, your grandfather or anyone else), you are then the contracting party and the other person is the person travelling. This has an impact on what contracting partners and persons travelling see in their respective SwissPass customer accounts. question: I have a new e-mail address, but have forgotten the password for the address I previously used.
answer: Click on the “Forgotten your password?” link when logging in or click directly on the link here. Enter your registered e-mail address and click on “Request password change”. We will send a security code to your registered e-mail address. If you cannot find an e-mail in your inbox, please check your spam or junk folders. Enter the security code you received and a new password of your choice and then click on “Save new password”. Then you can log in with the old e-mail address and the new password on swisspass.ch. You can then change your login e-mail and password under Login details. Warning: if you change your password, you will have to sign in again for all the online services and apps that work using the SwissPass login. You will have to reactivate the “Stay signed in” function if you want to use it.                                             Change your password here                         Link opens in new window.

question: What is the difference between the customer account on swisspass.ch and the profile on SBB.ch?
answer: Your customer account on swisspass.ch is the basis for a public transport travelcard such as the Half Fare Travelcard or GA Travelcard. If you buy tickets on SBB.ch or in the SBB Mobile / SBB Preview app, you have the option of logging in with the same access details as for swisspass.ch. This means you have only one login for your public transport services. On SBB.ch, this account is called ‘Profile’. Since you can also buy travelcards (and tickets) for other people, we distinguish between the contracting party and the person travelling. In the SwissPass customer account, you will only be able to find an invoice for your travelcard if you are also the contracting party. For example, if you purchased a GA Travelcard for your son, you will be the contracting party and your son will be the passenger. As the passenger, your son will not be able to find any invoice information regarding the GA Travelcard in his SwissPass customer account. However, you will see this information as you are the contracting party. question: I receive an error message when linking my customer number.
answer: Please check your name, address and telephone number etc. as stored in your customer account on swisspass.ch. These details must be identical to those on your SwissPass card (e.g. no nicknames, check double names etc.). If you still receive the error message, get in touch with us using the contact form. Let us know your customer number and send us a screenshot of the page with the error message.                                             Go to the SwissPass contact form                         Link opens in new window.

question: Where can I change my e-mail address for correspondence on swisspass.ch?
answer: Sign in with your e-mail address and your personal password on swisspass.chLink opens in new window.. Then click on your initials in the top right and select Customer data. Under Correspondence, enter the new e-mail address you would like to use.

question: I would like to delete my SwissPass account.
answer: To delete your SwissPass account, proceed as follows:  Sign into swisspass.ch with your SwissPass login. Click on your initials at the top right. Click on Login details. Select "Delete SwissPass customer account" Click on Delete irrevocably.  If you have forgotten your password, you can ask for a new one using your e-mail address. After logging in, proceed as described above. Go to login on swisspass.chLink opens in new window. Reset passwordLink opens in new window.

question: I’ve got a SwissPass card but don’t yet have a SwissPass login. What is that and what do I need to do?
answer: Your SwissPass login consists of your e-mail address (user name) and the password that you select at the time of initial registration. You can use it to log into your customer account on swisspass.ch.  You can also use the SwissPass login to log into SBB.ch or the SBB Mobile app. Your personal details will then be pre-entered and you’ll save time when purchasing online and also when completing forms. How registration works:  Go to swisspass.ch Click on ‘Register’. Select ‘I have a public transport travel pass’. Enter the customer number in the format 000-000-000-0. This number can be found at the bottom of the SwissPass card on the side with your photo. Enter your postcode and your date of birth. Proceed according to the instructions.

question: Do I need a SwissPass card to have a login?
answer: No, you do not need a SwissPass card to have a login. You can complete an initial registration on swisspass.ch, even while making your purchase online. On subsequent occasions, you can just sign in.                                             Go to registration on swisspass.ch                         Link opens in new window.

question: Where can I amend my e-mail address on swisspass.ch?
answer: Sign in with your e-mail address and your personal password on swisspass.chLink opens in new window.. Then click on your initials at the top right and select Login details. Under Change login e-mail, enter the new e-mail address you want to use.

question: What could be the reason why I see a message telling me that my e-mail address is invalid?
answer: Umlauts and special characters cannot be used in e-mail addresses.

question: Why has my access to my SwissPass account been blocked and how can I unblock it?
answer: Your SwissPass account has been blocked because there have been too many failed attempts to sign in. Request a new password to unblock the account.                                              Request new password                         Link opens in new window.

question: What information can I find in my SwissPass customer account?
answer: You can find the following information in your SwissPass customer account.

question: What are the advantages of a login / signing in?
answer: Advantages of a log in / signing in on SBB.ch.  Your details are already stored and do not have to be entered the next time you make an online purchase. You can view your previous purchases and orders at any time and show or print out any tickets you bought online. You can save payment methods easily and set them as defaults. You can have tickets bought for travel in Switzerland refunded before the start of validity (except supersaver tickets, Saver Day Passes and special offers). If the connection breaks down during the purchase you can check under Orders whether a ticket was actually purchased on not. You can also use your login for the SBB Mobile app and buy tickets there too.  Advantages of a login for / signing into the SBB Mobile app:  Your details are already stored and do not have to be entered the next time you make an online purchase. You can save payment methods easily and set them as defaults. You can see the travelcards you hold on your SwissPass. You can also use your login for SBB.ch to buy tickets there and you can view your previous purchases and orders at any time. You can also display any tickets bought online or by mobile again or print them out.  Benefits of a login / signing in on swisspass.ch: A login on swisspass.chLink opens in new window. lets you view the public transport and partner passes on your SwissPass. And you can activate the days of your Leisure Travelcard you wish to use.

question: Where can I find the SBB customer number?
answer: Your customer number is the number with the format 000-000-000-0 on your SwissPass card. This number can be found at the bottom of the SwissPass card on the side with your photo.

question: Do I have to sign / log in to buy a ticket?
answer: No, to buy tickets you do not need to log in / sign in. However, we recommend that you have a login. It offers you numerous benefits, as you do not need to enter your personal details and payment method every time. If you wish to purchase a Half Fare Travelcard or a GA Travelcard online or book a group trip, you need a login. To do so, complete an initial registration.

question: What may be the reason why I have to sign in every time I use the app?
answer: Some data cannot be encrypted securely on older Android devices. Therefore, we do send not these smartphones sensitive data to store. This affects smartphones running Android 4.x. If you are using older devices, you will need to sign in with your user name and password whenever you buy tickets.

question: Why do I see a blank page / why am I not forwarded to the right page after logging in?
answer: Please delete your browser history (including cookies) and log in again. Check whether your browser needs an update. Alternatively, you could use another browser.

question: I cannot register on swisspass.ch. I have not received a verification code.
answer: That may be because a login has already been created for this e-mail address. If you no longer know if you already have a SwissPass account with this e-mail address, you can request a new password with your e-mail address on swisspass.ch.                                             Request new password                         Link opens in new window.                                       If you would like to make an initial registration for another person on swisspass.chLink opens in new window., you need to use another e-mail address.

question: Can I get the app to show a ticket I bought online?
answer: You can use the SBB Mobile app to show almost all tickets bought online. The inverse is also possible: you can also show and print tickets bought on SBB Mobile on SBB.ch. The only requirement is that tickets were bought using the same SwissPass login.

question: I already have a SwissPass account. Can I create a SwissPass account for another person using my e-mail address?
answer: No. An e-mail address can only be used once for data security reasons. We therefore ask you to use a different e-mail address if you wish to register another person.

question: Can I save a payment method on swisspass.ch?
answer: You cannot store any payment method on swisspass.ch. In your customer account on swisspass.ch, you can choose whether you wish to receive GA Travelcard / Half Fare Travelcard invoices by post or e-mail. You can also enter an IBAN so that we can reimburse any credit from a GA Travelcard / Half Fare Travelcard contract.

question: I have changed my name. My new name is already on my official ID, but the old one is still on my SwissPass. Is my SwissPass still valid despite the change of name?
answer: Yes, your SwissPass remains valid. However, if you frequently buy tickets in the SBB Mobile app or via SBB.ch, we recommend that you order a replacement card. This makes it easier to check your ticket on the train. If you change your name yourself in your customer account on swisspass.ch (see question ”How do I change my name?”), the replacement card is free of charge. If you apply for a name change at an SBB Travel Centre, the replacement card costs CHF 30.                                             Change your name yourself free of charge                         Link opens in new window.

question: How do I change my name?
answer: There are two ways that you can change your name.  Independent customisation in the customer account (free of charge): Sign in to your customer account at swisspass.ch. Select “Customer data” in the top right under your initials. Then, under “Personal details”, click on “Change” and “Start identity check”. You will automatically receive a SwissPass card with your new name. The card is free of charge and will be sent to you by post. Go to your customer dataLink opens in new window. At a public transport point of sale (subject to charge): Have your name changed at a Travel Centre. Please bring a valid official ID with you. The SwissPass replacement card costs CHF 30 and will be sent to you by post.

question: Skis in ski bag or other type of bag.
answer: It is very useful for us if both the skis and the ski bag or other bag are recorded separately (in the same loss report).

question: Keys.
answer: The best way you can help us is by giving us the key numbers. Often there are several copies of the same key, so it will be possible to enter the number in the loss report. This is especially helpful with registered house keys and building keys. By comparing the numbers, we can more easily assign your key(s). The exact description of a possible tag is also useful.

question: Mobile phones and other electronic items such as laptops,tablets and cameras.
answer: By providing the SIM card number or the IMEI number, we can identify / allocate your mobile phone without any problems. The SIM card number and, if necessary, the IMEI number can be obtained from your telephone provider / vendor. The IMEI number can also be found on the original box. The description of the background picture and the language setting will also help us to find your mobile.

question: Wallet.
answer: All cards can be listed in the description. It is not necessary to record the cards individually as a separate category.

question: Do you have a photo of the lost item?
answer: This function is not currently available, but will be soon.

question: How much is the delivery fee?
answer: Shipping of the recovered item within Switzerland = CHF 25 per item (including reclaim fee) Shipping of the recovered item abroad = CHF 50 per item (including reclaim fee) + shipping costs

question: How much is the reclaim fee?
answer: With a GA travelcard = CHF 5 per item With a Half-Fare Travelcard = CHF 10 per item With a personal annual point-to-point travelcard or regional travelcard = CHF 10 per item With none of the above = CHF 20 per item Change to a different collection station following notification = CHF 10 per item

question: How do I submit a loss report?
answer: You can find detailed instructions on how to submit a loss report here:                                             Go to the loss report guidance

question: What happens with unclaimed items?
answer: Once the period required by law has expired, unclaimed items are forwarded to the fundsachenverkauf.ch GmbH company for sale by public auction. Information on the sale of lost property and upcoming auctions can be found at fundsachenverkauf.chLink opens in new window..

answer: If you lose something while travelling with one of the following transport companies, all you need to do is enter a loss report on SBB.ch.  Aare Seeland mobil (ASM)Link opens in new window. Baselland Transport AG (BLT)Link opens in new window. Basler Verkehrs-Betriebe (BVB)Link opens in new window. Bergbahn Lauterbrunnen–Mürren AG (BLM)Link opens in new window. Berner Oberland Bahnen AG (BOB)Link opens in new window. BLS AGLink opens in new window. BUS Ostschweiz AG (BOS) (WilMobil, RTB and BUS Sarganserland-Werdenberg)Link opens in new window. Chemin de fer Montreux Oberland bernois SA (MOB)Link opens in new window. Firstbahn AGLink opens in new window. Harderbahn AGLink opens in new window. Jungfraubahn AG (JB)Link opens in new window.
